cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
After replacing the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Drive the vehicle for at least 1 minute after the engine is warmed up until M.U.T.-III data list item No. 22: NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release status has changed to "ON."
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P06EB set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
The check is end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P2002 DPF flow resistance below limit
Code No. P2002: DPF Flow Resistance Below Limit
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The DCU measures the amount of PM accumulated in the exhaust muffler PM sensor within a certain period.
  • When the amount of PM exceeds the specified value, the DCU determines that the DPF is deteriorated or damaged and sets diagnosis code No. P2002.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Engine is running.
  • Exhaust muffler PM sensor is operating.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the PM amount exceeds a predetermined value.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed catalytic converter assembly (DPF is deteriorated or damaged)
  • Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether any diagnosis code related to the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1, No. 2) is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Replace the catalytic converter assembly (DPF) (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P202A Reductant Tank Heater Control Circuit/Ope
Code No. P202A: Urea Tank Heater Control Circuit Open
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The voltage is applied from the DCU connector terminal THS to the urea pump module connector terminal via the power transistor in the DCU.
  • The voltage is earthed to the body earth from the urea pump module connector heater earth terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P202A when there is an open circuit in the urea tank heater circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • An open circuit in the urea tank heater circuit is detected for 2 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit in urea tank heater circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank heater)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check urea tank heater itself
Urea tank heater check (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank heater) (Refer to )
 
STEP 2. Check harness between urea pump module connector heater earth terminal and body earth
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal THS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P202A set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P202B Reductant Tank Heater Control Circuit Low
Code No. P202B: Urea Tank Heater Control Circuit Low
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The voltage is applied from the DCU connector terminal THS to the urea pump module connector terminal via the power transistor in the DCU.
  • The voltage is earthed to the body earth from the urea pump module connector heater earth terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P202B when the urea tank heater circuit is short to earth.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A short to earth in the urea tank heater circuit is detected for 2 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Short circuit in urea tank heater circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Open circuit in DCU power supply circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank heater)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check urea tank heater itself
Urea tank heater check (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank heater) (Refer to )
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal BAT1 and urea SCR relay connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal THS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P202B set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P202C Reductant Tank Heater Control Circuit High
Code No. P202C: Urea Tank Heater Control Circuit High
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The voltage is applied from the DCU connector terminal THS to the urea pump module connector terminal via the power transistor in the DCU.
  • The voltage is earthed to the body earth from the urea pump module connector heater earth terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P202C when the urea tank heater circuit is short to power supply.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A short to power supply in the urea tank heater circuit is detected for 2 seconds or more.
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • When the urea tank heater is operating. (When the urea tank temperature is -7°C or less, the DCU energises the urea tank heater and the urea line tube heater).
Judgement Criterion
  • An input voltage abnormality in the urea tank heater is detected for 2 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit in urea tank heater circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank heater)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check urea tank heater itself
Urea tank heater check (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank heater) (Refer to )
 
STEP 2. Check harness between urea pump module connector heater earth terminal and body earth
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal THS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for short to power supply and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire. Then change AdBlue™.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P202C set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ). Then change AdBlue™.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P202E Reductant Injection Valve Circuit Range/Performance Bank1 Unit1
Code No. P202E: Urea Injector Circuit Range/Performance
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the urea injector assembly from the DCU connector terminal INJ+.
  • The DCU connector terminal INJ- makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the urea injector assembly.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P202E when it detects that the temperature of the urea injector assembly drive circuit is high.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • High temperature abnormality of the urea injector assembly circuit is detected for 2 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Short circuit in urea injector assembly circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea injector assembly
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Measurement of urea injector assembly resistance
Measurement of urea injector assembly resistance (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal INJ+ and urea injector assembly connector terminal, and between DCU connector terminal INJ- and urea injector assembly connector terminal
Check power supply line and earth line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P202E set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P203A Reductant Level Sensor Circuit
Code No. P203A: Urea Tank Level Sensor Circuit
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power is applied to the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor power supply terminal of urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal TLSS and earthed to the DCU connector terminal TLSE from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor earth terminal of urea pump module connector.
  • The PWM signal of sensor is inputted to the DCU connector terminal TLS from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor output terminal of urea pump module connector.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P203A when there is an abnormality in the urea tank level sensor signal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • The PWM signal of the urea level is stuck high for 2.5 seconds or more.
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • The PWM signal of the urea level is stuck low for 2.5 seconds or more.
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • The PWM signal of the urea tank level which differs from the specified pulse period is received for 3 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit and short to earth in urea tank level sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank level sensor)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at urea pump module connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DCU TLSS line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DUC connector terminal TLSE and urea pump module connector terminal
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal TLS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check sensor line for open circuit, short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between DCU connector terminal TLSS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P203A set?
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank level sensor) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P203A set?
Replace the DCU.
The check is end.
 
STEP 7. Check harness between DCU connector terminal TLSS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P203A set?
Replace the DCU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P203C Reductant Level Sensor Circuit Low
Code No. P0203C: Urea Tank Level Sensor Circuit Low
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power is applied to the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor power supply terminal of urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal TLSS and earthed to the DCU connector terminal TLSE from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor earth terminal of urea pump module connector.
  • The PWM signal of sensor is inputted to the DCU connector terminal TLS from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor output terminal of urea pump module connector.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P203C when a signal indicating urea tank level sensor abnormality (minimum abnormality) is received.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • An open circuit/short to earth signal of the urea tank level sensor is received from the urea tank level sensor for 2 seconds or more.
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result pulse signal indicating minimum abnormality is received from the urea tank level sensor 3 times or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit in urea tank level sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank level sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at urea pump module connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DCU TLSS line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DUC connector terminal TLSE and urea pump module connector terminal
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal TLS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check sensor line for open circuit, short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between DCU connector terminal TLSS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank level sensor) (Refer to ), and then check whether the urea tank level is displayed correctly.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P203D Reductant Level Sensor Circuit High
Code No. P203D: Urea Tank Level Sensor Circuit High
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power is applied to the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor power supply terminal of urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal TLSS and earthed to the DCU connector terminal TLSE from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor earth terminal of urea pump module connector.
  • The PWM signal of sensor is inputted to the DCU connector terminal TLS from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor output terminal of urea pump module connector.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P203D when a signal indicating urea tank level sensor abnormality (maximum abnormality) is received.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A short to power supply signal of the urea tank level sensor is received from the urea tank level sensor for 2 seconds or more.
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result pulse signal indicating maximum abnormality is received from the urea tank level sensor 3 times or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit in urea tank level sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank level sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at urea pump module connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DCU TLSS line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DUC connector terminal TLSE and urea pump module connector terminal
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal TLS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check sensor line for open circuit, short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between DCU connector terminal TLSS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank level sensor) (Refer to ), and then check whether the urea tank level is displayed correctly.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P203E Reductant Level Sensor Circuit Intermittent/Erratic
Code No. P203E: Urea Tank Level Sensor Circuit Intermittent/Erratic
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power is applied to the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor power supply terminal of urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal TLSS and earthed to the DCU connector terminal TLSE from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor earth terminal of urea pump module connector.
  • The PWM signal of sensor is inputted to the DCU connector terminal TLS from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor output terminal of urea pump module connector.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P203E when a pulse signal indicating "AdBlue™ not detected" is received from the urea tank level sensor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position, and then drive the vehicle for at least 2.5 km.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • Urea tank temperature is -9°C or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result pulse signal indicating that the AdBlue™ is not detected is received from the urea tank level sensor for 5 times or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank level sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. AdBlue™ replenishment check
Is AdBlue™ refilled?
Go to Step 2.
Refill AdBlue™ (Refer to ).
 
STEP 2. Check urea tank assembly itself
Check the urea tank assembly for AdBlue™ leaks due to damage or deformation.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the urea tank assembly (Refer to ).
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at urea pump module connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DCU TLSS line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between DUC connector terminal TLSE and urea pump module connector terminal
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between DCU connector terminal TLS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check sensor line for open circuit, short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between DCU connector terminal TLSS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Drive the vehicle for 2.5 km or more.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P203E set?
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank level sensor) (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P2047 Reductant Injection Valve Circuit/Open Bank 1 Unit 1
Code No. P2047: Urea Injector Circuit Open,
Code No. P2048: Urea Injector Circuit Low,
Code No. P2049: Urea Injector Circuit High
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the urea injector assembly from the DCU connector terminal INJ+.
  • The DCU connector terminal INJ- makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the urea injector assembly.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P2047, P2048 or P2049 when it detects an open circuit, short to earth or short to power supply in the urea injector assembly circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT <P2047>
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • An open circuit in the urea injector assembly circuit is detected for 5 seconds or more.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT <P2048>
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the engine was started.
Judgement Criterion
  • A short to earth in the urea injector assembly (High side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
  • A short to earth in the urea injector assembly circuit (Low side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT <P2049>
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A short to power supply in the urea injector assembly circuit (High side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
  • A short to power supply in the urea injector assembly circuit (Low side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit, short to earth and short to power supply in urea injector assembly circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed urea injector assembly
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Measurement of urea injector assembly resistance
Measurement of urea injector assembly resistance (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal INJ+ and urea injector assembly connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal INJ- and urea injector assembly connector terminal
Check earth line for open circuit, short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2047, P2048 or P2049 set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P205B Reductant Tank Temperature Sensor Circuit Range/Performance
Code No. P205B: Urea Tank Temperature Sensor Circuit Range/Performance
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power is applied to the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor power supply terminal of urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal TLSS and earthed to the DCU connector terminal TLSE from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor earth terminal of urea pump module connector.
  • The PWM signal of sensor is inputted to the DCU connector terminal TLS from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor output terminal of urea pump module connector.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P205B when it detects a characteristic abnormality of the urea tank temperature sensor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • The difference between the DPF temperature (No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor) and the engine coolant temperature is 8°C or less.
  • The difference between the DPF temperature (No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor) and the ambient temperature is 8°C or less.
  • The difference between the engine coolant temperature and the ambient temperature is 8°C or less.
  • 9 hours or more have passed since the last time the ignition switch was turned "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The difference between the urea tank temperature and the ambient temperature remains 30°C or more for at least 5 seconds.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed combination meter system (Failed ambient temperature sensor)
  • Failed diesel fuel system (Failed engine coolant temperature sensor or No. 3 exhaust temperature sensor)
  • Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank temperature sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the ambient temperature displayed on the combination meter
Check that the ambient temperature is correctly displayed on the combination meter.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Perform troubleshooting of the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Symptom Procedure 13: Ambient Temperature Sensor Dose Not Work ).
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the temperature sensor related diagnosis code (engine coolant temperature sensor or No. 3 exhaust temperature sensor) is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Codes ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code other than No. P205B set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 7: Urea tank temperature
OK: Indicates almost the same temperature as the surrounding temperature of the urea tank.
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank temperature sensor) (Refer to )
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P205C Reductant Tank Temperature Sensor Circuit Low
Code No. P205C: Urea Tank Temperature Sensor Circuit Low
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power is applied to the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor power supply terminal of urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal TLSS and earthed to the DCU connector terminal TLSE from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor earth terminal of urea pump module connector.
  • The PWM signal of sensor is inputted to the DCU connector terminal TLS from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor output terminal of urea pump module connector.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P205C when it receives an abnormal signal of the urea tank temperature sensor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result pulse signal indicating minimum abnormality is received from the urea tank temperature sensor 3 times or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank temperature sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank temperature sensor) (Refer to )
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P205D Reductant Tank Temperature Sensor Circuit High
Code No. P205D: Urea Tank Temperature Sensor Circuit High
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power is applied to the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor power supply terminal of urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal TLSS and earthed to the DCU connector terminal TLSE from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor earth terminal of urea pump module connector.
  • The PWM signal of sensor is inputted to the DCU connector terminal TLS from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor output terminal of urea pump module connector.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P205D when it receives an abnormal signal of the urea tank temperature sensor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result pulse signal indicating maximum abnormality is received from the urea tank temperature sensor 3 times or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank temperature sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank temperature sensor) (Refer to )
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P205E Reductant Tank Temperature Sensor Circuit Intermittent/Erratic
Code No. P205E: Urea Tank Temperature Sensor Circuit Intermittent/Erratic
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power is applied to the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor power supply terminal of urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal TLSS and earthed to the DCU connector terminal TLSE from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor earth terminal of urea pump module connector.
  • The PWM signal of sensor is inputted to the DCU connector terminal TLS from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor output terminal of urea pump module connector.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P205E when it detects a characteristic abnormality of the urea tank temperature sensor.
noteWhen urea tank temperature is less than -11°C, AdBlue™ will be frozen. When AdBlue™ in tank isn't frozen, urea tank level can be detected.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • The remaining amount in the urea tank is 15% or more (tank level can be detected).
Judgement Criterion
  • The urea tank temperature remains -14.4°C or less for at least 8 seconds.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank temperature sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank temperature sensor) (Refer to )
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P208A Reductant Pump "A" Control Circuit/Open
Code No. P208A: Supply Pump Control Circuit/Open,
Code No. P208C: Supply Pump Control Circuit Low,
Code No. P208D: Supply Pump Control Circuit High
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal MCPS.
  • The DCU connector terminal MCPD makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the urea pump (supply pump).
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P208A, P208C or P208D when it detects a drive abnormality in the supply pump.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT <P208A>
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the engine was started.
Judgement Criterion
  • An open circuit in the supply pump circuit is detected for 2 seconds or more.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Execute item No. 5 "Supply pump" on the M.U.T.-III actuator test.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT <P208C>
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A short to earth in the supply pump circuit (Low side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
or
  • A short to earth in the supply pump circuit (High side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Execute item No. 5 "Supply pump" on the M.U.T.-III actuator test.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT <P208D>
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • A short to power supply in the supply pump circuit (Low side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
or
  • A short to power supply in the supply pump circuit (High side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Execute item No. 5 "Supply pump" on the M.U.T.-III actuator test.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit, short to earth and short to power supply in supply pump circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea pump (integrated with supply pump)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Measurement of urea pump resistance
Measurement of urea pump (supply pump) resistance (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea pump (integrated with supply pump) (Refer to )
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal MCPS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal MCPD and urea pump module connector terminal
Check earth line for open circuit, short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Execute item No. 5 "Supply pump" on the M.U.T.-III actuator test.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P208A, P208C or P208D set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P208B Reductant Pump "A" Control Performance/Stuck Off
Code No. P208B: Supply Pump Control Performance/Stuck Off
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal MCPS.
  • The DCU connector terminal MCPD makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the urea pump (supply pump).
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P208B when it detects a drive abnormality in the supply pump.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • Urea pressure is 5,000 hPa or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • An abnormality in the drive waveform of the supply pump is detected approximately 5 minutes or more.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Warm up the engine until M.U.T.-III data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is changed to "ON", then let the engine idle for 5 minutes or more without turning the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • High temperature abnormality of the supply pump drive circuit is detected for 2 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit, short to earth and short to power supply in supply pump circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea pump (integrated with supply pump)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Measurement of urea pump resistance
Measurement of urea pump (supply pump) resistance (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea pump (with supply pump) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal MCPS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to MCPD line, Short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal MCPD and urea pump module connector terminal
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until M.U.T.-III data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is changed to "ON", then let the engine idle for 5 minutes or more without turning the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P208B set?
Replace the urea pump (integrated with supply pump) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until M.U.T.-III data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is changed to "ON", then let the engine idle for 5 minutes or more without turning the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P208B set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Check is end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P208E Reductant Injection Valve Stuck Closed Bank 1 Unit 1
Code No. P208E: Urea Injector Stuck Closed
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the urea injector assembly from the DCU connector terminal INJ+.
  • The DCU connector terminal INJ- makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the urea injector assembly.
 
 
FUNCTION
Diagnosis code No. P208E is set when the urea injector assembly is detected to be stuck closed.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • Urea pressure is 5,000 hPa or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the AdBlue™ is injected, a seizure of the urea injector assembly is detected approximately 10 minutes or more.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Warm up the engine until data list item No. 3: SCR catalyst temperature rises to 150°C or more, and then drive the vehicle for 10 minutes or more without turning the ignition switch "LOCK" (OFF) position.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit and short to earth in urea injector circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed urea injector assembly
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check harness between DCU connector terminal INJ+ and urea injector assembly connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal INJ- and urea injector assembly connector terminal
Check earth line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Urea injector assembly condition check
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to check the spray state of the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is ON, and then drive the vehicle for 10 minutes or more without turning the ignition switch "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P208E set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P209F Reductant Tank Heater Control Circuit Performance
Code No. P209F: Urea Tank Heater Control Circuit Performance
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The voltage is applied from the DCU connector terminal THS to the urea pump module connector terminal via the power transistor in the DCU.
  • The voltage is earthed to the body earth from the urea pump module connector heater earth terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P209F when it detects a characteristic abnormality of the urea tank heater.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • 5 minutes or more have passed since the last time the ignition switch was turned "LOCK" (OFF) position.
  • When the urea tank heater is operating. (When the urea tank temperature is -7°C or less, the DCU energises the urea tank heater and the urea feed tube heater).
Judgement Criterion
  • The conductance of the urea tank heater is low.
or
  • The conductance of the urea tank heater is high.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit in urea tank heater circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank heater)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P202A, P202B or P202C set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between urea pump module connector heater earth terminal and body earth
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal THS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and wait at least 5 seconds.
(4) Operate the urea tank heater (When the urea tank temperature is -7°C or less, the DCU energises the urea tank heater).
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P209F set?
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank heater) (Refer to )
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P20B9 Reductant Heater Control Circuit/Open
Code No. P20B9: Urea Feed Tube Heater Control Circuit Open
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The voltage is applied from the DCU connector terminal LHS to the urea heater tube connector terminal via the power transistor in the DCU.
  • The voltage is earthed to the body earth from the urea heater tube connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P20B9 when there is an open circuit in the urea line tube heater circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • An open circuit in the urea line tube heater circuit is detected for 2 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit in urea line tube heater circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea line tube (integrated with urea line tube heater)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check urea line tube heater itself
Urea line tube heater check (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea line tube (integrated with urea line tube heater) (Refer to )
 
STEP 2. Check harness between urea heater tube connector heater earth terminal and body earth
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal LHS and urea heater tube connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20B9 set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P20BA Reductant Heater Control Circuit Performance
Code No. P20BA: Urea Feed Tube Heater Control Circuit Performance
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The voltage is applied from the DCU connector terminal LHS to the urea heater tube connector terminal via the power transistor in the DCU.
  • The voltage is earthed to the body earth from the urea heater tube connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P20BA when it detects a characteristic abnormality of the urea line tube heater.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • 5 minutes or more have passed since the last time the ignition switch was turned "LOCK" (OFF) position.
  • When the urea line tube heater is operating (When the urea tank temperature is -7°C or less, the DCU energises the urea tank heater and the urea line tube heater).
Judgement Criterion
  • The conductance of the urea line tube heater is low.
or
  • The conductance of the urea line tube heater is high.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit in urea line tube heater circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea line tube (integrated with urea line tube heater)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20B9, P20BB or P20BC set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between urea heater tube connector heater earth terminal and body earth
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal LHS and urea heater tube connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and wait at least 5 seconds.
(4) Operate the urea tank heater (When the urea tank temperature is -7°C or less, the DCU energises the urea tank heater).
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20BA set?
Replace the urea line tube (integrated with urea line tube heater) (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P20BB Reductant Heater Control Circuit Low
Code No. P20BB: Urea Feed Tube Heater Control Circuit Low
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The voltage is applied from the DCU connector terminal LHS to the urea heater tube connector terminal via the power transistor in the DCU.
  • The voltage is earthed to the body earth from the urea heater tube connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P20BB when the urea line tube heater circuit is short to earth.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A short to earth in the urea line tube heater circuit is detected for 2 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Short circuit in urea line tube heater circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Open circuit in DCU power supply circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea line tube (integrated with urea line tube heater)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check urea line tube heater itself
Urea line tube heater check (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea line tube (integrated with urea line tube heater) (Refer to )
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal BAT2 and urea SCR relay connector
Check power supply line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal LHS and urea heater tube connector terminal
Check power supply line for short to earth.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20BB set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P20BC Reductant Heater Control Circuit High
Code No. P20BC: Urea Feed Tube Heater Control Circuit High
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The voltage is applied from the DCU connector terminal LHS to the urea heater tube connector terminal via the power transistor in the DCU.
  • The voltage is earthed to the body earth from the urea heater tube connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P20BC when the urea line tube heater circuit is short to power supply.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A short to power supply in the urea line tube heater circuit is detected for 2 seconds or more.
Check Conditions
  • When the urea line tube heater is commanded ON.
Judgement Criterion
  • An input voltage abnormality in the urea line tube heater is detected for 2 seconds or more.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Warm up the engine until data list item No. 3: SCR catalyst temperature rises to 150°C or more, and then let the engine idle for approximately 30 minutes without turning the ignition switch "LOCK" (OFF) position.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit in urea line tube heater circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea line tube (integrated with urea line tube heater)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check urea line tube heater itself
Urea line tube heater check (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea line tube (integrated with urea line tube heater) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 2. Check harness between urea heater tube connector heater earth terminal and body earth
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal LHS and urea heater tube connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire. Then replace the urea line tube (integrated with urea line tube heater) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20BC set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ). Then replace the urea line tube (integrated with urea line tube heater) (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P20E8 Reductant Pressure Too Low
Code No. P20E8: Urea Pressure Too Low
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
Diagnosis code No. P20E8 is set when low pressure abnormality of the urea injector assembly is detected after the urea pump (supply pump) is activated.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • After the urea pump (supply pump) is activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • The number of times of driving the urea pump (supply pump) is too many and the data list item No. 6: SCR sub state machine doesn't reach to "Metering control" after urea pump (supply pump) is activated.
  • Urea pressure is lower than 4,500 hPa.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Warm up the engine until data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is "ON", and check the data list item No. 6: SCR sub state machine reaches to "Metering control" and item No. 9: Modeled urea pressure reaches to "5,000 - 6,500 hPa". Then, let the engine idle for approximately 30 minutes.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed urea line tube
  • Failed urea injector assembly
  • The urea injector fin is clogged with foreign material
  • Failed urea pump (integrated with supply pump)
  • Failed DCU
noteAfter replacing AdBlue™ in the urea tank, the diagnosis code may be set when the urea SCR system test is not performed or air bleeding is not sufficient.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the urea pump (supply pump) related (provisional) diagnosis code, urea injector assembly related (provisional) diagnosis code or (provisional) diagnosis code No. P2BA7 is set
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. AdBlue™ leak check
Visually check whether there is AdBlue™ leak between the urea pump (supply pump) and the urea injector assembly.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair. Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 3. Urea injector fin check
Check whether the urea injector fin is clogged with foreign material.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair. Then go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Urea leak test
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to check the urea leaks (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
NO (When terminated abnormally) : Replace the urea pump (integrated with supply pump) (Refer to ).
NO (When determined to be NG) : Replace the leaking part.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is "ON".
(4) Check the data list item No. 6: SCR sub state machine reaches to "Metering control", and item No. 9: Modeled urea pressure reaches to "5,000 - 6,500 hPa".
(5) Let the engine idle for approximately 30 minutes.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20E8 set?
Replace the urea pump (integrated with supply pump) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6
Check is end.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is "ON".
(4) Check the data list item No. 6: SCR sub state machine reaches to "Metering control", and item No. 9: Modeled urea pressure reaches to "5,000 - 6,500 hPa".
(5) Let the engine idle for approximately 30 minutes.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20E8 set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Check is end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P20E9 Reductant Pressure Too High
Code No. P20E9: Urea Pressure Too High
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
Diagnosis code No. P20E9 is set when high pressure abnormality of the urea injector assembly is detected after the urea pump (supply pump) is activated.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • After the urea pump (supply pump) is activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A high pressure abnormality in the urea injector assembly is detected (more than 8,500 hPa).
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Warm up the engine until data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is "ON", and check the data list item No. 6: SCR sub state machine reaches to "Metering control" and item No. 9: Modeled urea pressure reaches to "5,000 - 6,500 hPa". Then, let the engine idle for approximately 30 minutes.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed urea line tube
  • Failed urea injector assembly
  • The urea injector fin is clogged with foreign material
  • Failed urea pump (integrated with supply pump)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the urea line tube heater related (provisional) diagnosis code or urea injector assembly (provisional) related diagnosis code is set
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Urea injector fin check
Check whether the urea injector fin is clogged with foreign material.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair. Then go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check the urea line tube for clogging
Disconnect all the pipes of the urea line tube. Then, send air into the pipes with an air blow gun, and check whether the air comes out from the other side.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair. Then go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Urea pump (supply pump) operation check
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to check operation of the urea pump (supply pump) (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the urea pump (integrated with supply pump) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 5. Urea injection assembly condition check
Use the M.U.T.-III to check the spray state of the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
OK: The AdBlue™ is injected from each injection port of the urea injector assembly equally
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is "ON".
(4) Check the data list item No. 6: SCR sub state machine reaches to "Metering control", and item No. 9: Modeled urea pressure reaches to "5,000 - 6,500 hPa".
(5) Let the engine idle for approximately 30 minutes.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20E9 set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Check is end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P20EA Reductant Control Module Power Relay De-Energized - Too Early
Code No. P20EA: Urea SCR Relay De-energized - Too Early
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Battery voltage is applied to the urea SCR relay from the battery.
  • DCU connector terminal C/R applies current to the urea SCR relay coil by turning ON the power transistor in the unit in order to turn the relay ON.
  • When the urea SCR relay turns ON, battery voltage is supplied by the urea SCR relay to the DCU connector terminals BAT1, BAT2 and BAT3.
 
 
FUNCTION
Diagnosis code No. P20EA is set when the urea SCR relay is stuck open.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The urea SCR relay is detected to be open (no voltage is applied to BAT3 terminal) 3 times when the ignition switch is "ON" position.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed urea SCR relay
  • Open circuit in urea SCR relay circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check urea SCR relay itself
Urea SCR relay continuity check (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea SCR relay.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal C/R and urea SCR relay connector terminal
Check C/R line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal BAT1 and urea SCR relay connector terminal, and between DCU connector terminal BAT2 and urea SCR relay connector terminal, between DCU connector terminal BAT3 and urea SCR relay connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position and wait at least 1 minute.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and wait at least 10 seconds.
(4) Repeat Steps 2 to 3 twice.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20EA set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P20EB Reductant Control Module Power Relay De-Energized - Too Late
Code No. P20EB: Urea SCR Relay De-energized - Too Late
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Battery voltage is applied to the urea SCR relay from the battery.
  • DCU connector terminal C/R applies current to the urea SCR relay coil by turning ON the power transistor in the unit in order to turn the relay ON.
  • When the urea SCR relay turns ON, battery voltage is supplied by the urea SCR relay to the DCU connector terminals BAT1, BAT2 and BAT3.
 
 
FUNCTION
Diagnosis code No. P20EB is set when the urea SCR relay is stuck closed.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • When the ignition switch is turned from "ON" to "LOCK" (OFF) position
Judgement Criterion
  • The urea SCR relay is detected to be closed (voltage is applied to BAT3 terminal) when a certain period of time has passed after the ignition switch was turned to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed urea SCR relay
  • Short circuit in urea SCR relay circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check urea SCR relay itself
Urea SCR relay continuity check (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea SCR relay.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal C/R and urea SCR relay connector terminal
Check C/R line for short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal BAT1 and urea SCR relay connector terminal, and between DCU connector terminal BAT2 and urea SCR relay connector terminal, between DCU connector terminal BAT3 and urea SCR relay connector terminal
Check power supply line for short to power supply and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position and wait at least 1 minute.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and wait at least 10 seconds.
(4) Repeat Steps 2 to 3 twice.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20EB set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P20EE SCR NOx Catalyst Efficiency Below Threshold Bank 1
Code No. P20EE: SCR Efficiency Below Threshold
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • This monitor determines that the purification efficiency of the SCR has decreased when the actual integrated value of the NOx purification calculated from the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1, No. 2) input becomes lower than the integrated value estimated from the catalyst temperature, the exhaust air temperature and the AdBlue™ injection quantity.
  • The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P20EE when it determines that the purification efficiency of the SCR has decreased.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • After the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1, No. 2) heater is activated.
  • During urea injection assembly.
  • During on-line dosing.
  • Not during DPF regeneration.
  • Barometric pressure is more than 750 hPa.
  • Intake air temperature is more than -12°C.
  • The ammonia is adsorbed onto the SCR sufficiently.
  • The SCR efficiency is 0.7 or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • The NOx purification efficiency is determined to be decreased.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Dilution or deterioration of the AdBlue™
  • Failed diesel fuel system
  • Failed No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
  • Failed urea injector assembly (injection quantity is small)
  • Failed urea pump (integrated with supply pump)
  • Failed exhaust center pipe (integrated with SCR)
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
OK:
  • Engine cold state (engine stopped): At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent
  • Engine hot state: The temperature changes as the engine operates (The indicated temperature rises when the engine operation is changed from "low revolution/low load" to "high revolution/high load").
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Carry out the troubleshooting for diagnosis code No. P1427 and P1428 of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1427 and Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1428 ).
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether any diagnosis code related to the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1, No. 2), urea injector assembly and urea pump (supply pump) is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Urea pressure check
