Use the M.U.T.-III to check the urea pressure (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Perform the troubleshooting Step 1 to 4 of diagnosis code No. P20E8: Urea pressure too low (Refer to ).
 
STEP 5. Urea injection assembly condition check
noteIf diagnosis code No. P249D or P249E is set, carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to or ).
Use the M.U.T.-III to check the spray state of the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
OK: The AdBlue™ is injected from each injection port of the urea injector assembly equally.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
 
STEP 6. Check the SCR
(1) Remove the exhaust center pipe (integrated with SCR) (Refer to ).
(2) Check if there is a damage or urea crystal (white) adhered inside the catalytic converter (with mixer) and the SCR.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace the catalytic converter (with mixer) and/or the exhaust center pipe (integrated with SCR). Then change all the AdBlue™ (Refer to ).
 
STEP 7. Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
(1) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 21: NOx sensor (UP) heater release status and item No. 22: NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release status are "ON".
(2) Display the M.U.T.-III data list below.
  • Item No. 49: Modified NOx value (UP) <No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor>
  • Item No. 50: Modified NOx value (DOWN) <No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor>
  • Item No. 76: Estimated ammonia load
(3) Carry out the ammonia purge to consume ammonia adsorbed onto the SCR (Refer to ).
OK:
  • Check that the amount detected at the downstream side of the SCR becomes closer to the value of the upstream side of the SCR as the amount of adsorbed ammonia decreases.
  • When the amount of adsorbed ammonia is 0 g, operate the accelerator pedal to check that the amount detected at the downstream side of the SCR changes following the amount detected at the upstream side of the SCR.
Is the check result normal?
Change all the AdBlue™ (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8.
Replace the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1 and/or No. 2) the value of which does not change even when the accelerator pedal is operated (Refer to ).
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 21: NOx sensor (UP) heater release status and item No. 22: NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release status are "ON".
(4) Perform constant speed driving at approximately 60 km/h for 25 minutes or more in total.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
noteDo not turn off the ignition switch during reconfirmation. If the engine is stopped by turning off the ignition switch, repeat the procedure from the beginning.
Is diagnosis code No. P20EE set?
Replace the exhaust center pipe (integrated with SCR) (Refer to ).
Check is end
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P20FA Reductant Pump "B" Control Circuit/Open
Code No. P20FA: Back Flow Pump Control Circuit Open,
Code No. P20FC: Back Flow Pump Control Circuit Low,
Code No. P20FD: Back Flow Pump Control Circuit High
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal PPS.
  • The DCU connector terminal PPD makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the urea pump (back flow pump).
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P20FA, P20FC or P20FD when it detects a drive abnormality in the urea pump (back flow pump).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT <P20FA>
Check Conditions
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the engine was started.
Judgement Criterion
  • An open circuit in the urea pump (back flow pump) circuit is detected for 2 seconds or more.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Execute item No. 4: Back flow pump on the M.U.T.-III actuator test.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT <P20FC>
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • The DCU power supply voltage has been 10 V or more for at least 1 second.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A short to earth in the urea pump (back flow pump) circuit (Low side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
or
  • A short to earth in the urea pump (back flow pump) circuit (High side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Execute item No. 4: Back flow pump on the M.U.T.-III actuator test.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT <P20FD>
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A short to power supply in the urea pump (back flow pump) circuit (Low side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
or
  • A short to power supply in the urea pump (back flow pump) circuit (High side) is detected for 2 seconds or more.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Execute item No. 4: Back flow pump on the M.U.T.-III actuator test.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit, short to earth and short to power supply in urea pump (back flow pump) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea pump (integrated with back flow pump)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Measurement of urea pump (back flow pump) resistance
Measurement of urea pump (back flow pump) resistance (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea pump (integrated with back flow pump) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal PPS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal PPD and urea pump module connector terminal
Check earth line for open circuit, short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Execute item No. 4: Back flow pump on the M.U.T.-III actuator test.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20FA, P20FC or P20FD set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P20FB Reductant Pump "B" Control Performance/Stuck Off
Code No. P20FB: Back Flow Pump Control Performance Stuck Off
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal PPS.
  • The DCU connector terminal PPD makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the urea pump (back flow pump).
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P20FB when it detects a drive abnormality in the urea pump (back flow pump).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • When the ignition switch is turned from "ON" to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
  • Urea pressure is 4,500 hPa or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • The depressurisation control of the urea does not finish for 4.5 seconds or more.
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • High temperature abnormality of the back flow pump drive circuit is detected for 2 seconds or more.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Warm up the engine until data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is "ON", and check the data list item No. 6: SCR sub state machine reaches to "Metering control" and item No. 9: Modeled urea pressure reaches to "5,000 - 6,500 hPa". Then, turn the ignition switch from "ON" to "LOCK" (OFF) position, and wait at least 2 minutes.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit, short to earth and short to power supply in urea pump (back flow pump) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea pump (integrated with back flow pump)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Measurement of urea pump (back flow pump) resistance
Measurement of urea pump (back flow pump) resistance (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea pump (integrated with back flow pump) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal PPS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to PPD line, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal PPD and urea pump module connector terminal
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is "ON".
(4) Check the data list item No. 6: SCR sub state machine reaches to "Metering control", and item No. 9: Modeled urea pressure reaches to "5,000 - 6,500 hPa".
(5) Turn the ignition switch from "ON" to "LOCK" (OFF) position, and wait at least 2 minutes.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20FB set?
Replace the urea pump (integrated with back flow pump) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 15: Supply pump power stage status is "ON".
(4) Check the data list item No. 6: SCR sub state machine reaches to "Metering control", and item No. 9: Modeled urea pressure reaches to "5,000 - 6,500 hPa".
(5) Turn the ignition switch from "ON" to "LOCK" (OFF) position, and wait at least 2 minutes.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P20FB set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Check is end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P21C5 Reductant Level Sensor Stuck
Code No. P21C5: Urea Tank Level Sensor Stuck
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power is applied to the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor power supply terminal of urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal TLSS and earthed to the DCU connector terminal TLSE from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor earth terminal of urea pump module connector.
  • The PWM signal of sensor is inputted to the DCU connector terminal TLS from the urea tank level sensor/urea tank temperature sensor output terminal of urea pump module connector.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P21C5 when there is no change in the value received from the urea tank level sensor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • Urea tank level is 61 mm or more, and is 113 mm or less.
  • Drive the vehicle at 20 km/h or more for 15 seconds or more, and then stop the vehicle for 15 seconds or more.
  • Urea tank temperature is -7°C or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • The state that there is no change in the urea tank level during acceleration and deceleration is detected 5 times or more (approximately 5 minutes).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank level sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 31: Vehicle speed
  • Item No. 56: Vehicle acceleration (+: deceleration, -: acceleration)
Is the check result normal?
Check if there is a malfunction of the vehicle and repair if necessary.
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank level sensor) (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P21CB Reductant Control Module Supply Voltage Low
Code No. P21CB: DCU Supply Voltage Low
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Battery voltage is applied to the urea SCR relay.
  • DCU connector terminal C/R applies current to the urea SCR relay coil by turning ON the power transistor in the unit in order to turn the relay ON.
  • When the urea SCR relay is turned ON, the battery power will be supplied from the urea SCR relay to the DCU connector terminals BAT1, BAT2 and BAT3.
  • The DCU connector terminal GND is earthed to the vehicle body.
 
 
FUNCTION
Diagnosis code No. P21CB is set when the power supply voltage of the DCU is low.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • Battery power supply voltage is less than 8 V for 1 second.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed battery (poor charging/deteriorated/contaminated or loose terminals)
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in DCU power supply circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Battery check
Check the battery (Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery, On-vehicle Service, Battery Test ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Charge the battery, replace the battery, or repair the terminal part.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal GND and body earth
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal BAT1 and urea SCR relay connector terminal, and between DCU connector terminal BAT2 and urea SCR relay connector terminal, between DCU connector terminal BAT3 and urea SCR relay connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P21CB set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P21CC Reductant Control Module Supply Voltage High
Code No. P21CC: DCU Supply Voltage High
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Battery voltage is applied to the urea SCR relay.
  • DCU connector terminal C/R applies current to the urea SCR relay coil by turning ON the power transistor in the unit in order to turn the relay ON.
  • When the urea SCR relay is turned ON, the battery power will be supplied from the urea SCR relay to the DCU connector terminals BAT1, BAT2 and BAT3.
  • The DCU connector terminal GND is earthed to the vehicle body.
 
 
FUNCTION
Diagnosis code No. P21CC is set when the power supply voltage of the DCU is high.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • Engine is running.
Judgement Criterion
  • Battery power supply voltage is more than 16 V for 2.5 seconds.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Start the engine.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed charging system
  • Failed battery
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Battery voltage check
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Perform the regulated voltage test (Refer to GROUP 16 - Charging System, On-vehicle Service, Regulated Voltage Test ).
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P21CB set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P2200 NOx Sensor Circuit(Bank 1 Sensor 1)
Code No. P2200: No. 1 NOx Sensor Circuit
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P2200 when it receives open or short circuit information from the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • When the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater is activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • An open circuit signal sent from the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication persists for at least 2 seconds.
  • A short circuit signal sent from the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication persists for at least 2 seconds.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Open circuit of sensor circuit)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P2201 NOx Sensor Circuit Range/Performance(Bank 1 Sensor 1)
Code No. P2201: No. 1 NOx Sensor Circuit Range/Performance
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P2201 when the detected value received from the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication is abnormal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Engine is running.
  • Approximately 5 minutes or more have passed since the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater was activated.
  • Engine idling (less than 1,000 r/min).
  • Exhaust temperature is more than 110°C and is less than 500°C.
  • Not during DPF regeneration.
  • The oxygen ratio is 0.03 or more.
  • The vehicle is stationary.
  • There is no NOx sensor-related malfunction.
Judgement Criterion
  • The NOx inclination characteristics of the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor remains 50% or less.
or
  • The NOx inclination characteristics of the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor remains 150% or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed diesel fuel system
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 21: NOx sensor (UP) heater release status changes to "ON", then continue to drive for 5 minutes.
(4) Let the engine idle for 10 minutes, and check that the data list item No. 3: SCR catalyst temperature indicates a value in the range between 110°C and 500°C.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
noteDo not turn off the ignition switch during reconfirmation. If the engine is stopped by turning off the ignition switch, repeat the procedure from the beginning.
Is diagnosis code No. P2201 set?
Replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P2202 NOx Sensor Circuit Low(Bank 1 Sensor 1)
Code No. P2202: No. 1 NOx Sensor Circuit Low
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P2202 when it receives information of an abnormality in the validity diagnosis of the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor or the validity diagnosis of the oxygen sensor in the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (the value is lower than the specified lower limit value) via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • After the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater is activated.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • Engine is running.
Judgement Criterion
  • The NOx value sent from the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is 195 ppm or less.
or
  • The oxygen density value sent from the oxygen sensor in the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is -0.08 or less.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed diesel fuel system
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 21: NOx sensor (UP) heater release status changes to "ON".
(4) Stop the vehicle, and wait at least 5 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
noteDo not turn off the ignition switch during reconfirmation. If the engine is stopped by turning off the ignition switch, repeat the procedure from the beginning.
Is diagnosis code No. P2202 set?
Replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P2203 NOx Sensor Circuit High(Bank 1 Sensor 1)
Code No. P2203: No. 1 NOx Sensor Circuit High
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P2203 when it receives information of an abnormality in the validity diagnosis of the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor or the validity diagnosis of the oxygen sensor in the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (the value is more than or equal to the specified lower limit value) via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • After the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater is activated.
  • When the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater is deactivated.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • Engine is running.
Judgement Criterion
  • The NOx value sent from the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is 3,075 ppm or more.
or
  • The oxygen density value sent from the oxygen sensor in the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is 0.29 or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed diesel fuel system
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 21: NOx sensor (UP) heater release status changes to "ON".
(4) Stop the vehicle, and wait at least 5 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
noteDo not turn off the ignition switch during reconfirmation. If the engine is stopped by turning off the ignition switch, repeat the procedure from the beginning.
Is diagnosis code No. P2203 set?
Replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P220A NOx Sensor Supply Voltage Circuit(Bank 1 Sensor 1)
Code No. P220A: No. 1 NOx Sensor Supply Voltage Circuit
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal from the engine control relay connector terminal and is earthed to the body from the No.1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal.
  • The No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is connected to the DCU via the local CAN lines (CANL/CANH) and sends information such as the NOx value, the oxygen density and the self-diagnosis results.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P220A when it receives power supply voltage abnormality information from the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • After the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater is activated.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A power supply voltage abnormality signal sent from the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN persists for at least 2 seconds.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit and short to earth in No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check harness between engine control relay connector terminal and No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector power supply terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector earth terminal and body earth
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 21: NOx sensor (UP) heater release status changes to "ON".
(4) Stop the vehicle, and wait at least 5 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
noteDo not turn off the ignition switch during reconfirmation. If the engine is stopped by turning off the ignition switch, repeat the procedure from the beginning.
Is diagnosis code No. P202A set?
Replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P220B NOx Sensor Supply Voltage Circuit(Bank 1 Sensor 2)
Code No. P220B: No. 2 NOx Sensor Supply Voltage Circuit
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal from the engine control relay connector terminal and is earthed to the body from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal.
  • The No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is connected to the DCU via the local CAN lines (CANL/CANH) and sends information such as the NOx value, the oxygen density and the self-diagnosis results.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P220B when it receives power supply voltage abnormality information from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • After the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater is activated
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • A power supply voltage abnormality signal sent from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN persists for at least 2 seconds.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit and short to earth in No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check harness between engine control relay connector terminal and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector power supply terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector earth terminal and body earth
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 22: NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release status changes to "ON".
(4) Stop the vehicle, and wait at least 5 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
noteDo not turn off the ignition switch during reconfirmation. If the engine is stopped by turning off the ignition switch, repeat the procedure from the beginning.
Is diagnosis code No. P202B set?
Replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P220E NOx Sensor Heater Control Circuit Range/Performance(Bank1 SNSR1)
Code No. P220E: No. 1 NOx Sensor Heater Control Circuit Range/Performance
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P220E when the heater temperature received from the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication does not rise.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • After the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater is activated.
  • Engine is running.
Judgement Criterion
  • The temperature of the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater does not rise for 120 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P220F NOx Sensor Heater Control Circuit Range/Performance(Bank1 SNSR2)
Code No. P220F: No. 2 NOx Sensor Heater Control Circuit Range/Performance
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P220F when the heater temperature received from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication does not rise.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • After the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater is activated.
  • Engine is running.
Judgement Criterion
  • The temperature of the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater does not rise for 120 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P225C NOx Sensor Performance - Signal Biased/Stuck High(Bank1 Sensor1)
Code No. P225C: No. 1 NOx Sensor Performance - Signal Biased/Stuck High
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P225C when it detects a characteristic abnormality information from the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 minutes have passed since the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor was activated.
  • During overrun (during fuel cut by deceleration).
Judgement Criterion
  • The No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor offset value is detected to be 80 ppm or more at least twice.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P225D NOx Sensor Performance - Signal Biased/Stuck Low(Bank1 Sensor1)
Code No. P225D: No. 1 NOx Sensor Performance - Signal Biased/Stuck Low
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P225D when it detects a characteristic abnormality information from the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 minutes have passed since the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor was activated.
  • During overrun (during fuel cut by deceleration).
Judgement Criterion
  • The No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor offset value is detected to be -30 ppm or less at least twice.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P225E NOx Sensor Performance - Signal Biased/Stuck High(Bank1 Sensor2)
Code No. P225E: No. 2 NOx Sensor Performance - Signal Biased/Stuck High
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P225E when it detects a characteristic abnormality information from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 minutes have passed since the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor was activated.
  • During overrun (during fuel cut by deceleration).
Judgement Criterion
  • The No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor offset value is detected to be 80 ppm or more at least twice.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P225F NOx Sensor Performance - Signal Biased/Stuck Low(Bank1 Sensor2)
Code No. P225F: No. 2 NOx Sensor Performance - Signal Biased/Stuck Low
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P225F when it detects a characteristic abnormality information from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 minutes have passed since the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor was activated.
  • During overrun (during fuel cut by deceleration).
Judgement Criterion
  • The No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor offset value is detected to be -30 ppm or less at least twice.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P229E NOx Sensor Circuit(Bank 1 Sensor 2)
Code No. P229E: No. 2 NOx Sensor Circuit
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P229E when it receives open or short circuit information from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • When the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater is deactivated.
Judgement Criterion
  • An open circuit signal sent from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication persists for at least 2 seconds.
  • A short circuit signal sent from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication persists for at least 2 seconds.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Open circuit of sensor circuit)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P229F NOx Sensor Circuit Range/Performance(Bank 1 Sensor 2)
Code No. P229F: No. 2 NOx Sensor Circuit Range/Performance
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P229F when the detected value received from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor via CAN communication is abnormal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Engine is running.
  • Approximately 5 minutes or more have passed since the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater was activated.
  • Engine idling (less than 1,000 r/min).
  • Exhaust temperature is more than 110°C and is less than 500°C.
  • Not during DPF regeneration.
  • The oxygen ratio is 0.12 or more.
  • The vehicle is stationary.
  • There is no NOx sensor-related malfunction.
Judgement Criterion
  • The NOx inclination characteristics of the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor remains 50% or less.
or
  • The NOx inclination characteristics of the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor remains 150% or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed diesel fuel system
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 22: NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release status changes to "ON", then continue to drive for 5 minutes.
(4) Let the engine idle for 10 minutes, and check that the data list item No. 3: SCR catalyst temperature indicates a value in the range between 110°C and 500°C.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P229F set?
Replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P22A0 NOx Sensor Circuit Low(Bank 1 Sensor 2)
Code No. P22A0: No. 2 NOx Sensor Circuit Low
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P22A0 when it receives information of an abnormality in the validity diagnosis of the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor or the validity diagnosis of the oxygen sensor in the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (the value is lower than the specified lower limit value) via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • After the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater is activated.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • Engine is running.
Judgement Criterion
  • The NOx value sent from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is 195 ppm or less.
or
  • The oxygen density value sent from the oxygen sensor in the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is -0.08 or less.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed diesel fuel system
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 22: NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release status changes to "ON".
(4) Stop the vehicle, and wait at least 5 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
noteDo not turn off the ignition switch during reconfirmation. If the engine is stopped by turning off the ignition switch, repeat the procedure from the beginning.
Is diagnosis code No. P22A0 set?
Replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P22A1 NOx Sensor Circuit High(Bank 1 Sensor 2)
Code No. P22A1: No. 2 NOx Sensor Circuit High
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P22A1 when it receives information of an abnormality in the validity diagnosis of the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor or the validity diagnosis of the oxygen sensor in the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (the value is more than or equal to the specified lower limit value) via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • Approximately 5 minutes or more have passed since the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater was activated.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
  • Engine is running.
Judgement Criterion
  • The NOx value sent from the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is 3,075 ppm or more.
or
  • The oxygen density value sent from the oxygen sensor in the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is 0.29 or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed diesel fuel system
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 22: NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release status changes to "ON".
(4) Stop the vehicle, and wait at least 5 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
noteDo not turn off the ignition switch during reconfirmation. If the engine is stopped by turning off the ignition switch, repeat the procedure from the beginning.
Is diagnosis code No. P22A1 set?
Replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P22FB NOx Sensor Performance - Sensing Element(Bank 1 Sensor 1)
Code No. P22FB: No. 1 NOx Sensor Performance - Sensing Element
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The DCU determines whether the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is installed properly according to the oxygen density.
  • The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P22FB when the oxygen density detected by the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor during acceleration is outside the specified range.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater was activated.
  • Engine torque is more than 150 Nm.
  • Engine speed is more than 1,500 r/min.
Judgement Criterion
  • The oxygen density of the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is 0.19 or more for 5 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor improperly installed (dislocation/looseness).
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (oxygen improperly detected).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the installation state of the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor for dislocation and looseness.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Repair. Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor functionality
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
(1) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 21: NOx sensor (UP) heater release status changes to "ON".
(2) Stop the vehicle, and wait at least 2 minutes.
(3) Check that the value of data list item No. 51: Modified O2 value (UP) changes when the accelerator pedal is depressed and released.
Is the check result normal?
Check is end.
Replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P22FE NOx Sensor Performance - Sensing Element(Bank 1 Sensor 2)
Code No. P22FE: No. 2 NOx Sensor Performance - Sensing Element
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The DCU determines whether the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is installed properly according to the oxygen density.
  • The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P22FE when the oxygen density detected by the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor during acceleration is outside the specified range.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor heater was activated.
  • Engine torque is more than 150 N·m.
  • Engine speed is more than 1,500 r/min.
Judgement Criterion
  • The oxygen density of the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor is 0.19 or more for 5 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor improperly installed (dislocation/looseness).
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (oxygen improperly detected).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the installation state of the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
Check the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor for dislocation and looseness.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Repair. Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor functionality
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
(1) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 22: NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release status changes to "ON".
(2) Stop the vehicle, and wait at least 2 minutes.
(3) Check that the value of data list item No. 52: Modified O2 value (DOWN) changes when the accelerator pedal is depressed and released.
Is the check result normal?
Check is end.
Replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P249D Closed Loop Reductant Injection Control At Limit - Flow Too Low
Code No. P249D: Closed Loop Urea Injection Control At Limit - Flow Too Low
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P249D when it determines that the injection quantity of the AdBlue™ is too small.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The adaptation factor is 1.4 or more for at least 1 second.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Dilution or deterioration of the AdBlue™
  • Failed diesel fuel system
  • Failed No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
  • Exhaust leak
  • Failed urea line tube A, B, C (leakage or clogging in piping)
  • Failed urea injector assembly (injection quantity decreased)
  • Failed urea pump (integrated with supply pump and back flow pump)
  • Failed exhaust centre pipe (integrated with SCR)
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
cautionPrior to diagnosis, ask your customer if diesel exhaust fluid other than AdBlue™ is replenished. If diesel exhaust fluid other than AdBlue™ is used, the urea crystal may accumulate inside the exhaust pipe with the lapse of time.
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
OK:
  • Engine cold state (engine stopped): At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent
  • Engine hot state: The temperature changes as the engine operates (The indicated temperature rises when the engine operation is changed from "low revolution/low load" to "high revolution/high load").
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Carry out the troubleshooting for diagnosis code No. P1427 and No. P1428 of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1427 and Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1428 ).
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether any diagnosis code related to the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1, No. 2), urea injector assembly and urea pump (supply pump, back flow pump) is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check for exhaust leaks
Check whether there is exhaust leak at the exhaust pipe.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair.
 
STEP 5. Urea pressure check
Use the M.U.T.-III to check the urea pressure (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
NO <Urea pressure too low> : Perform the troubleshooting Step 1 to 4 of diagnosis code No. P20E8: Urea pressure too low (Refer to ).
NO <Urea pressure too high> : Perform the troubleshooting Step 1 to 4 of diagnosis code No. P20E9: Urea pressure too high (Refer to ).
 
STEP 6. Urea injection assembly condition check
Use the M.U.T.-III to check the spray state of the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
OK: The AdBlue™ is injected from each injection port of the urea injector assembly equally.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Replace the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
 
STEP 7. Check the SCR
(1) Remove the exhaust center pipe (integrated with SCR) (Refer to ).
(2) Check if there is a damage or urea crystal (white) adhered inside the catalytic converter (with mixer) and the SCR.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair or replace the catalytic converter (with mixer) and/or the exhaust center pipe (integrated with SCR). Then change all the AdBlue™ (Refer to ).
 
STEP 8. Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
(1) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 21: NOx sensor (UP) heater release status and item No. 22: NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release status are "ON".
(2) Display the M.U.T.-III data list below.
  • Item No. 49: Modified NOx value (UP) <No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor>
  • Item No. 50: Modified NOx value (DOWN) <No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor>
  • Item No. 76: Estimated ammonia load
(3) Carry out the ammonia purge to consume ammonia adsorbed onto the SCR (Refer to ).
OK:
  • Check that the amount detected at the downstream side of the SCR becomes closer to the value of the upstream side of the SCR as the amount of adsorbed ammonia decreases.
  • When the amount of adsorbed ammonia is 0 g, operate the accelerator pedal to check that the amount detected at the downstream side of the SCR changes following the amount detected at the upstream side of the SCR.
Is the check result normal?
Change all the AdBlue™ (Refer to ).
Replace the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1 and/or No. 2) the value of which does not change even when the accelerator pedal is operated (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P249E Closed Loop Reductant Injection Control At Limit - Flow Too High
Code No. P249E: Closed Loop Urea Injection Control At Limit - Flow Too High
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P249E when it determines that the injection quantity of the AdBlue™ is too large.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The adaptation factor is 0.6 or less for at least 1 second.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Dilution or deterioration of the AdBlue™
  • Failed diesel fuel system
  • Failed No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
  • Exhaust leak
  • Failed urea line tube A, B, C (leakage or clogging in piping)
  • Failed urea injector assembly (injection quantity decreased)
  • Failed urea pump (integrated with supply pump and back flow pump)
  • Failed exhaust centre pipe (integrated with SCR)
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
cautionPrior to diagnosis, ask your customer if diesel exhaust fluid other than AdBlue™ is replenished. If diesel exhaust fluid other than AdBlue™ is used, the urea crystal may accumulate inside the exhaust pipe with the lapse of time.
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
OK:
  • Engine cold state (engine stopped): At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent
  • Engine hot state: The temperature changes as the engine operates (The indicated temperature rises when the engine operation is changed from "low revolution/low load" to "high revolution/high load").
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Carry out the troubleshooting for diagnosis code No. P1427 and No. P1428 of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1427 and Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1428 ).
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether any diagnosis code related to the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1, No. 2), urea injector and urea pump is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check for exhaust leaks
Check whether there is exhaust leak at the exhaust pipe.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair.
 
STEP 5. Urea pressure check
Use the M.U.T.-III to check the urea pressure (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
NO <Urea pressure too low> : Perform the troubleshooting Step 1 to 4 of diagnosis code No. P20E8: Urea pressure too low (Refer to ).
NO <Urea pressure too high> : Perform the troubleshooting Step 1 to 4 of diagnosis code No. P20E9: Urea pressure too high (Refer to ).
 
STEP 6. Urea injection assembly condition check
Use the M.U.T.-III to check the spray state of the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
OK: The AdBlue™ is injected from each injection port of the urea injector assembly equally.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Replace the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
 
STEP 7. Check the SCR
(1) Remove the exhaust center pipe (integrated with SCR) (Refer to ).
(2) Check if there is a damage or urea crystal (white) adhered inside the catalytic converter (with mixer) and the SCR.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair or replace the catalytic converter (with mixer) and/or the exhaust center pipe (integrated with SCR). Then change all the AdBlue™ (Refer to ).
 
STEP 8. Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
(1) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 21: NOx sensor (UP) heater release status and item No. 22: NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release status are "ON".
(2) Display the M.U.T.-III data list below.
  • Item No. 49: Modified NOx value (UP) <No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor>
  • Item No. 50: Modified NOx value (DOWN) <No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor>
  • Item No. 76: Estimated ammonia load
(3) Carry out the ammonia purge to consume ammonia adsorbed onto the SCR (Refer to ).
OK:
  • Check that the amount detected at the downstream side of the SCR becomes closer to the value of the upstream side of the SCR as the amount of adsorbed ammonia decreases.
  • When the amount of adsorbed ammonia is 0 g, operate the accelerator pedal to check that the amount detected at the downstream side of the SCR changes following the amount detected at the upstream side of the SCR.
Is the check result normal?
Repair or replace the exhaust centre pipe (integrated with SCR) (Refer to . Then change all the AdBlue™ (Refer to ).
Replace the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1 and/or No. 2) the value of which does not change even when the accelerator pedal is operated (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P24AE Particulate Matter Sensor Circuit
Code No. P24AE: PM Sensor Circuit
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P24AE when it receives malfunction information of the positive side electrode from the exhaust muffler PM sensor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • While the exhaust muffler PM sensor heater is ON.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result indicating malfunction of the negative-side electrode is received from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P24AF Particulate Matter Sensor Circuit Range/Performance
Code No. P24AF: PM Sensor Circuit Range/Performance
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P24AF when it receives sensor internal error information from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • While the exhaust muffler PM sensor heater is ON.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result indicating internal error of the sensor is received from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P24B1 Particulate Matter Sensor Circuit High
Code No. P24B1: PM Sensor Circuit High
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P24B1 when it receives malfunction information of the negative-side electrode from the exhaust muffler PM sensor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result indicating malfunction of the negative-side electrode is received from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN communication for 3 seconds or more.
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • 220 seconds or more have passed since the PM measurement was started.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result indicating malfunction of the negative-side electrode is received from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P24B5 Particulate Matter Sensor Heater Control Circuit Low
Code No. P24B5: PM Sensor Heater Control Circuit Low
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P24B5 when it receives heater circuit low abnormality information from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • While the exhaust muffler PM sensor heater is ON.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result indicating heater circuit low abnormality is received from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN communication for 3 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor (Failed heater circuit)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P24B6 Particulate Matter Sensor Heater Control Circuit High
Code No. P24B6: PM Sensor Heater Control Circuit High
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P24B6 when it receives heater circuit high abnormality information from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • While the exhaust muffler PM sensor heater is ON.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result indicating heater circuit high abnormality is received from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN communication for 3 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor (Failed heater circuit)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P24B7 Particulate Matter Sensor Heater Resistance
Code No. P24B7: PM Sensor Heater Resistance
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P24B7 when it receives abnormality information of the temperature sensor resistance value from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • While the exhaust muffler PM sensor heater is ON.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result indicating abnormality in the temperature sensor resistance value is received from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor (Failed heater circuit)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P24C6 Particulate Matter Sensor Temperature Circuit
Code No. P24C6: PM Sensor Temperature Circuit
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P24C6 when it receives temperature sensor circuit abnormality (open circuit/short to earth) information from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The self-diagnosis result indicating abnormality in the temperature sensor circuit (open circuit/short to earth) is received from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN for 3 seconds or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor (Failed heater circuit)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P24C7 Particulate Matter Sensor Temperature Circuit Range/performance
Code No. P24C7: PM Sensor Temperature Circuit Range/Performance
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P24C7 when it determines that there is a characteristic abnormality of the exhaust muffler PM sensor temperature.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • 8 hours or more have passed since the last time the ignition switch was turned "LOCK" (OFF) position.
  • Barometric pressure is more than 750 hPa.
  • No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) is more than -30°C and is less than 80°C.
  • Engine coolant temperature is more than -30°C and is less than 80°C.
  • Intake air temperature is more than -30°C and is less than 80°C.
Judgement Criterion
  • The value of A below is 45.5°C or more.
    • A: B - average value of C, D and E
    • B: Exhaust muffler PM sensor temperature
    • C: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor temperature (DPF temperature)
    • D: Engine coolant temperature
    • E: Intake air temperature
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • 8 hours or more have passed since the last time the ignition switch was turned "LOCK" (OFF) position.
  • Barometric pressure is more than 750 hPa.
  • Intake air temperature is more than -6.64°C.
Judgement Criterion
  • Exhaust muffler PM sensor temperature is less than -40°C.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed diesel fuel system [Failed engine coolant temperature sensor, No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) or intake air temperature]
  • Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor (characteristic abnormality)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for data list of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position (engine stopped)
  • Engine cold state.
  • Item No. 7: Engine coolant temperature sensor
OK: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Carry out the troubleshooting for diagnosis code No. P0117 and No. P0118 of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P0117 and Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P0118 ).
 
STEP 2. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position (engine stopped)
  • Engine cold state
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
OK: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Carry out the troubleshooting for diagnosis code No. P1427 and No. P1428 of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1427 and Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1428 ).
 
STEP 3. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position (engine stopped)
  • Engine cold state.
  • Item No. 43: Intake air temperature sensor
OK: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Carry out the troubleshooting for diagnosis code No. P0072 and No. P0073 of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P0072 and Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P0073 ).
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position (engine stopped)
  • Engine cold state.
  • Item No. 65: PM sensor temperature
OK: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P24CA Particulate Matter Sensor Temperature Circuit Intermittent
Code No. P24CA: PM Sensor Temperature Circuit Intermittent
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P24CA when the difference between the exhaust muffler PM sensor temperature and the No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor temperature is larger than the predetermined value.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • More than 30 seconds have passed with vehicle speed is more than 30 km/h.
  • 180 seconds or more have passed since the exhaust muffler PM sensor heater was turned ON.
  • No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor temperature (DPF temperature) is more than 50°C and is less than 400°C
  • The change in No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor temperature (DPF temperature) remains 9.6°C or less for 90 seconds or more.
  • Barometric pressure is more than 750 hPa.
  • At least 10 seconds have elapsed while the exhaust gas velocity is more than the predetermined value.
Judgement Criterion
  • The difference between the exhaust muffler PM sensor temperature and the No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor temperature (DPF temperature) is larger than the predetermined value.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed diesel fuel system [Failed No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)]
  • Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor (characteristic abnormality)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for data list of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
OK:
  • Engine cold state (engine stopped): At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
  • Engine hot state: The temperature changes as the engine operates (The indicated temperature rises when the engine operation is changed from "low revolution/low load" to "high revolution/high load").
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Carry out the troubleshooting for diagnosis code No. P1427 and No. P1428 of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1427 and Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1428 ).
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 65: PM sensor temperature
OK:
  • Engine cold state (engine stopped): At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
  • Engine hot state: The temperature changes as the engine operates (The indicated temperature rises when the engine operation is changed from "low revolution/low load" to "high revolution/high load").
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P24D0 Particulate Matter Sensor Supply Voltage Circuit
Code No. P24D0: PM Sensor Supply Voltage Circuit
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector terminal from the engine control relay connector terminal and is earthed to the body from the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector terminal.
  • The exhaust muffler PM sensor is connected to the DCU via the local CAN lines (CANL/CANH) and sends information such as the amount of PM and the self-diagnosis results.
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P24D0 when it receives power supply voltage abnormality information from the exhaust muffler PM sensor via CAN communication.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The exhaust muffler PM sensor power supply voltage remains lower than the DCU power supply voltage by 2.6 V or more for at least 1 second.
  • The exhaust muffler PM sensor power supply voltage remains higher than the DCU power supply voltage by 2.1 V or more for at least 1 second.
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • While the exhaust muffler PM sensor heater is ON.
Judgement Criterion
  • The exhaust muffler PM sensor power supply voltage remains higher than the DCU power supply voltage by 2.1 V or more for at least 1 second.
  • The exhaust muffler PM sensor power supply voltage remains lower than the DCU power supply voltage by 2.6 V or more for at least 1 second.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor power supply circuit (loose connection/poorly earthed)
  • Failed DCU power supply circuit (loose connection/poorly earthed)
  • Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether any diagnosis code related to the DCU power supply is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between engine control relay connector terminal and exhaust muffler PM sensor power supply terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between exhaust muffler PM sensor connector earth terminal and body earth
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P24DA Particulate Matter Sensor Exhaust Sample Error(Bank 1)
Code No. P24DA: PM Sensor Exhaust Sample Error
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P24DA when the temperature of the exhaust muffler PM sensor does not rise during driving.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • More than 40 seconds have elapsed after the under mentioned all conditions have been met.
    1. Ignition switch is "ON" position.
    2. Vehicle speed is more than 25 km/h.
    3. 120 seconds or more have passed since the exhaust muffler PM sensor heater was turned ON.
    4. DPF temperature is more than 155°C.
    5. Barometric pressure is more than 750 hPa.
    6. The exhaust gas velocity is more than the predetermined value (vehicle is driven at a speed of 70 km/h or more).
Judgement Criterion
