  • The exhaust muffler PM sensor temperature does not rise to the specified value which is set according to the ambient temperature.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Exhaust muffler PM sensor improperly installed (dislocation/looseness)
  • Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor (Failed temperature sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the installation state of the exhaust muffler PM sensor
Check the exhaust muffler PM sensor for dislocation and looseness.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
Repair.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P2BA7 NOx Exceedance - Empty Reagent Tank
Code No. P2BA7: NOx Exceedance - Empty Reagent Tank
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P2BA7 when the remaining amount of the AdBlue™ becomes equivalent to travelable distance of 0 km.
  • This diagnosis code indicates the history of engine restart prohibition which is caused when the AdBlue™ is not replenished, and it is not a failure of the vehicle. If the diagnosis code is stored as a past trouble, erase it.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • At least 2 seconds have passed since the remaining amount of the AdBlue™ became equivalent to travelable distance of 0 km (Data list item No. 64: Urea tank remaining volume is almost 5.1% or less.).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
AdBlue™ is not replenished.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Refill the AdBlue™ (Refer to).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P2BA9 NOx Exceedance - Insufficient Reagent Quality
Code No. P2BA9: NOx Exceedance - Insufficient Reagent Quality
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • This monitor determines that the purification efficiency of the SCR has decreased when the actual integrated value of the NOx purification calculated from the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1, No. 2) input becomes lower than the integrated value estimated from the catalyst temperature, the exhaust air temperature and the AdBlue™ injection quantity.
  • The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P2BA9 when it determines that the purification efficiency of the SCR has decreased within a certain period of time after the AdBlue™ was replenished.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • After the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1, No. 2) heater is activated.
  • During urea injection.
  • During on-line dosing.
  • Not during DPF regeneration.
  • Barometric pressure is more than 750 hPa.
  • Intake air temperature is more than -12°C.
  • The ammonia is adsorbed onto the SCR sufficiently.
  • The SCR efficiency is 0.7 or more.
  • There is no ammonia slip.
  • Not during SCR adaptation.
  • 120 seconds or more have passed since the SCR adaptation was completed.
  • The integrated value of the urea injection assembly amount after the AdBlue™ is replenished is 45 g or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • The NOx purification efficiency is determined to be decreased.
noteAfter performing repairs, perform the following operations to turn off the warning display of the urea SCR system.
  • Perform the forcible DPF regeneration, and then drive the vehicle for 20 to 30 minutes or more (Refer to ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Dilution or deterioration of the AdBlue™
  • Failed diesel fuel system
  • Failed No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
  • Failed urea injector assembly (injection quantity decreased)
  • Failed urea pump (integrated with supply pump)
  • Failed exhaust centre pipe (integrated with SCR)
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
cautionPrior to diagnosis, ask your customer if diesel exhaust fluid other than AdBlue™ is replenished. If diesel exhaust fluid other than AdBlue™ is used, the urea crystal may accumulate inside the exhaust pipe with the lapse of time.
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
OK:
  • Engine cold state (engine stopped): At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent
  • Engine hot state: The temperature changes as the engine operates (The indicated temperature rises when the engine operation is changed from "low revolution/low load" to "high revolution/high load").
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Carry out the troubleshooting for diagnosis code No. P1427 and No. P1428 of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1427 and Diagnosis Code Procedures No. P1428 ).
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether any diagnosis code related to the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1, No. 2), urea injector assembly and urea pump (supply pump) is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Urea pressure check
Use the M.U.T.-III to check the urea pressure (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Perform the troubleshooting Step 1 to 4 of diagnosis code No. P20E8: Urea pressure too low (Refer to ).
 
STEP 5. Urea injection assembly condition check
noteIf diagnosis code No. P249D or No. P249E is set, carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to or ).
Use the M.U.T.-III to check the spray state of the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
OK: The AdBlue™ is injected from each injection port of the urea injector assembly equally.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the urea injector assembly (Refer to ).
 
STEP 6. Check the SCR
(1) Remove the exhaust center pipe (integrated with SCR) (Refer to ).
(2) Check if there is a damage or urea crystal (white) adhered inside the catalytic converter (with mixer) and the SCR.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace the catalytic converter (with mixer) and/or the exhaust center pipe (integrated with SCR). Then change all the AdBlue™ (Refer to ).
 
STEP 7. Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
(1) Warm up the engine until data list item No. 21: NOx sensor (UP) heater release status and item No. 22: NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release status are "ON".
(2) Display the M.U.T.-III data list below.
  • Item No. 49: Modified NOx value (UP) <No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor>
  • Item No. 50: Modified NOx value (DOWN) <No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor>
  • Item No. 76: Estimated ammonia load
(3) Carry out the ammonia purge to consume ammonia adsorbed onto the SCR (Refer to ).
OK:
  • Check that the amount detected at the downstream side of the SCR becomes closer to the value of the upstream side of the SCR as the amount of adsorbed ammonia decreases.
  • When the amount of adsorbed ammonia is 0 g, operate the accelerator pedal to check that the amount detected at the downstream side of the SCR changes following the amount detected at the upstream side of the SCR.
Is the check result normal?
Change all the AdBlue™ (Refer to ) Then go to Step 8.
Replace the exhaust muffler NOx sensor (No. 1 and/or No. 2) the value of which does not change even when the accelerator pedal is operated (Refer to ).
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to carry out the reset (urea tank level) (Refer to ).
(4) Carry out the forcible DPF regeneration once (Refer to ).
(5) Perform driving for 20 to 30 minutes.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
noteDo not turn off the ignition switch during reconfirmation. If the engine is stopped by turning off the ignition switch, repeat the procedure from the procedure 4 to 6 of Step 8.
Is diagnosis code No. P2BA9 set?
Replace the exhaust center pipe (integrated with SCR) (Refer to ).
Check is end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P33FD Reductant pump "A" current implausible
Code No. P33FD: Supply Pump Current Implausible
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the urea pump module connector from the DCU connector terminal MCPS.
  • The DCU connector terminal MCPD makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the urea pump (supply pump).
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P33FD when it detects a drive abnormality in the urea pump (supply pump).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Within 30 seconds after the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position.
  • DCU power supply voltage is more than 10 V.
  • The urea pump (supply pump) is deactivated.
  • Ambient temperature is more than -7°C.
  • The difference between the DPF temperature (No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor) and the engine coolant temperature is 15°C or less.
  • The difference between the DPF temperature (No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor) and the ambient temperature is 15°C or less.
  • The difference between the engine coolant temperature and the ambient temperature is 15°C or less.
  • 5 hours or more have passed since the last time the ignition switch was turned "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The difference between the calculated current value and the actual current value of the urea pump (supply pump) is larger than the predetermined value.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit and short to earth in urea pump (supply pump) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed urea pump (integrated with supply pump)
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Measurement of urea pump (supply pump) resistance
Measurement of urea pump (supply pump) resistance (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the urea pump (integrated with supply pump) (Refer to )
 
STEP 2. Check harness between DCU connector terminal MCPS and urea pump module connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal MCPD and urea pump module connector terminal
Check earth line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position, and leave the vehicle for at least 5 hours.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P33FD set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. P33FF SCR System Heater Malfunction
Code No. P33FF: SCR System Heater Malfunction
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The DCU sets diagnosis code No. P33FF when it detects a malfunction of defrosting control of the urea tank or the urea line tube heater.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is 10 V or more.
  • At least 1 second has passed since the DCU was activated.
Judgement Criterion
  • The defrosting control of the urea tank heater is performed 5 times or more.
or
  • The defrosting control of the urea line tube heater is performed 5 times or more.
noteThe number of times of defrosting control is reset by turning the ignition switch from "LOCK" (OFF) to "ON" position.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank heater and urea tank temperature sensor)
  • Failed urea line tube heater (A, B and/or C)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether any diagnosis code related to the urea pump, urea line tube heater is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 7: Urea tank temperature
OK: Indicates almost the same temperature as the surrounding temperature of the urea tank.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank heater and urea tank temperature sensor) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 4.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III actuator test
Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 3: Urea tank heater
OK: When the test is executed 10 times, data list item No. 7: Urea tank temperature rises by 0.1°C to 0.2°C, compared to the temperature before the test.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the urea tank assembly (integrated with urea tank heater and urea tank temperature sensor) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III actuator test
Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Touch the urea line tube with your fingers.
  • Item No. 2: Pressure line heater
OK: When the test is executed 10 times, the temperature increase of the urea line tube is felt.
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the urea line tube heater (A, B and/or C) (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. U0073 Reductant Control Module Communication Bus Off
Code No. U0073: DCU Communication Bus Off
 
 
cautionReplace DCU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • After 1 second have passed since the DCU was started.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the bus off error is detected.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector in CAN bus line
  • Failed DCU
  • External noise input
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check "Communication with DCU is not possible"
Check Inspection Procedure: Communication with DCU is not possible (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0073 set?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. U0100 Engine CAN timeout
Code No. U0100: Engine-ECU Time-out
 
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • Unable to receive engine-ECU signals through the CAN bus line for 2.5 seconds.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
This DTC can be checked only as a past malfunction.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and DCU and malfunction in the power supply system of DCU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions. (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed engine-ECU power supply circuit
  • Failed harness and connector in CAN bus line
  • Failed engine-ECU
  • Failed DCU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Erase the set diagnosis code. Then check end.s
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. U029D Lost Communication With NOx Sensor1
Code No. U029D: Lost Communication with No. 1 NOx Sensor
 
 
cautionReplace No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is more than 10 V.
  • After 1 second have passed since the DCU was started.
Judgement Criterion
  • Unable to receive No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor signals through the CAN bus line.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between DCU and No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, by malfunction in the power supply system of No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, in No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor itself, in DCU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between DCU and No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor and malfunction in the power supply system of No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions. (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor power supply circuit
  • Failed harness and connector in CAN bus line
  • Failed harness and connector in earth line (Between No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal No. 5 and body earth)
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between power supply terminal (terminal No. 1) and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to earth and open circuit in power supply line between engine control relay connector and No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector (terminal No. 1).
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between earth terminal (terminal No. 2) and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of open circuit and damage in earth line between No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector (terminal No. 2) and body earth.
 
STEP 3. Perform resistance measurement at No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between earth terminal (terminal No. 5) and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of open circuit and damage in earth line between No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector (terminal No. 5) and body earth.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between DCU connector terminal CANH and No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
Check CANH line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between DCU connector terminal CANL and No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
Check CANL line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U029D set?
Replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between DCU and No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. U029E Lost Communication With NOx Sensor2
Code No. U029E: Lost Communication with No. 2 NOx Sensor
 
 
cautionReplace No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is more than 10 V.
  • After 1 second have passed since the DCU was started.
Judgement Criterion
  • Unable to receive No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor signals through the CAN bus line.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between DCU and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, by malfunction in the power supply system of No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, in No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor itself, in DCU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between DCU and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor and malfunction in the power supply system of No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions. (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor power supply circuit
  • Failed harness and connector in CAN bus line
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between power supply terminal (terminal No. 1) and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to earth and open circuit in power supply line between engine control relay connector and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector (terminal No. 1).
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between earth terminal (terminal No. 2) and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of open circuit and damage in earth line between No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector (terminal No. 2) and body earth.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal CANH and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
Check CANH line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between DCU connector terminal CANL and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
Check CANL line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U029E set?
Replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between DCU and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. U02A3 Lost Communication With PM Sensor
Code No. U02A3: Lost Communication with PM Sensor
 
 
cautionReplace exhaust muffler PM sensor after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • Unable to receive exhaust muffler PM sensor signals through the CAN bus line for 2.5 seconds.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between DCU and exhaust muffler PM sensor, by malfunction in the power supply system of exhaust muffler PM sensor, in exhaust muffler PM sensor itself, in DCU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between DCU and exhaust muffler PM sensor and malfunction in the power supply system of exhaust muffler PM sensor. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions. (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor power supply circuit
  • Failed harness and connector in CAN bus line
  • Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at exhaust muffler PM sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between power supply terminal (terminal No. 4) and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to earth, and open circuit in power supply line between engine control relay connector and exhaust muffler PM sensor connector (terminal No. 4).
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at exhaust muffler PM sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between earth terminal (terminal No. 1) and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of open circuit, and damage in earth line between exhaust muffler PM sensor connector (terminal No. 1) and body earth.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between DCU connector terminal CANH and exhaust muffler PM sensor connector terminal
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
Check CANH line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between DCU connector terminal CANL and exhaust muffler PM sensor connector terminal
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
Check CANL line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U02A3 set?
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between DCU and exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. U0401 Engine (CAN message)
Code No. U0401: Engine-ECU (CAN Message)
 
 
cautionReplace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the communication data length error is judged between the DCU and the engine-ECU.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Data length failure input into DCU sent from engine-ECU through CAN communication.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector in CAN bus line
  • Failed engine-ECU
  • External noise input
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0401 set?
Replace engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Engine-ECU <4N14> ).
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and DCU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. U04A4 Invalid Data Received From PM Sensor
Code No. U04A4: Invalid Data Received from PM Sensor
 
 
cautionReplace exhaust muffler PM sensor after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the communication data length error is judged between the DCU and the exhaust muffler PM sensor.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Data length failure input into DCU sent from exhaust muffler PM sensor through CAN communication.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector in CAN bus line
  • Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor
  • External noise input
  • A component other than genuine parts is installed to the CAN bus line.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U04A4 set?
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between DCU and exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. U059E Invalid Data Received From NOx Sensor "A"
Code No. U059E: Invalid Data Received From No. 1 NOx Sensor
 
 
cautionReplace No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the communication error is judged between the DCU and the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Signal failure input into DCU sent from No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor through CAN communication.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector in CAN bus line
  • Failed No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
  • External noise input
  • A component other than genuine parts is installed to the CAN bus line.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check "Communication with DCU is not possible"
Check Inspection Procedure: Communication with DCU is not possible (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U059E set?
Replace No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between DCU and No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. U059F Invalid Data Received From NOx Sensor "B"
Code No. U059F: Invalid Data Received From No. 2 NOx Sensor
 
 
cautionReplace No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the communication error is judged between the DCU and the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Signal failure input into DCU sent from No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor through CAN communication.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector in CAN bus line
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor
  • External noise input
  • A component other than genuine parts is installed to the CAN bus line.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check "Communication with DCU is not possible"
Check Inspection Procedure: Communication with DCU is not possible (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U059F set?
Replace No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between DCU and No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. U05A4 PM Sensor Received Invalid Data From ENGINE
Code No. U05A4: PM Sensor Received Invalid Data from DCU
 
 
cautionReplace DCU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • DCU failure input into DCU sent from exhaust muffler PM sensor for 2 seconds.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
When the exhaust muffler PM sensor receives invalid data from the DCU, the exhaust muffler PM sensor sends a DCU abnormality signal to the DCU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector in CAN bus line
  • Failed DCU
  • Failed harness and connector of exhaust muffler PM sensor
  • Failed exhaust muffler PM sensor
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether any diagnosis code related to the CAN communication other than diagnosis code No. U05A4 is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether any diagnosis code related to the exhaust muffler PM sensor is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U05A4 set?
Replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between DCU and exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > CODE NO. U1350 SNA from Engine-ECU 1
Code No. U1350: SNA from Engine-ECU 1,
Code No. U1351: SNA from Engine-ECU 2,
Code No. U1352: SNA from Engine-ECU 3,
Code No. U1353: SNA from Engine-ECU 4,
Code No. U1354: SNA from Engine-ECU 5,
Code No. U1355: SNA from Engine-ECU 6,
Code No. U1356: SNA from Engine-ECU 7,
Code No. U1357: SNA from Engine-ECU 8,
Code No. U1358: SNA from Engine-ECU 9,
Code No. U1359: SNA from Engine-ECU 10,
Code No. U1360: SNA from Engine-ECU 11,
Code No. U1361: SNA from Engine-ECU 12,
Code No. U1362: SNA from Engine-ECU 13,
Code No. U1363: SNA from Engine-ECU 14,
Code No. U1364: SNA from Engine-ECU 15,
Code No. U1365: SNA from Engine-ECU 16,
Code No. U1366: SNA from Engine-ECU 17
 
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • DCU supply voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • After 1 second have passed since the DCU was started.
Judgement Criterion
  • Abnormal value input into DCU sent from engine-ECU through CAN communication.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The diesel fuel system may have a problem.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed diesel fuel system
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Perform the troubleshooting of the diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart For Diagnosis Code ).
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > SYMPTOM CHART
CHECK CHART FOR TROUBLE SYMPTOMS
Trouble symptomInspection procedure No.Reference page
Communication with DCU is not possible.Communication with no ECUs is possible (ENG-LOCAL CAN).1
Diagnose shorts in the power supply to ENG-LOCAL CAN.2
Diagnose shorts in the earth to ENG-LOCAL CAN.3
Diagnose shorts between CAN_H and CAN_L lines (ENG-LOCAL CAN).4
DCU power supply system (Communication between M.U.T.-III and DCU is not possible).5
The exhaust gas has an ammonia odour.6
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > COMMUNICATION WITH NO ECUS IS POSSIBLE (ENG-LOCAL CAN).
Inspection Procedure 1: Communication with No ECUs is Possible (ENG-LOCAL CAN).
 
 
cautionWhen servicing a CAN bus line, earth yourself by touching a metal object such as an unpainted water pipe. If you fail to do, a component connected to the CAN bus line may be broken.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction in ENG-LOCAL CAN (short to earth or power supply, wire short to one another)
  • Malfunction in the ECUs or sensors which are interconnected via ENG-LOCAL CAN (internal error) (DCU, Engine-ECU, No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, exhaust muffler PM sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN for short to power supply. Voltage measurement at No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Connect the negative battery terminal, and turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Voltage between No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal CAN_H and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(4) Voltage between No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal CAN_L and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position and disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
YES <Voltage is 4.0 V or less in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 2.
NO <Voltage is more than 4.0 V in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Check Inspection Procedure 2: Diagnose Shorts in The Power Supply to ENG-LOCAL CAN (Refer to ).
 
STEP 2. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN for short to earth. Resistance measurement at No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(3) Disconnect No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Resistance between No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal CAN_H and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
(5) Resistance between No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal CAN_L and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <Resistance value is 1 kΩ or more in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 3.
NO <Resistance value is less than 1 kΩ in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Check Inspection Procedure 3: Diagnose Shorts in The Earth to ENG-LOCAL CAN (Refer to .
 
STEP 3. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN for short to each other. Resistance measurement at No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(3) Resistance between No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor harness side connector terminal CAN_H and CAN_L.
OK: 60 ± 10 Ω
(4) Connect No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
NO <Resistance value is less than 60 ± 10 Ω> : Check Inspection Procedure 4: Diagnose Shorts Between CAN_H and CAN_L Lines (ENG-LOCAL CAN) (Refer to ).
NO <Resistance value is 1 kΩ or more> : Check the terminal resistors in the engine-ECU and the DCU for open circuit. Then repair or replace if necessary.
 
STEP 4. Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor for short to earth. Resistance measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(2) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 9 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
(4) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 20 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
(5) Connect joint connector (CAN4) connector.
Is the check result normal?
YES <Resistance value is 1 kΩ or more in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 5.
NO <Resistance value is less than 1 kΩ in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 5. Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor for short to power supply. Voltage measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Connect the negative battery terminal, and turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 9 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(4) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 20 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position and disconnect the negative battery terminal.
(6) Connect joint connector (CAN4).
Is the check result normal?
YES <Voltage is 4.0 V or less in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 6.
NO <Voltage is more than 4.0 V in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 6. Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor for short to each other. Resistance measurement at No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
cautionA digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and measure at the component side.
(2) Resistance between No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal CAN_H and CAN_L.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
Check Inspection Procedure 5: DCU Power Supply System (Communication Between M.U.T.-III and DCU is Not Possible) (Refer to ).
Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > DIAGNOSE SHORTS IN THE POWER SUPPLY TO ENG-LOCAL CAN.
Inspection Procedure 2: Diagnose Shorts in The Power Supply to ENG-LOCAL CAN.
 
 
cautionWhen servicing a CAN bus line, earth yourself by touching a metal object such as an unpainted water pipe. If you fail to do, a component connected to the CAN bus line may be broken.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT CONDITIONS
The M.U.T.-III judges the trouble when it is impossible to receive the periodically sent data and the voltage of CAN_H or CAN_L line is more than 4.0 V.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the wiring harness
  • Malfunction of the connector
  • Malfunction in the ECUs or sensors which are interconnected via ENG-LOCAL CAN (internal error) (DCU, Engine-ECU, No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, exhaust muffler PM sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN. Voltage measurement at DCU connector.
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
noteThis inspection allows you to check that there is a short to power supply in either CAN_H line or CAN_L line. Thus, in the following steps, check the ENG-LOCAL CAN that is defective.
(1) Disconnect engine-ECU connector and DCU connector, and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Connect the negative battery terminal, and turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Voltage between DCU connector terminal CAN_H and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(4) Voltage between DCU connector terminal CAN_L and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position and disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
YES <Voltage is 4.0 V or less in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 13.
NO <Voltage is more than 4.0 V in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN between joint connector (CAN4) and the DCU. Voltage measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • Strictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Connect the negative battery terminal, and turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 10 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(4) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 21 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position and disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
YES <Voltage is 4.0 V or less in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 3.
NO <Voltage is more than 4.0 V in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the DCU connector.
 
STEP 3. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN between joint connector (CAN4) and the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor. Voltage measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Connect the negative battery terminal, and turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 9 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(4) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 20 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position and disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
YES <Voltage is 4.0 V or less in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 6.
NO <Voltage is more than 4.0 V in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN (No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector disconnected)
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector and read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is NC.
Is all diagnosis reading result of the DCU NC?
Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN
(1) Read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is normal (other than NC).
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 6. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN between joint connector (CAN4) and the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor. Voltage measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Connect the negative battery terminal, and turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 8 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(4) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 19 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position and disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
YES <Voltage is 4.0 V or less in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 9.
NO <Voltage is more than 4.0 V in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN (No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector disconnected)
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector and read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is NC.
Is all diagnosis reading result of the DCU NC?
Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
Check the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN
(1) Read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is normal (other than NC).
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Check the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 9. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN between joint connector (CAN4) and the exhaust muffler PM sensor. Voltage measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Connect the negative battery terminal, and turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 7 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(4) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 18 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position and disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
YES <Voltage is 4.0 V or less in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 12.
NO <Voltage is more than 4.0 V in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Go to Step 10.
 
STEP 10. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN (exhaust muffler PM sensor connector disconnected)
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect exhaust muffler PM sensor connector and read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is NC.
Is all diagnosis reading result of the DCU NC?
Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector.
Check the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector is in good condition, go to Step 11.
 
STEP 11. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN
(1) Read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is normal (other than NC).
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Check the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector is in good condition, replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 12. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN between joint connector (CAN4) and the engine-ECU. Voltage measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • Strictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Connect the negative battery terminal, and turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 11 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(4) Voltage between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 22 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 4.0 V or less
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position and disconnect the negative battery terminal.
Is the check result normal?
YES <Voltage is 4.0 V or less in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Repair the joint connector (CAN4).
NO <Voltage is more than 4.0 V in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the engine-ECU connector.
 
STEP 13. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN (DCU connector disconnected)
(1) Disconnect DCU connector and read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is NC.
Is all diagnosis reading result of the DCU NC?
Go to Step 15.
Check the DCU connector, and repair if necessary. If the DCU connector is in good condition, go to Step 14.
 
STEP 14. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN
(1) Read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is normal (other than NC).
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
 
STEP 15. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN
(1) Read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is normal (other than NC).
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Check the engine-ECU connector, and repair if necessary. If the engine-ECU connector is in good condition, replace the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Engine-ECU <4N14>).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > DIAGNOSE SHORTS IN THE EARTH TO ENG-LOCAL CAN.
Inspection Procedure 3: Diagnose Shorts in The Earth to ENG-LOCAL CAN.
 
 
cautionWhen servicing a CAN bus line, earth yourself by touching a metal object such as an unpainted water pipe. If you fail to do, a component connected to the CAN bus line may be broken.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT CONDITIONS
The M.U.T.-III judges the trouble when it is impossible to receive the periodically sent data and the voltage of CAN_H or CAN_L line is less than 1.0 V.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the wiring harness
  • Malfunction of the connector
  • Malfunction in the ECUs or sensors which are interconnected via ENG-LOCAL CAN (internal error) (DCU, Engine-ECU, No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, exhaust muffler PM sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN. Resistance measurement at DCU connector.
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
noteThis inspection allows you to check that there is a short to earth in either CAN_H line or CAN_L line. Thus, in the following steps, check the ENG-LOCAL CAN that is defective.
(1) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(2) Disconnect engine-ECU connector and DCU connector, and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Resistance between DCU connector terminal CAN_H and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
(4) Resistance between DCU connector terminal CAN_L and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <Resistance value is 1 kΩ or more in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 13.
NO <Resistance value is less than 1 kΩ in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN between joint connector (CAN4) and the DCU. Resistance measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • Strictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(2) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 10 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
(4) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 21 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <Resistance value is 1 kΩ or more in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 3.
NO <Resistance value is less than 1 kΩ in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the DCU connector.
 
STEP 3. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN between joint connector (CAN4) and the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor. Resistance measurement at joint connector (CAN3).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(2) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 9 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
(4) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 20 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <Resistance value is 1 kΩ or more in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 6.
NO <Resistance value is less than 1 kΩ in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN (No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector disconnected)
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector and read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is NC.
Is all diagnosis reading result of the DCU NC?
Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN
(1) Read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is normal (other than NC).
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 6. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN between joint connector (CAN4) and the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor. Resistance measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(2) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 8 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
(4) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 19 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <Resistance value is 1 kΩ or more in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 9.
NO <Resistance value is less than 1 kΩ in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN (No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector disconnected)
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector and read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is NC.
Is all diagnosis reading result of the DCU NC?
Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
Check the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN
(1) Read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is normal (other than NC).
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Check the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 9. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN between joint connector (CAN4) and the exhaust muffler PM sensor. Resistance measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(2) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 7 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
(4) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 18 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <Resistance value is 1 kΩ or more in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Go to Step 12.
NO <Resistance value is less than 1 kΩ in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Go to Step 10.
 
STEP 10. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN (exhaust muffler PM sensor connector disconnected)
cautionStrictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Disconnect exhaust muffler PM sensor connector and read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is NC.
Is all diagnosis reading result of the DCU NC?
Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector.
Check the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector is in good condition, go to Step 11.
 
STEP 11. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN
(1) Read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is normal (other than NC).
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Check the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector is in good condition, replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 12. Check the ENG-LOCAL CAN between joint connector (CAN4) and the engine-ECU. Resistance measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • Strictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(2) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 11 (CAN_H) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
(4) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 22 (CAN_L) and body earth.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <Resistance value is 1 kΩ or more in both CAN_H and CAN_L> : Repair the joint connector (CAN4).
NO <Resistance value is less than 1 kΩ in either CAN_H or CAN_L> : Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the engine-ECU connector.
 
STEP 13. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN (DCU connector disconnected)
(1) Disconnect DCU connector and read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is NC.
Is all diagnosis reading result of the DCU NC?
Go to Step 15.
Check the DCU connector, and repair if necessary. If the DCU connector is in good condition, go to Step 14.
 
STEP 14. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN
(1) Read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is normal (other than NC).
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
 
STEP 15. Diagnose the ENG-LOCAL CAN
(1) Read all diagnosis with M.U.T.-III.
(2) Confirm that all diagnosis reading result of the DCU is normal (other than NC).
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Check the engine-ECU connector, and repair if necessary. If the engine-ECU connector is in good condition, replace the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Engine-ECU <4N14>).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > DIAGNOSE SHORTS BETWEEN CAN_H AND L LINES (ENG-LOCAL CAN).
Inspection Procedure 4: Diagnose Shorts Between CAN_H and CAN_L Lines (ENG-LOCAL CAN).
 
 
cautionWhen servicing a CAN bus line, earth yourself by touching a metal object such as an unpainted water pipe. If you fail to do, a component connected to the CAN bus line may be broken.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT CONDITIONS
When all of the following conditions are met, the M.U.T.-III determines that a short circuit is present between CAN_L and CAN_H lines.
  • The M.U.T.-III cannot receive the periodic transmission data from DCU.
  • The voltage between ENG-LOCAL CAN (CAN_L and CAN_H lines) is 1.0 V or more, 4.0 V or less.
  • The resistance at ENG-LOCAL CAN (CAN_L and CAN_H lines) is 2 Ω or less.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the wiring harness
  • Malfunction of the connector
  • Malfunction in the ECUs or sensors which are interconnected via ENG-LOCAL CAN (internal error) (DCU, Engine-ECU, No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor, exhaust muffler PM sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Connector check: joint connector (CAN4)
cautionThe strand end of the twist wire should be within 10 cm from the connector (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
When checking the joint connector (CAN4), ensure that its wiring harness side and its short pins are not damaged.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair a defective connector or replace the joint connector (CAN4).
 
STEP 2. Resistance measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(3) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 11 and No. 22.
OK: 120 ± 20 Ω
Is the check result normal?
YES <Within 120 ± 20 Ω> : Go to Step 4.
NO <Not within 120 ± 20 Ω> : Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Resistance measurement at engine-ECU connector.
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • Strictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Remove the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Engine-ECU <4N14>), and measure at the equipment side.
(2) Resistance between engine-ECU connector terminal LCAH and LCAL.
OK: 120 ± 20 Ω
Is the check result normal?
YES <Within 120 ± 20 Ω> : Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the engine-ECU connector.
NO <Not within 120 ± 20 Ω> : Check the engine-ECU connector, and repair if necessary. If the engine-ECU connector is in good condition, replace the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Engine-ECU <4N14>).
 
STEP 4. Resistance measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(3) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 9 and No. 20.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <1 kΩ or more> : Go to Step 6.
NO <Less than 1 kΩ > : Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Resistance measurement at No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • Strictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Remove the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ), and measure at the equipment side.
(2) Resistance between No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal No. 3 and No. 4.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <1 kΩ or more> : Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
NO <Less than 1 kΩ > : Check the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, replace the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 6. Resistance measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(3) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 8 and No. 19.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <1 kΩ or more> : Go to Step 8.
NO <Less than 1 kΩ > : Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Resistance measurement at No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • Strictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Remove the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ), and measure at the equipment side.
(2) Resistance between No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector terminal No. 3 and No. 4.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <1 kΩ or more> : Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector.
NO <Less than 1 kΩ > : Check the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connector is in good condition, replace the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 8. Resistance measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
