  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(3) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 7 and No. 18.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <1 kΩ or more> : Go to Step 10.
NO <Less than 1 kΩ > : Go to Step 9.
 
STEP 9. Resistance measurement at exhaust muffler PM sensor connector.
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • Strictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Remove the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ), and measure at the equipment side.
(2) Resistance between exhaust muffler PM sensor connector terminal No. 2 and No. 3.
OK: 1 kΩ or more
Is the check result normal?
YES <1 kΩ or more> : Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector.
NO <Less than 1 kΩ > : Check the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector, and repair if necessary. If the exhaust muffler PM sensor connector is in good condition, replace the exhaust muffler PM sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 10. Resistance measurement at joint connector (CAN4).
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • The test wiring harness should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • When measuring the resistance, disconnect the negative battery terminal (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Ensure that the negative battery terminal is disconnected.
(3) Disconnect joint connector (CAN4), and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Resistance between joint connector (CAN4) terminal No. 10 and No. 21.
OK: 120 ± 20 Ω
Is the check result normal?
YES <Within 120 ± 20 Ω> : Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
NO <Not within 120 ± 20 Ω> : Go to Step 11.
 
STEP 11. Resistance measurement at DCU connector.
caution
  • A digital multimeter should be used (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
  • Strictly observe the specified wiring harness repair procedure (For details refer to GROUP 54C - Service Precautions ).
(1) Remove the DCU (Refer to ), and measure at the equipment side.
(2) Resistance between DCU connector terminal No. 65 and No. 87.
OK: 120 ± 20 Ω
Is the check result normal?
YES <Within 120 ± 20 Ω> : Repair the wiring harness between joint connector (CAN4) and the DCU connector.
NO <Not within 120 ± 20 Ω> : Check the DCU connector, and repair if necessary. If the DCU connector is in good condition, replace the DCU (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > DCU POWER SUPPLY SYSTEM （COMMUNICATION BETWEEN M.U.T.-IIISE AND DCU IS NOT POSSIBLE.）
Inspection Procedure 5: DCU Power Supply System (Communication Between M.U.T.-III and DCU is Not Possible).
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The power voltage is supplied to the DCU connector terminals BAT1, BAT2 and BAT3 from the urea SCR relay.
  • The ignition switch-IG1 signal is inputted into the DCU connector terminal IGN.
  • The DCU connector terminal GND is earthed to the vehicle body.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit in ignition switch-IG1 circuit, DCU earth circuit or urea SCR relay circuit.
  • Failed urea SCR relay.
  • Failed DCU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check urea SCR relay itself
Urea SCR relay continuity check (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the battery.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at DCU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal IGN and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of open circuit in IGN line between DCU connector and J/B connector.
 
STEP 3. Perform resistance measurement at DCU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal GND and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of open circuit and damage in GND line between DCU connector and body earth.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between DCU connector terminal C/R and urea SCR relay connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between DCU connector terminal BAT1 and urea SCR relay connector terminal, between DCU connector terminal BAT2 and urea SCR relay connector terminal, between DCU connector terminal BAT3 and urea SCR relay connector terminal
Check power supply line for open circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between DCU connector terminal IGN and J/B connector terminal
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the DCU (Refer to ).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > THE EXHAUST GAS HAS AN AMMONIA ODOUR.
Inspection Procedure 6: The Exhaust Gas Has an Ammonia Odour.
 
 
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure could possibly be caused by too large amount of ammonia adsorbed by the SCR catalyst.
noteThere may be an ammonia odour in the following cases, but this is not a vehicle failure.
  • The DPF regeneration was performed without performing ammonia purge.
  • The ammonia purge is not performed when the DCU is replaced.
  • The learned value is not written when the DCU is replaced.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The exhaust gas temperature when the ammonia is adsorbed is higher than the appropriate temperature.
  • There is a difference between the amount of ammonia adsorption estimated by the DCU and the real amount of ammonia adsorption.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Carry out the relevant troubleshooting for the set diagnosis code (Refer to ). Then warm up the engine, and race the engine. If there is an ammonia odour, perform ammonia purge (Refer to ).
Perform ammonia purge (Refer to ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > DATA LIST REFERENCE TABLE
DATA LIST REFERENCE TABLE
 
 
Item No.Inspection ItemInspection conditionNormal condition
1Ignition statusIgnition switch: "ON" positionON
2Battery voltageIgnition switch: "ON" positionSystem voltage
5SCR state machineDuring the initial check immediately after the startup.Initial
Under stand-by status after the initial check is completed.Standby
The pressure control is not started (waiting for the exhaust gas temperature to rise, defrosting the urea water, etc.).No pressure control
During pressure control.Pressure control
During pressure reduction control.Pressure reduction
During the shut-off process after the ignition switch is turned to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.Key OFF
The AdBlue™ is being returned.Purge
The test item "DPF regeneration or Pump first filling" of the special function by the M.U.T.-III is in progress.Service test
Plausibility check of the pressure model value is in progress.Plausibility check
While the engine is stopped due to the activation of the AS&G.Engine stop (AS&G)
Other than above.-
6SCR sub state machineOther than below.-
The AdBlue™ is being returned by turning the ignition switch from "ON" to "LOCK" (OFF) position (initial stage).Pre-Emptying
The AdBlue™ is being returned by turning the ignition switch from "ON" to "LOCK" (OFF) position.Emptying
During shut-off waiting.Shutoff waiting
During the pressure feeding of AdBlue™.Pressure build-up
During the pressure feeding of AdBlue™ (The ventilation of the urea piping).Ventilation
The pressure feeding of AdBlue™ is completed (injection is permitted).Metering control
While the engine is stopped due to the activation of the AS&G.Engine stop (AS&G)
The AdBlue™ is being returned.Purge (17), Purge (18), Purge (19), Purge (20), Purge (21), Purge (22), Purge (27)
During pressure reduction control.Pressure reduce (28), Pressure reduce (29), Pressure reduce (30), Pressure reduce (31) or Pressure reduce (32)
10SCR relay control status (Sensor)Immediately after the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position.Open
Other than above.Close
11SCR relay control status (Supply pump)Immediately after the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position.Open
Other than above.Close
12SCR relay control status (Back flow pump)Immediately after the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position.Open
Other than above.Close
13Urea tank heater power stage statusOther than below.OFF
  • When the urea tank temperature is less than -7°C.
  • Within a predetermined time after the engine is started.
ON
14Pressure line heater power stage statusOther than below.OFF
  • When the urea tank temperature is less than -7°C.
  • Within a predetermined time after the engine is started.
ON
15Supply pump power stage statusOther than below.OFF
  • Start the engine when the urea tank temperature is more than -7°C.
  • SCR temperature: 150°C or more
ON
16Back flow pump power stage statusOther than below.OFF
  • After item No. 5: SCR state machine has changed to "Pressure control" while the engine is running.
  • When the ignition switch is turned to the "LOCK" (OFF) position from the "ON" position.
ON
17Defrost check (Tank/Line)Other than below.Not completed
After item No. 13: Urea tank heater power stage status and item No. 14: Pressure line heater power stage status have changed from ON to OFF.Completed
21NOx sensor (UP) heater release statusOther than below.OFF
Engine: After warm-up, idle operation (After the dew point is reached).ON
22NOx sensor (DOWN) heater release statusOther than below.OFF
Engine: After warm-up, idle operation (After the dew point is reached).ON
28PM sensor status information (Dewpoint end reached)Other than below.OFF
Engine: After warm-up, idle operation (After the dew point is reached).ON
30Engine speedRefer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data list reference table .
31Vehicle speedRunning at 40 km/hApproximately 40 km/h
32Engine coolant temperatureRefer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data list reference table .
42Over run flagOther than below.OFF
During fuel cut by deceleration of the vehicle.ON
43Boost pressureRefer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data list reference table .
44Air flow rateRefer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data list reference table .
45EGR rateRefer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data list reference table .
46EGR valve rateRefer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data list reference table .

Running-9.8 to 9.8 m/s2

Running-9.8 to 9.8 m/s2

Depress the accelerator pedal gradually.Increases in response to the pedal depression stroke
Depress the accelerator pedal fully.98% or more

62Ambient pressureIgnition switch: "ON" positionAltitude: 0 m1,010 hPa
Altitude: 600 m950 hPa
Altitude: 1,200 m880 hPa
Altitude: 1,800 m810 hPa
63Throttle value rateRefer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data list reference table .
65PM sensor temperatureEngine: Idling after warming up the engineWhen the exhaust gas temperature at the upstream of the SCR is 150°C.150°C or less
When the exhaust gas temperature at the upstream of the SCR is 300°C.300°C or less
When the exhaust gas temperature at the upstream of the SCR is 450°C.450°C or less
When the exhaust gas temperature at the upstream of the SCR is 600°C.600°C or less
When the exhaust gas temperature at the upstream of the SCR is 750°C.750°C or less
74Online dosing modeEngine: Idle operationOther than below.OFF
During on-line dosing*1ON
75SCR adaptation statusIgnition switch: "ON" positionOther than belowNot active
During adaptation*2Active
note
  • *1: The on-line dosing is a mode that injects AdBlue™ needed for eliminating all the NOx detected by the No.1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor.
  • *2: Adaptation is a learning which corrects the difference between the NOx reduction efficiency calculated from the output values of the No. 1 exhaust muffler NOx sensor and the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor and the NOx reduction efficiency estimated by the DCU, when the difference is caused by the influence of deterioration of the urea injector.
 
 
DCU Monitorring Items
  • This monitor item includes useful items for understanding the urea SCR system controlled by the DCU.
  • It is hard to show the definite specification of each item. Therefore, this document describes the check conditions, display range, and behaviour of numeric values only.

17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA SCR TROUBLESHOOTING<4N14> > ACTUATOR TEST REFERENCE TABLE
ACTUATOR TEST REFERENCE TABLE
Item No.Check itemDrive contentsInspection conditionsValue to be determined as normal
2Pressure line heaterTurn the urea line tube heater ONIgnition switch: "ON" positionEnergise the urea line tube heater for approximately 10 seconds.*1
3Urea tank heaterTurn the urea tank heater ONIgnition switch: "ON" positionEnergise the urea tank heater for approximately 10 seconds.*2
4Back flow pumpActivate the back flow pump at the set output value.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Set the output value to 70%
Operating noise is heard.
5Supply pumpSupply pump is driven.Ignition switch: "ON" positionOperating noise is heard.
note
  • *1: When the test is executed 10 times, the temperature increase of the urea line tube is felt by touching the urea line tube with your fingers.
  • *2: When the test is executed 10 times, data list item No. 7: Urea tank temperature rises by 0.1°C to 0.2°C, compared to the temperature before the test.

noteThe voltage cannot be measured because the DCU uses connectors which cannot be backprobed. This list is only for reference.

  • Ignition switch: "ON" position

66IGNPower supply (Ignition switch: IG1)Ignition switch: "ON" positionSystem voltage
 
 
Check Chart for Resistance and Continuity Between Terminals
1. Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
2. Disconnect the DCU connector.
3.
cautionIf the terminals that should be checked are mistaken, or if connector terminals are not correctly shorted to earth, damage may be caused to the vehicle wiring, sensors, DCU and/or ohmmeter. Be careful to prevent this!
Measure the resistance and check for continuity between the terminals of the DCU harness-side connector while referring to the check chart.
note
  • When measuring resistance and checking continuity, a harness for checking contact pin pressure should be used instead of inserting a test probe.
  • Checking need not be carried out in the order given in the chart.
4. If the ohmmeter shows any deviation from the standard value, check the corresponding sensor, actuator and related electrical wiring, and the repair or replace.
5. After repair or replacement, recheck with the ohmmeter to confirm that the repair or replacement has corrected the problem.
Terminal No.Terminal codeInspection ItemStandard value, normal condition (Check condition)
8 to 74INJ+ to INJ-Urea injector assembly11.4 to 12.6 Ω (at 20°C)
29 to 51MCPS to MCPDSupply pump3.62 to 4.51 Ω (at 25°C)
33 to 72PPS to PPDBack flow pump3.62 to 4.51 Ω (at 25°C)
4 to Body earthGND to Body earthDCU earthContinuity (2 Ω or less)
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > SCR<4N14> > SCR REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
 
 
cautionAfter urea SCR system related parts are replaced, use the M.U.T.-III to execute each command by referring to action to be taken when urea SCR system related parts are replaced (Refer to ).
Pre-removal and Post-installation Operation
  • Under Skid Plate and Engine Room Under Cover Front Removal and Installation (Refer to GROUP 51 - Under Cover ).
  • Main Muffler Removal and Installation (Refer to GROUP 15 - Main Muffler <4N14> ).
Removal steps
1.Harness protector
2.Exhaust muffler PM sensor connection
<<A>>>>A<<3.No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor connection
4.Exhaust centre pipe (integrated with SCR)
5.Gasket
6.Hanger
 
 
REMOVAL SERVICE POINT
 
 
<<A>> NO. 2 EXHAUST MUFFLER NOx SENSOR REMOVAL
Use special tool oxygen sensor wrench (MB991953) to remove the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor.
 
 
 
 
INSTALLATION SERVICE POINT
 
 
>>A<< NO. 2 EXHAUST MUFFLER NOx SENSOR INSTALLATION
In the same manner as removal, use special tool oxygen sensor wrench (MB991953) to tighten the No. 2 exhaust muffler NOx sensor to the specified torque.
Tightening torque: 60 ± 10 N·m
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA INJECTOR, UREA FEED TUBE<4N14> > UREA INJECTOR, UREA FEED TUBE REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
 
 
caution
  • After urea SCR system related parts are replaced, use the M.U.T.-III to execute each command by referring to action to be taken when urea SCR system related parts are replaced (Refer to ).
  • Put the disconnected pipes and connectors in a plastic bag respectively to prevent dust from adhering to them.
  • If any AdBlue™ gets on painted surfaces, wash it off immediately with clean water.
  • If the AdBlue™ is adhered to the vehicle, wipe the area with a wet cloth.
Pre-removal Operation
  • Reduce Pressurized Urea Pressure (Refer to ).
  • Under Skid Plate and Engine Room Under Cover Front A and B Removal (Refer to GROUP 51 - Under Cover ).
Post-installation Operation
  • Under Skid Plate and Engine Room Under Cover Front A and B Installation (Refer to GROUP 51 - Under Cover ).
Urea injector removal steps
1.Urea line tube A connection
>>A<<2.Urea line clamp
3.Urea line gasket
4.Urea injector assembly
Urea feed tube removal steps
5.Urea line tube A
6.Urea line tube B
 
 
INSTALLATION SERVICE POINT
 
 
>>A<< UREA LINE CLAMP INSTALLATION
Close the clamp hook of the urea line clamp until it is locked, then tighten it to the specified torque.
Tightening torque: 4.7 ± 0.4 N·m

17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA TANK<4N14> > UREA TANK REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION

caution
  • After urea SCR system related parts are replaced, use the M.U.T.-III to execute each command by referring to action to be taken when urea SCR system related parts are replaced (Refer to ).
  • Put the disconnected pipes and connectors in a plastic bag respectively to prevent dust from adhering to them.
  • If any AdBlue™ gets on painted surfaces, wash it off immediately with clean water.
  • If the AdBlue™ is adhered to the vehicle, wipe the area with a wet cloth.

  • Rear Bumper Assembly Installation (Refer to GROUP 51 - Rear Bumper ).
  • Refilling AdBlue™ (Refer to ).
Removal steps
1.Urea line tube B connection
2.Urea tank harness connector connection
3.Urea leveling tube assembly connection
4.Urea ventilation tube assembly connection
5.Urea filler hose C assembly connection
<<A>>•Draining AdBlue™ <only at removal>
6.Self locking flange &shy;&shy;&shy;&shy;nut
7.Urea tank and protector assembly
 
 
REMOVAL SERVICE POINT
 
 
<<A>> DRAINING AdBlue™
After disconnect the urea filler hose C, insert a hand pump to the urea tank assembly, and drain AdBlue™ as much as possible.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > EMISSION CONTROL <DIESEL> > UREA TANK<4N14> > UREA TANK DISASSEMBLY AND REASSEMBLY
DISASSEMBLY AND REASSEMBLY
 
 
cautionThe removed urea pump can be reassembled up to 3 times. To count the number of urea pump reassembly, record it by adding the reassembly number of this time (once usually) to the previous number of reassembly written on the maintenance handbook. When the number of the previous reassembly reaches 3 or when the urea pump is replaced, always use a new urea pump. At that time, write "New (0 times)" in the maintenance handbook.
Urea pump disassembly steps
1.Urea tank protector (right side lower)
3.Urea tank protector (left side)
4.Urea tank protector (pump and tube)
5.Urea line tube C connection
6.Urea tank harness connector connection
>>A<<7.Urea pump
Urea tank assembly disassembly steps
1.Urea tank protector (right side lower)
2.Urea tank protector (right side upper)
3.Urea tank protector (left side)
4.Urea tank protector (pump and tube)
8.Urea line tube C
9.Urea tank harness
10.Urea tank protector (under)
11.Urea tank assembly
 
 
REASSEMBLY SERVICE POINT
 
 
>>A<< UREA PUMP INSTALLATION
1. Install the urea pump unit with the collar and rubber mount using the bolt.
2. Tighten the bolt of the urea pump to the specified torque.
Tightening torque: 5.75 ± 0.4 N·m
3. Wait for 120 seconds, then check that the bolt is tighten to the specified torque (tighten additionally).

17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > GENERAL INFORMATION
GENERAL INFORMATION
 
 
AUTO STOP & GO (AS&G) SYSTEM
The purpose of the Auto Stop & Go (AS&G) system is to reduce CO2 exhaust gases from vehicles. The AS&G system automatically should stop the engine when the vehicle is stopped. And also the system should automatically restart the engine when the vehicle is started. The AS&G-ECU judges whether the engine should be stopped or restarted. The AS&G-ECU also stops or restarts the engine. The AS&G-ECU monitors the vehicle condition by using the signals from sensors and each ECU. If the specified conditions are satisfied, the AS&G-ECU should send the engine stop request signal to the engine-ECU via CAN. When receiving the signal, the engine-ECU should stop the engine (auto stop). When the driver depresses the clutch pedal during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should turn on the starter relay and the starter cut relay to drive the starter, also should send the engine start request signal to the engine-ECU via CAN bus line <M/T>. When receiving the signal, the engine-ECU should stop the engine (auto stop). When the driver release the brake pedal during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should turn on the starter relay to drive the starter, also should send the engine start request signal to the engine-ECU via CAN bus line <A/T>. When receiving the signal, the engine-ECU should restart the engine (auto start).
 
 
System Configuration Diagram
<M/T>
<A/T>
 
 
1. Auto Stop & Go (AS&G) System
When the ignition switch is turned "ON" position or when the engine starts, the AS&G system should automatically be turned ON. The driver can turn OFF the AS&G system by pressing the AS&G OFF switch. At that time, the AS&G OFF display screen should be turned ON in the multi-information display of the combination meter. When the AS&G OFF switch is pressed again, the AS&G system should be turned ON.
 

 
 
2. Auto Stop Control
The engine-ECU will stop the engine when the following operation is performed while the AS&G display screen illuminates in the multi-information display of the combination meter.
 
 
 
<M/T>
  1. While letting the vehicle run and perfectly stop, depress the clutch pedal to place the gearshift lever in the neutral position.
  2. Release the clutch pedal.
During the auto stop, the AS&G indicator is turned ON in the combination meter. When one or more of following conditions are satisfied, the AS&G-ECU should prohibit the auto stop.
  • After the key is used to start the engine, approximately 30 seconds have not been taken.
  • The accelerator pedal is depressed.
  • If the vehicle is stopped again within approximately 10 seconds of the engine auto start.
  • More than the vehicle speed of approximately 5 km/h is not detected even once after the engine start, including the engine start of the auto start.
  • The auto stop prohibition signal is received from the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - General Information ).
  • The auto stop prohibition signal is received from the A/C-ECU.
  • The auto stop prohibition signal is received from the transfer-ECU <4WD>.
  • The vacuum pressure of the brake booster is less than specified value.
  • The engine-ECU detects an abnormality in the AS&G system.
  • The AS&G-ECU detects an abnormality in the AS&G system.
  • The driver's seat belt is unfastened.
  • The hood is opened.
  • The driver’s door is opened.
  • The ambient temperature is lower than approximately 0°C
  • The steering wheel is being steered.
  • Parking on steep hill.
 
 
<A/T>
  1. Depress the brake pedal when the vehicle is running to stop the vehicle ("D" range transmission).
  2. If the brake pedal is depressed continuously when the vehicle has completely stopped, the engine will automatically stop.
During the auto stop, the AS&G display screen should be turned ON in the multi-information display of the combination meter. When one or more of following conditions are satisfied, the AS&G-ECU should prohibit the auto stop.
  • After the key/engine switch is used to start the engine, approximately 30 seconds have not been taken.
  • The accelerator pedal is depressed.
  • If the vehicle is stopped again within approximately 10 seconds of the engine auto start.
  • More than the vehicle speed of approximately 5 km/h is not detected even once after the engine start, including the engine start of the auto start.
  • The vacuum pressure of the brake booster is less than specified value.
  • The brake fluid pressure is less than the specified value.
  • The driver's seat belt is unfastened.
  • The hood is opened.
  • The driver’s door is opened.
  • The parking brakes are applied.
  • The steering wheel is being steered.
  • The vehicle slant angle is more than specified value.
  • The ambient temperature is lower than approximately 0°C.
  • The AS&G-ECU detects an abnormality in the AS&G system.
  • The auto stop prohibition signal is received from each ECU with the conditions described in the following table.
ECUAuto stop prohibition condition
Engine-ECU
  • Engine coolant temperature: 50°C or less
  • During the battery charging
  • Battery deterioration is detected
  • Battery temperature: 80° or less, -5°C or more
  • The engine-ECU detects abnormality
A/T-ECU
  • A/T fluid temperature: 21°C or less, 107°C or more
  • Change gear ratio: Not in Low state
  • A speed of 5 km/h or more is never detected
  • 5 seconds have not passed after auto start
  • The A/T-ECU detects abnormality
Transfer-ECU <4WD>The transfer-ECU detects abnormality
ASTC-ECU
  • The ASTC-ECU detects abnormality
  • Hill Decent Control (HDC) function is in operation. <Vehicles with HDC function>
A/C-ECU
  • When the following are not set while the blower fan is "ON":
    1. Engine coolant temperature: Less than the specified temperature (changed by ambient temperature)
    2. Ambient temperature: Less than the specified temperature
    3. Room temperature: Outside the specified value range
    4. Evaporator temperature: More than the specified temperature (changed by ambient temperature)
  • The defroster mode is set
  • The temperature adjustment dial is set to the lowest or highest temperature
 
 
3. Auto Start Control
cautionIf the following motions are carried out during the auto stop even one time, the AS&G-ECU should blink the AS&G display screen in the multi-information display of the combination meter and prohibits the auto start. Even if trying to return to the previous status after that, the auto start should be prohibited. When restarted, the engine must be started by the key/engine switch.
  • In case the hood is opened
noteWhen in the states mentioned above, the AS&G-ECU should send the signal to the ETACS-ECU via the CAN to sound the warning buzzer built into the ETACS-ECU. This warns the driver that this is different from normal use.
 
 
Normal auto start <M/T>
When the driver depresses the clutch pedal during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should turn on the starter relay and the starter cut relay to drive the starter, also should send the engine start request signal to the engine-ECU via CAN bus line. When receiving the signal, the engine-ECU should restart the engine. When the engine starts, the AS&G display screen in the multi-information display of the combination meter should go off. When the following conditions are satisfied during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should prohibit the auto start.
  • AS&G system: OFF*
  • Gearshift lever position: except neutral position
note*: Pressing the AS&G OFF switch again to turn ON the AS&G system can enable the auto start.
 
 
Normal auto start <A/T>
Depending on the driver's operation, the AS&G-ECU turns off the AS&G display screen that was displayed in the multi-information display of the combination meter while quickly starting the engine. Auto start should function either by brake pedal or accelerator pedal operation. Auto start conditions are as follows:
Selector leverBrake pedalAccelerator pedal
"P" positionReleased then depressed againDepressed
"R" positionAuto start functions regardless of pedal state
"N" positionReleasedDepressed
"D" positionReleasedDepressed
note
  • If the selector lever is moved from "D" position to outside "D" position, and then back to "D" position again, the engine will the engine will perform auto start.
  • *: The engine does not start automatically even if the brake pedal is released.
 
 
Forcible auto start <M/T>
When one of the following conditions is satisfied during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should send the engine start request signal to the engine-ECU for starting the engine swiftly despite the driver's determination. Also, the AS&G-ECU should turn on the starter relay and the starter cut relay to drive the starter. At that time, the AS&G display screen in the multi-information display of the combination meter should go off as well as the normal auto start.
  • The vehicle speed is more than 3 km/h.
  • The steering wheel is being steered.
  • The vacuum pressure of the brake booster is less than specified value.
  • The engine start request signal is received from the A/C-ECU.
  • The engine start request signal is received from the engine-ECU.
  • The AS&G-ECU detects an abnormality in the AS&G system.
  • The driver's seat belt is unfastened.
  • The driver's door is opened.
  • HDC switch is turned on.
When the following conditions are satisfied during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should prohibit the forcible auto start.
  • AS&G system: OFF*
  • Gearshift lever position: except neutral position
note*: Pressing the AS&G OFF switch again to turn ON the AS&G system can enable the forcible auto start.
 
 
Forcible auto start <A/T>
When one of the following conditions is satisfied during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should send the engine start request signal to the engine-ECU for starting the engine swiftly despite the driver's determination. Also, the AS&G-ECU should turn on the starter relay to drive the starter. At that time, the AS&G display screen in the multi-information display of the combination meter should go off as well as the normal auto start.
  • The vehicle speed is more than 3 km/h.
  • The steering wheel is being steered.
  • The driver's door is opened.
  • The driver's seat belt is unfastened.
  • The vacuum pressure of the brake booster is less than specified value.
  • The AS&G-ECU detects an abnormality in the AS&G system.
  • The engine start request signal is received from each ECU with the conditions described in the following table. engine start request signal
ECUEngine start request condition
Engine-ECU
  • The battery's charge state has deteriorated
  • Vehicle electrical load has increased
  • The engine-ECU detects abnormality
A/T-ECUThe A/T-ECU detects abnormality
Transfer-ECU <4WD>The transfer-ECU detects abnormality
ASTC-ECU
  • The ASTC-ECU detects abnormality
  • HDC switch is turned on. <Vehicles with HDC function>
A/C-ECU
  • A/C: "OFF" to "ON"
  • The defroster mode is set
  • The temperature adjustment dial is set to the lowest or highest temperature
 
 
4. Control for Increasing Voltage
At the auto start, the AS&G-ECU sends the increasing voltage request signal to the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). When receiving the signal, the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) should temporarily switch the relay in the unit to the voltage converter of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). The voltage converter increases the battery voltage dropping during cranking to 12.2 V. This can prevent the jumpy sound of the audio equipment due to the battery voltage drop at the auto start. The DC/DC converter (entertainment system) should stop increasing the voltage when the input voltage returns to 12.2 V. There is a DC/DC converter (entertainment system) in both the control system and the entertainment system. The control system controls the power supply voltage of the A/T-ECU and ASTC-ECU. <A/T> The entertainment system controls the power voltage supply of Mitsubishi Multi Communication System (MMCS), audio, etc.
 
 
5. AS&G System Indicator Control
The AS&G-ECU sends the signal to the combination meter via CAN bus line, corresponding to the operation of the AS&G system. The combination meter that received the signal turns ON or blinks the AS&G display screen or AS&G OFF display screen. Then the AS&G system status is informed to the driver.

AS&G systemConditionMulti-information display
AS&G display screen or AS&G OFF display screen
OFFIgnition switch: "ON" position (engine is stopped.); After several seconds are taken"AS&G OFF" displayed
During engine running"AS&G OFF" displayed
ONIgnition switch: "ON" position (engine is stopped.); After several seconds are taken-
During idling and driving
(The auto stop operation standby incomplete)
-
During idling and driving
(The auto stop operation standby complete)
"AS&G" displayed
During auto stop"AS&G" displayed
Hood is opened"AS&G" blinked
During auto stop, hood is opened"AS&G" blinked
Driver's seat belt is unfastened"AS&G" blinked
Driver's door is opened"AS&G" blinked
During auto stop, shift lever is operated*1 <M/T>"AS&G" blinked
During auto stop, selector lever is placed on "P" position and brake pedal is released <A/T>"AS&G" blinked
AS&G system is abnormal*2"AS&G OFF" blinked
ON/OFFAfter ignition switch "ON" position; for several seconds"AS&G OFF" displayed
note
  • *1: When detecting that the gearshift lever is in other than neutral position during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should send the request signal to the combination meter via the CAN bus line to sound the warning buzzer. When receiving the signal, the combination meter should sound the built-in warning buzzer. This warns the driver about the dangerous operation, prohibiting the auto start.
  • *2 <M/T>: The AS&G-ECU or the engine-ECU may detect a diagnosis code. Check whether the each ECU detects a diagnosis code or not.
  • *2 <A/T>: The AS&G-ECU, engine-ECU, A/T-ECU or ASTC-ECU may detect a diagnosis code. Check whether the each ECU detects a diagnosis code or not.
 
 
 
6. Starter Relay Control <M/T>
At normal engine start
  • When the following signals are input, the AS&G-ECU should turn ON the both of the power transistor of the starter cut relay in the unit and the power transistor of the starter relay in the unit. This allows the starter cut relay and the starter relay to be turned ON, and then the starter is driven. If the immobilizer result checking has some discrepancy, the output to the starter relay should be turned OFF. The starter, therefore, should not be driven.
    • Ignition switch-"ST" signal
    • Clutch interlock switch ON signal (the clutch pedal is fully depressed)
At engine start from auto stop status
  • When detecting one of the following conditions during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should turn ON the both of the power transistor of the starter cut relay in the unit and the power transistor of the starter relay in the unit. This allows the starter cut relay and the starter relay to be turned ON, and then the starter is driven.
    • Neutral position switch: ON; Clutch monitoring switch: ON (the clutch pedal is depressed.)
    • Neutral position switch: ON and the conditions of the forcible auto start are satisfied
 
 
6. Starter Relay Control <A/T>
At normal engine start
  • When the following signals are input, the AS&G-ECU should turn ON the power transistor of the starter relay in the unit. This allows the starter relay to be turned ON, and then the starter is driven. If the immobilizer result checking has some discrepancy, the output to the starter relay should be turned OFF. The starter, therefore, should not be driven.
    • Ignition switch-ST signal
    • Transmission: "P" or "N" position
At engine start from auto stop status
  • When detecting the conditions for auto start during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should turn ON the power transistor of the starter relay in the unit. This allows the starter relay to be turned ON, and then the starter is driven.
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SPECIAL TOOL(S)
SPECIAL TOOL(S)
ToolNumberNameUse
-MB992744
MB992745

  • b: MB991220
  • c: MB991221
  • d: MB991222

  • a: Check harness
  • b: LED harness
  • c: LED harness adaptor
  • d: Probe
Making voltage and resistance measurement during troubleshooting
  • a: Connector pin contact pressure inspection
  • b: Power circuit inspection
  • c: Power circuit inspection
  • d: Commercial tester connection
MB992006Extra fine probeMaking voltage and resistance measurement during troubleshooting
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS TROUBLESHOOTING FLOW
DIAGNOSIS TROUBLESHOOTING FLOW
Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, Contents of Troubleshooting .
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS FUNCTION
DIAGNOSIS FUNCTION
 
 
AS&G OFF DISPLAY SCREEN
When the AS&G OFF switch is depressed, the AS&G system should be turned OFF and the AS&G OFF display screen in the multi-information display of the combination meter be turned ON. When the following items in the table, related to the AS&G system, are abnormal, the AS&G OFF display screen should blink. When the AS&G OFF display screen continues to blink, check the output of the diagnosis code. After the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position, the AS&G OFF display screen should be turned ON for several seconds so that the display can be checked for the normal operation.
noteWhen the engine-ECU or A/T-ECU detects a diagnosis code, the AS&G OFF display screen is also blinked.

Item to blink AS&G OFF display screen
Code No.Diagnosis item
B1353*1DC/DC converter (control system) control circuit <A/T>
B1355*2AS&G functional error <A/T>
B1356DC/DC converter (control system) diag output line <A/T>
C0047Brake vacuum sensor circuit
C1101Barometric pressure sensor circuit
P081DNeutral position switch circuit <M/T>
P0830Clutch monitoring switch circuit <M/T>
P0833Clutch interlock switch circuit <M/T>
P1612*1Starter relay for auto start <A/T>
U0001*1Bus off
U0100*1Engine-ECU time-out
U0101*1A/T-ECU time-out <A/T>
U0114*1Transfer-ECU time-out <4WD>
U0121*1ASTC-ECU time-out
U0126*1Steering wheel sensor time-out
U0141*1ETACS-ECU time-out
U1180*1Combination meter time-out
U1210Brake lamp switch status error <A/T>
U1211*1Engine parity/toggle bit error <A/T>
U1212*1A/T parity/toggle bit error <A/T>
U1213*1ASTC parity/toggle bit error <A/T>
U1214*1ETACS parity/toggle bit error <A/T>
noteWhen detecting a malfunction, the AS&G-ECU should store it. When detecting the same malfunction again after the next engine start, the AS&G-ECU should blink the AS&G indicator because the AS&G-ECU judges the malfunction surely occurs. For the items marked with a "*" in the diagnosis code number column, the AS&G OFF indicator blinks on the first detection of the malfunction.
 
 
 
AS&G DISPLAY SCREEN
When the specified conditions are satisfied during the engine operation, the AS&G-ECU should send engine stop request signal to the engine-ECU and the engine-ECU should stop the engine. The AS&G display screen in the multi-information display will come on when the AS&G system is ready to activate or has activated with the engine running.If the following items in the table, related to the AS&G system, are applied, the AS&G display screen should blink. When the AS&G display screen continues to blink, carry out the check according to the applied item. After the ignition switch is turned "ON" position, the AS&G OFF display screen in the multi-information display of the combination meter should be turned ON for several seconds so that the indicator can be checked for the normal operation.
Items to blink AS&G display screen
ItemsInspection contents
The driver’s door is opened.Check the driver’s door is securely closed.
The hood is opened.Check the hood is securely closed. Use the key/engine switch to start the engine because the auto start should be prohibited if the hood is opened during the auto stop.
The driver’s seat belt is unfastened.Check the driver’s seat belt is securely fastened.
The gearshift lever is operated during the auto stop (The combination meter sounds the warning buzzer except the neutral position). <M/T>Check the gearshift lever is in the neutral position.
During auto stop, selector lever is placed on "P" position and brake pedal is released. <A/T>Check the selector lever is in the "P" position. In addition, auto start enable when the brake pedal depressed again or do the selector lever any place other than "P".
 
 
 
METHOD OF READING AND ERASING DIAGNOSIS CODES
Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, Diagnosis Function .
 
 
 
INSPECTION WITH M.U.T.-III DATA LIST
Reading data list using M.U.T.-III enables you to check the vehicle body harnesses and components for abnormalities. Sensor input or output to the actuator can be displayed in numerical values or graphs in the data list.
 
 
Diagnosis Procedure
1.
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
After the ignition switch is in "LOCK" (OFF) position, connect the M.U.T.-III to the diagnosis connector.
2. Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
3. Select "AS&G" from system select screen of the M.U.T.-III.
4. Select "Data List" from AS&G screen.
5. Use the data list function to perform the check (Refer to ).
6. If any abnormality is found, inspect and repair vehicle body harnesses and components.
7. After repair, check that input and output have returned to normal.
8. If a diagnosis code which is caused by inspection and repair work is generated, erase the diagnosis code.
9. Perform a test run to check that the malfunction phenomenon is resolved.
 
 
 
FREEZE FRAME DATA
When the AS&G-ECU detects a malfunction and sets a diagnosis code, it also stores a current status of the engine. This function is called "Freeze frame data". By analysing this "Freeze frame data" with the M.U.T.-III, an effective troubleshooting can be performed.The display items of freeze frame data are shown below.
Display item list
Item No.Date itemUnit
1Odometerkm
2Ignition cycletimes
4Accumulated minute*min
note*: Accumulated time of current malfunction from time point when malfunction is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The control is carried out, which keeps the safety driving by the preset control logic when the diagnosis code is set. The diagnosis code having the fail-safe function is as follows.
List of fail-safe and backup function items
Code No.Diagnosis itemControl content during malfunction
B1351DC/DC converter (control system) performance <A/T>In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
B1352DC/DC converter (control system) system <A/T>
B1353DC/DC converter (control system) control circuit <A/T>
B1355AS&G functional error <A/T>
B1356DC/DC converter (control system) diag output line <A/T>In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited.
C0047Brake vacuum sensor circuitIn the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
C1101Barometric pressure sensor circuit
P081DNeutral position switch circuit <M/T>In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited.
P0830Clutch monitoring switch circuit <M/T>
P0833Clutch interlock switch circuit <M/T>
P1612Starter relay for auto start <A/T>In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
P1617Battery voltage low during idle stopIn the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited.
U0001Bus offIn the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
U0100Engine-ECU time-outIn the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
U0101A/T-ECU time-out <A/T>
U0114Transfer-ECU time-out <4WD>In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
U0121ASTC-ECU time-outIn the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
U0126Steering wheel sensor time-outIn the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
U0141ETACS-ECU time-outIn the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
U1180Combination meter time-outIn the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
U1201Vehicle speed signal error <M/T>In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
U1210Brake lamp switch status error <A/T>In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
U1211Engine parity/toggle bit error <A/T>
U1212A/T parity/toggle bit error <A/T>
U1213ASTC parity/toggle bit error <A/T>
U1214ETACS parity/toggle bit error <A/T>
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE CHART
DIAGNOSIS CODE CHART
cautionWhen the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position with the connector disconnected in proceeding with troubleshooting, the diagnosis code may be set in other systems. Erase codes if diagnosis codes of all the systems are checked and the codes are set after completion of the troubleshooting.
Code No.Diagnosis itemReference page
B1301DC/DC converter (entertainment system) performance <M/T>
DC/DC converter (entertainment system) performance <A/T>
B1302DC/DC converter (entertainment system) system <M/T>
DC/DC converter (entertainment system) system <A/T>

B1352DC/DC converter (control system) system <A/T>

17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. B1301 DC/DC CONVERTER (ENTERTAINMENT SYSTEM) PERFORMANCE<M/T>
Code No. B1301: DC/DC Converter (Entertainment System) Performance <M/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • At the auto start, the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCCT sends increasing voltage request signal to the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector terminal DCCT.
  • If the increasing voltage control system is abnormal, the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector terminal DCCA should send the diagnostic signal to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCDA.
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU checks whether the increasing voltage control system is normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • The IOD fuse is installed.
Judgement Criterion
  • For 5 seconds, the duty signal (failure signal) is received in a row.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Connection with accessories having rated output current large enough to possibly cause overloads (overcurrents).
  • Modified circuit.
  • Failed battery.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in DC/DC converter (entertainment system) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the vehicle status for use
Ask the user whether he or she connects the vehicle with accessories having the rated output current large enough to possibly cause overloads (overcurrents) or not. Or ask the user whether he or she modifies the circuit or not.
Does the user connect the vehicle with accessories having the large rated output current? Or does the user modify the circuit?
Turn OFF the accessories or remove them. Then go to Step 2.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
noteBefore checking the data list, carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Repeat Steps (1) and (2).
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to check the data list after having passed for more than 60 seconds (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 9: DC-DC OUT (Input)
OK: ON
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check the operation of the accessories
Ignition switch: "ACC" position
OK: Radio and CD player operates or multivision display operates
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
NO <Vehicles with radio and CD player> : Perform the troubleshooting of the radio and CD player (Refer to GROUP 54A - Radio and CD Player, Troubleshooting, Trouble Symptom Chart ).
NO <Vehicles with smartphone link display audio> : Perform the troubleshooting of the smartphone link display audio (Refer to GROUP 54A - Smartphone Link Display Audio, Troubleshooting, Trouble Symptom Chart ).
NO <Vehicles with Mitsubishi Multi Communication System (MMCS)> : Perform the troubleshooting of the MMCS (Refer to GROUP 54A - Mitsubishi Multi Communication System (MMCS), Troubleshooting, Trouble Symptom Chart ).
 
STEP 4. Check the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) power supply circuit
Check the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) power supply circuit (Refer to GROUP 54A - DC/DC Converter <Entertainment System>, Troubleshooting, Symptom Procedures, Inspection Procedure 1: Check the DC/DC Converter Power Supply Circuit ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the circuit according to the troubleshooting. Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCCT line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Check of short to power supply, short to body earth, and open circuit in DCDA line between AS&G-ECU connector and DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector
Is the check result normal?
Replace the DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 7. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCCT line and body earth.
OK: 1 V or less
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore rechecking the diagnosis code is set, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1301 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 9. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) DCCA line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check of short circuit to body earth in DCDA line between DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector and AS&G-ECU connector.
 
STEP 10. Check of harness damage in DCCT line between AS&G-ECU connector and DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 11. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Measure DC/DC converter (entertainment system) terminal voltage.
  • Measure the voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) OUT1 line and body earth at auto start.
  • Measure the voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) OUT2 line and body earth at auto start.
  • Check the difference among the measured voltage of the terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) OUT1 line and the measured voltage of the terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) OUT2 line.
OK: Under 0.3 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 12.
Replace the DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
 
STEP 12. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore rechecking the diagnosis code is set, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1301 set?
Replace the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). Then go to Step 13 .
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 13. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore rechecking the diagnosis code is set, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1301 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. B1301 DC/DC CONVERTER (ENTERTAINMENT SYSTEM) PERFORMANCE<A/T>
Code No. B1301: DC/DC Converter (Entertainment System) Performance <A/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • At the auto start, the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCCT sends increasing voltage request signal to the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector terminal DCCT.
  • If the increasing voltage control system is abnormal, the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector terminal DCCA should send the diagnostic signal to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCDA.
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU checks whether the increasing voltage control system is normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • The IOD fuse is installed.
Judgement Criterion
  • For 5 seconds, the duty signal (failure signal) is received in a row.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Connection with accessories having rated output current large enough to possibly cause overloads (overcurrents).
  • Modified circuit.
  • Failed battery.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in DC/DC converter (entertainment system) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code is set.
Is diagnosis code No. B1354 set?
Perform the troubleshooting of diagnosis code No. B1354: DC/DC converter (entertainment system) control circuit .
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the vehicle status for use
Ask the user whether he or she connects the vehicle with accessories having the rated output current large enough to possibly cause overloads (overcurrents) or not. Or ask the user whether he or she modifies the circuit or not.
Does the user connect the vehicle with accessories having the large rated output current? Or does the user modify the circuit?
Turn OFF the accessories or remove them. Then go to Step 3.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list
noteBefore checking the data list, carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Repeat Steps (1) and (2).
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to check the data list after having passed for more than 60 seconds (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 9: DC-DC OUT (Input)
OK: ON
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check the operation of the accessories
Ignition switch: "ACC" position
OK: Radio and CD player operates or multivision display operates
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
NO <Vehicles with radio and CD player> : Perform the troubleshooting of the radio and CD player (Refer to GROUP 54A - Radio and CD Player, Troubleshooting, Trouble Symptom Chart ).
NO <Vehicles with smartphone link display audio> : Perform the troubleshooting of the smartphone link display audio (Refer to GROUP 54A - Smartphone Link Display Audio, Troubleshooting, Trouble Symptom Chart ).
NO <Vehicles with Mitsubishi Multi Communication System (MMCS)> : Perform the troubleshooting of the MMCS (Refer to GROUP 54A - Mitsubishi Multi Communication System (MMCS), Troubleshooting, Trouble Symptom Chart ).
 
STEP 5. Check the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) power supply circuit
Check the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) power supply circuit (Refer to GROUP 54A - DC/DC Converter <Entertainment System>, Troubleshooting, Symptom Procedures, Inspection Procedure 1: Check the DC/DC Converter Power Supply Circuit ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the circuit according to the troubleshooting and go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCCT line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Check of short to power supply, short to body earth, and open circuit in DCDA line between AS&G-ECU connector and DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector
Is the check result normal?
Replace the DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 8. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCCT line and body earth.
OK: 1 V or less
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Go to Step 9.
 
STEP 9. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore rechecking the diagnosis code is set, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1301 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 10. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) DCCA line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check of short circuit to body earth in DCDA line between DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector and AS&G-ECU connector.
 
STEP 11. Check of harness damage in DCCT line between AS&G-ECU connector and DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 12.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 12. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Measure DC/DC converter (entertainment system) terminal voltage.
  • Measure the voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) OUT1 line and body earth at auto start.
  • Measure the voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) OUT2 line and body earth at auto start.
  • Check the difference among the measured voltage of the terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) OUT1 line and the measured voltage of the terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) OUT2 line.
OK: Under 0.3 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 13.
Replace the DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
 
STEP 13. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore rechecking the diagnosis code is set, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1301 set?
Replace the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). Then go to Step 14 .
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 14. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore rechecking the diagnosis code is set, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1301 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. B1302 DC/DC CONVERTER (ENTERTAINMENT SYSTEM) SYSTEM<M/T>
Code No. B1302: DC/DC Converter (Entertainment System) System <M/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • At the auto start, the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCCT sends increasing voltage request signal to the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector terminal DCCT.
  • If the increasing voltage control system is abnormal, the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector terminal DCCA should send the diagnostic signal to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCDA.
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU checks whether the increasing voltage control system is normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • The IOD fuse is installed.
Judgement Criterion
  • For 5 seconds, the high signal (OFF signal) is received in a row.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed battery.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in DC/DC converter (entertainment system) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector
noteBefore checking the voltage, carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Repeat Steps (1) and (2).
(4) Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position and check the voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) PWR line and body earth.
OK: Not more than 20 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the battery.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 9: DC-DC OUT (Input)
OK: ON
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
NO <OFF> : Go to Step 3.
NO <Failure> : Perform the troubleshooting of diagnosis code No. B1301: DC/DC Converter (Entertainment System) Performance (Refer to ).
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) DCCA line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCDA line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Repair the connector(s), or check of open circuit in DCDA line between AS&G-ECU connector and DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore rechecking the diagnosis code is set, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1302 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Check of harness damage in DCDA line between AS&G-ECU connector and DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 7. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (entertainment system) DCCA line and body earth.
OK: 1 V or less
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. B1302 DC/DC CONVERTER (ENTERTAINMENT SYSTEM) SYSTEM<A/T>
Code No. B1302: DC/DC Converter (Entertainment System) System <A/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • At the auto start, the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCCT sends increasing voltage request signal to the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector terminal DCCT.
  • If the increasing voltage control system is abnormal, the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector terminal DCCA should send the diagnostic signal to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCDA.

  • The IOD fuse is installed.
Judgement Criterion
  • For 5 seconds, the high signal (OFF signal) is received in a row.

  • Failed battery.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in DC/DC converter (entertainment system) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.

Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code is set.

noteBefore checking the voltage, carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Repeat Steps (1) and (2).

17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. B1351 DC/DC CONVERTER (CONTROL SYSTEM) PERFORMANCE<A/T>
Code No. B1351: DC/DC Converter (Control System) Performance <A/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • At the auto start, the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCCP sends increasing voltage request signal to the DC/DC converter (control system) connector terminal DCCP.
  • If the increasing voltage control system is abnormal, the DC/DC converter (control system) connector terminal DCDP sends a diagnostic signal to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCDP.
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU checks whether the increasing voltage control system is normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • Battery voltage is 6.3 V or more.
  • Not in auto stop.
Judgement Criterion
  • For 2 seconds, the duty signal (failure signal) is received in a row.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Connection with accessories having rated output current large enough to possibly cause overloads (overcurrents).
  • Modified circuit.
  • Failed battery.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in DC/DC converter (control system) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DC/DC converter (control system).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code is set.
Is diagnosis code No. B1353 set?
Perform the troubleshooting of diagnosis code No. B1353: DC/DC converter (control system) control circuit .
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the vehicle status for use
Ask the user whether he or she connects the vehicle with accessories having the rated output current large enough to possibly cause overloads (overcurrents) or not. Or ask the user whether he or she modifies the circuit or not.
Does the user connect the vehicle with accessories having the large rated output current? Or does the user modify the circuit?
Turn OFF the accessories or remove them. Then go to Step 3.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list
noteBefore checking the data list, carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Repeat Steps (1) and (2).
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to check the data list after having passed for more than 60 seconds (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 27: DC-DC OUT for powertrain (Input)
OK: ON
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code is set.
Is diagnosis code No. U0101 set?
Perform the troubleshooting of diagnosis code No. U0101: A/T-ECU time-out .
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code is set.
Is diagnosis code U0121 set?
Perform the troubleshooting of diagnosis code No. U0121: ASTC-ECU time-out .
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Check the DC/DC converter (control system) power supply circuit
Check the DC/DC converter (control system) power supply circuit (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Revise a circuit according to troubleshooting. Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCCP line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Check of short to earth and open circuit in DCCP line between DC/DC converter (control system) connector and AS&G-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Replace the DC/DC converter (control system).
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 9. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCCP line and body earth.
OK: 1 V or less
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
Go to Step 10.
 
STEP 10. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore checking the diagnosis code, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1351 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 11. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (control system) connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (control system) DCDP line and body earth.
OK: 4.6 V or more
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 12.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to earth in DCDP line between DC/DC converter (control system) connector and AS&G-ECU connector.
 
STEP 12. Check of harness damage in DCCP line between AS&G-ECU connector and DC/DC converter (control system) connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 13.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 13. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (control system) connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Measure DC/DC converter (control system) terminal voltage.
  • Measure the terminal voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (control system) OUT1 line and body earth at auto start.
  • Measure the terminal voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (control system) OUT2 line and body earth at auto start.
  • Check the difference among the measured terminal voltage of the terminal DC/DC converter (control system) OUT1 line and the measured voltage of the terminal DC/DC converter (control system) OUT2 line.
OK: Under 0.3 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 14.
Replace the DC/DC converter (control system).
 
STEP 14. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
