noteBefore checking the diagnosis code, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1351 set?
Replace the DC/DC converter (control system). Then go to Step 15.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 15. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore checking the diagnosis code, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1351 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. B1352 DC/DC CONVERTER (CONTROL SYSTEM) SYSTEM<A/T>
Code No. B1352: DC/DC Converter (Control System) System <A/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • At the auto start, the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCCP sends increasing voltage request signal to the DC/DC converter (control system) connector terminal DCCP.
  • If the increasing voltage control system is abnormal, the DC/DC converter (control system) connector terminal DCDP sends a diagnostic signal to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCDP.
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU checks whether the increasing voltage control system is normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • Battery voltage is 6.3 V or more.
  • Not in auto stop.
Judgement Criterion
  • For 2 seconds, the high signal (OFF signal) is received in a row.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed battery.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in DC/DC converter (control system) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DC/DC converter (control system).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code is set.
Is diagnosis code No. B1353 set?
Perform the troubleshooting of diagnosis code No. B1353: DC/DC converter (control system) control circuit .
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (control system) connector
noteBefore checking the voltage, carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be stored. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Repeat Steps (1) and (2).
(4) Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position and check the voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (control system) PWR line and body earth.
OK: Not more than 20 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the battery.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list
noteBefore checking the data list, carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (1) to (3).
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Repeat Steps (1) and (2).
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to check the data list after having passed for more than 60 seconds (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 27: DC-DC OUT for powertrain (Input)
OK: ON
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
NO <OFF> : Go to Step 4.
NO <Failure> : Perform the troubleshooting of diagnosis code No. B1351: DC/DC converter (control system) system malfunction (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (control system) connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (control system) DCDP line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCDP line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 6. Check of short to earth in DCDP line between AS&G-ECU connector and DC/DC converter (control system) connector
Is the check result normal?
  • Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to earth in DCDP line between AS&G-ECU connector and DC/DC converter (control system) connector.
Repair or replace the connector.
 
STEP 7. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore checking the diagnosis code, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1352 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 8. Check of harness damage in DCDP line between AS&G-ECU connector and DC/DC converter (control system) connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 9. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (control system) connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (control system) DCDP line and body earth.
OK: 1 V or less
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the DC/DC converter (control system).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. B1353 DC/DC CONVERTER (CONTROL SYSTEM) CONTROL CIRCUIT<A/T>
Code No. B1353: DC/DC Converter (Control System) Control Circuit <A/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • At the auto start, the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCCP sends increasing voltage request signal to the DC/DC converter (control system) connector terminal DCCP.
  • If the increasing voltage control system is abnormal, the DC/DC converter (control system) connector terminal DCDP sends a diagnostic signal to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCDP.
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU checks whether the increasing voltage control system is normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • Battery voltage is 6.3 V or more.
  • Not in auto stop.
Judgement Criterion
  • Low monitor voltage of the increasing voltage instruction signal is detected after the engine is manually started.
or
  • The monitor voltage is at a low level during auto start (increasing voltage instruction).
or
  • The monitor voltage is at a high level for 2 seconds or more when not in auto start (without increasing voltage instruction).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in DC/DC converter (control system) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DC/DC converter (control system).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCCP line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check of short to earth and open circuit in DCCP line between DC/DC converter (control system) connector and AS&G-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Replace the DC/DC converter (control system).
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCCP line and body earth.
OK: Voltage is 25% of the battery voltage or less.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore checking the diagnosis code, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1353 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Check of harness damage in DCCP line between DC/DC converter (control system) connector and AS&G-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 6. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore checking the diagnosis code, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1353 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. B1354 DC/DC CONVERTER (ENTERTAINMENT SYSTEM) CONTROL CIRCUIT<A/T>
Code No. B1354: DC/DC Converter (Entertainment System) Control Circuit <A/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • At the auto start, the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCCT sends increasing voltage request signal to the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector terminal DCCT.
  • If the increasing voltage control system is abnormal, the DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector terminal DCCA sends a diagnostic signal to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCDA.
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU checks whether the increasing voltage control system is normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGMENT
Check Condition
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position.
  • Battery voltage is 6.3 V or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • The monitor voltage is at a low level during auto start (increasing voltage instruction).
or
  • The monitor voltage is at a high level for 2 seconds or more when not in auto start (without increasing voltage instruction).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in DC/DC converter (entertainment system) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCCT line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check of short to earth and open circuit in DCCT line between DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector and AS&G-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Replace the DC/DC converter (entertainment system).
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCCT line and body earth.
OK: Voltage is 25% of the battery voltage or less.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore rechecking the diagnosis code is set, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1354 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Perform auto start with the following procedures.
    1. Change vehicle status to auto stop status.
    2. Selector lever: "D" position to "P" position
    3. Release the brake pedal then depress it again (Auto Start carried out at this point).
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU DCCP line and body earth.
OK: Voltage is 75% of the battery voltage or more.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore rechecking the diagnosis code is set, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1354 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 7. Check of harness damage in DCCT line between AS&G-ECU connector and DC/DC converter (entertainment system) connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore rechecking the diagnosis code is set, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (entertainment system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ACC" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1354 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. B1355 AS&G FUNCTIONAL ERROR<A/T>
Code No. B1355: AS&G Functional Error <A/T>
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU monitors the DC/DC converter (control system) whether it is normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • Either of the following diagnosis code is set.
    1. Code No. B1351: DC/DC converter (control system) performance
    2. Code No. B1352: DC/DC converter (control system) system
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto stop is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed DC/DC converter (control system) circuit.
  • Failed DC/DC converter (control system).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code is set.
Is diagnosis code other than No. B1355 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore checking the diagnosis code, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1355 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. B1356 DC/DC CONVERTER (CONTROL SYSTEM) DIAG OUTPUT LINE<A/T>
Code No. B1356: DC/DC Converter (Control System) Diag Output Line <A/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • At the auto start, the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCCP sends increasing voltage request signal to the DC/DC converter (control system) connector terminal DCCP.
  • If the increasing voltage control system is abnormal, the DC/DC converter (control system) connector terminal DCDP sends a diagnostic signal to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal DCDP.
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU checks the DC/DC converter's (control system) diagnostic signal circuit whether it is normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • For 10 seconds after the ignition is turn to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The low signal (ON signal) is received in a row.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Short circuit in DC/DC converter (control system) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DC/DC converter (control system).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (control system) connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (control system) DCDP line and body earth.
OK: 4.6 V or more
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to earth circuit in DCDP line between DC/DC converter (control system) connector and AS&G-ECU connector.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
  • Disconnect DC/DC converter (control system) connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
    Item No. 27: DC-DC OUT for powertrain (Input)
OK: OFF
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore checking the diagnosis code, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1356 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteBefore checking the diagnosis code, carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4), to reset the diagnosis information of the DC/DC converter (control system). If the operation is swiftly carried out, the diagnosis code can be set. Slowly carry out the operation, Step (2) to (4).
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Repeat Steps (2) and (3).
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code after having passed for more than 60 seconds.
Is diagnosis code No. B1356 set?
Replace the DC/DC converter (control system).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. C0047 BRAKE VACUUM SENSOR CIRCUIT
Code No. C0047: Brake Vacuum Sensor Circuit
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The power voltage is supplied to the brake vacuum sensor connector power terminal from the AS&G-ECU connector terminal BVS5.
  • The brake vacuum sensor signal is inputted to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal BVS from the brake vacuum sensor connector output terminal.
  • The brake vacuum sensor connector earth terminal is earthed to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal BVSE.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The brake vacuum sensor converts the vacuum pressure in the brake booster into a voltage and inputs the signal to the AS&G-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the AS&G-ECU controls the AS&G system.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The brake vacuum sensor output voltage is less than 0.3 V for 2 seconds.
or
  • The brake vacuum sensor output voltage is more than 4.8 V for 2 seconds.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in brake vacuum sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed brake vacuum sensor.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at brake vacuum sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU BVS5 line and earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between AS&G-ECU connector terminal BVS5 and brake vacuum sensor connector terminal
Check power supply line for open/short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Start the engine.
(3) Depress the brake pedal several times.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C0047 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Check of harness damage in BVS5 line between AS&G-ECU connector and brake vacuum sensor connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 5. Check of short to earth, open circuit, and harness damage in BVS line between AS&G-ECU connector and brake vacuum sensor connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 6. Check of short to earth, open circuit, and harness damage in BVSE line between AS&G-ECU connector and vacuum sensor connector terminal
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 7. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Start the engine.
(3) Depress the brake pedal several times.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C0047 set?
Replace the brake vacuum sensor. Then go to Step 8.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Start the engine.
(3) Depress the brake pedal several times.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C0047 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. C1101 BAROMETRIC PRESSURE SENSOR CIRCUIT
Code No. C1101: Barometric Pressure Sensor Circuit
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The barometric pressure sensor built in the AS&G-ECU detects the atmospheric pressure and converts it to the voltage.
  • In response to the signal, the AS&G-ECU controls the AS&G system.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The barometric pressure sensor output voltage is less than 0.3 V for 2 seconds.
or
  • The barometric pressure sensor output voltage is more than 4.7 V for 2 seconds.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed AS&G-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1011 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P081D NEUTRAL POSITION SWITCH CIRCUIT<M/T>
Code No. P081D: Neutral Position Switch Circuit <M/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The power voltage is supplied to the neutral position switch connector terminal from the J/B connector terminal.
  • The ON/OFF signal is inputted to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal NTSW from the neutral position switch connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The AS&G-ECU detects the gearshift lever position by using the signals of the neutral position switch.
  • In response to the signal, the AS&G-ECU controls the AS&G system.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • The diagnosis code No. P0833 is not detected.
  • Ambient temperature is more than -5°C.
  • The diagnosis code No. U0141 is not detected.
  • The diagnosis code No. U0100 is not detected.
Judgement Criterion
  • When you drive the vehicle at more than 60 km/h at least one time, the ON/OFF signal of the neutral position switch does not change even once although the ON/OFF signal of the clutch interlock switch is detected more than 10 times.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in neutral position switch circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed neutral position switch.
  • Failed installation of neutral position switch.
  • Failed system inside transmission.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 8: Neutral Position SW
OK:
  • ON (Gearshift lever position: Neutral)
  • OFF (Gearshift lever position: Except neutral)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Continuity check on neutral position switch connector
  • Disconnect connector, and check at neutral position switch side.
  • Continuity check between the neutral position switch terminals.
OK:
  • Continuity (Gearshift lever position: Neutral)
  • No continuity (Gearshift lever position: Except neutral)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check the installation state of the neutral position switch
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair.
 
STEP 4. Check the neutral position switch itself
Check the neutral position switch itself (Refer to GROUP 22B - Transmission, Transmission Inspection, Neutral Position Switch Check <R6M5A>, or Refer to GROUP 22C - Transmission, Transmission Inspection, Neutral Position Switch Check <V6M5A>).
Is the check result normal?
The area affecting the neutral position switch inside the transmission can possibly be abnormal. Overhaul and repair the transmission, or change the transmission.
Replace the neutral position switch.
 
STEP 5. Perform voltage measurement at neutral position switch connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal IG1 line and earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the connector(s), or check short to earth, and open circuit in IG1 line between J/B connector and neutral position switch connector.
 
STEP 6. Check of harness damage in IG1 line between J/B connector and neutral position switch connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 7. Check of short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in NTSW line between neutral position switch connector and AS&G-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P081D set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0830 CLUTCH MONITORING SWITCH CIRCUIT<M/T>
Code No. P0830: Clutch Monitoring Switch Circuit <M/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The power voltage is supplied to the clutch switch connector terminal from the AS&G-ECU connector terminal CLT1.
  • The clutch switch connector terminal is earthed to the vehicle body.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The AS&G-ECU detects the state of the depressed clutch pedal by using the signal of the clutch switch.
  • In response to the signal, the AS&G-ECU controls the AS&G system.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • Diagnosis code No. U0100 is not detected.
Judgement Criterion
  • Although the driving is more than 60 km/h during the previous driving, the ON/OFF signal of the clutch switch is not changed even once.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in clutch switch circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed clutch switch.
  • Failed installation of clutch switch.
  • Failed clutch pedal.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 6: Clutch SW Upper
OK:
  • ON (Clutch pedal: Depressed)
  • OFF (Clutch pedal: Released)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the installation state of the clutch switch and check the clutch pedal
  • Check the installation state of the clutch switch.
  • Check whether the installation portion of the clutch switch of the clutch pedal is not damaged.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace.
 
STEP 3. Check the clutch switch itself
Check the clutch switch itself (Refer to GROUP 21A - On-vehicles Service, Clutch Switch Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the clutch switch.
 
STEP 4. Perform voltage measurement at clutch switch connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU CLT1 line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check of short to earth, and open circuit in CLT1 line between AS&G-ECU connector and clutch switch connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0830 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 7. Perform resistance measurement at clutch switch connector terminal
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal earthing line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check of open circuit, and harness damage in earthing line between clutch switch connector and body earth.
 
STEP 8. Check harness damage in CLT1 line between AS&G-ECU connector and clutch switch connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0833 CLUTCH INTERLOCK SWITCH CIRCUIT<M/T>
Code No. P0833 Clutch Interlock Switch Circuit <M/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The power voltage is supplied to the clutch interlock switch connector terminal from the J/B connector terminal.
  • The ON/OFF signal is inputted to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal CLTR from the clutch interlock switch connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The AS&G-ECU detects the state of the depressed clutch pedal by using the signal of the clutch interlock switch.
  • In response to the signal, the AS&G-ECU controls the AS&G system.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • The diagnosis code U0100 is not detected.
Judgement Criterion
  • Although the driving is more than 30 km/h during the previous driving, the ON/OFF signal of the clutch interlock switch is not changed even once.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in clutch interlock switch circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed clutch interlock switch.
  • Failed installation of clutch interlock switch.
  • Failed clutch pedal.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 7: Clutch SW Bottom
OK:
  • ON (Clutch pedal: Fully depressed)
  • OFF (Clutch pedal: Released)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the installation state of the clutch interlock switch and check the clutch pedal
  • Check the installation state of the clutch interlock switch.
  • Check whether the installation portion of the clutch interlock switch of the clutch pedal is not damaged.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace.
 
STEP 3. Check the clutch interlock switch itself
Check the clutch interlock switch itself (Refer to GROUP 21A - On-vehicles Service, Clutch Switch Check, Clutch Interlock Switch Continuity Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the clutch interlock switch.
 
STEP 4. Perform voltage measurement at clutch interlock switch connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Voltage between terminal IG1 line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the connector(s), or check of short circuit to earth, and open circuit in IG1 line between J/B connector and clutch interlock switch connector.
 
STEP 5. Check short to earth, open circuit, and harness damage in CLTR line between clutch interlock switch connector and AS&G-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0833 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1612 STARTER RELAY FOR AUTO START<A/T>
Code No. P1612: Starter Relay for Auto Start <A/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power for starter drive is supplied from the battery to the starter relay connector terminal.
  • At the auto start, battery voltage is supplied to the starter relay coil connector terminal from the AS&G-ECU connector terminal STR.
  • When the starter relay is turned ON, battery voltage is supplied to the starter from the starter relay connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU turns ON the starter relay at the auto start. This, in turn, supplies battery voltage to the starter.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGMENT
Check Condition
  • More than 2 seconds have passed since the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or more than 2 seconds have passed since engine starting sequence was completed.
  • Battery voltage is 10 V or more and 16 V or less.
  • Not in auto start.
Judgement Criterion
  • The starter relay (for auto start) terminal monitor voltage is 4.5 V or more for 2 seconds.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit or damage in starter relay (auto start) circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check of short circuit to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in STR line between AS&G-ECU connector and starter relay connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1612 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1617 BATTERY VOLTAGE LOW DURING IDLE STOP
Code No. P1617: Battery Voltage Low During Idle Stop
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU monitors the battery voltage during an auto stop.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • During auto stop.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the battery capacity is decreased.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed battery.
  • Battery voltage temporarily lowered due to overloads (overcurrents), low battery temperature, loose battery terminal, etc.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the auto stop operation
Ask the user if the auto stop function is often deactivated or not in recent days.
Is the auto stop function often deactivated in recent days?
Go to Step 2.
Delete the diagnosis code and the procedure is complete (The diagnosis code may have been set due to the temporarily lowered battery voltage, but now it has been recovered).
 
STEP 2. Check battery
Battery check (Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery, On-vehicle Service, Battery Life Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the battery.
 
STEP 3. Check of damage in BAT1 line between the battery and AS&G-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 4. Check of damage in GND line between the AS&G-ECU connector and body earth
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 5. Check the vehicle status for use
Ask the user whether he or she connects the vehicle with accessories having the rated output current large enough to possibly cause overloads (overcurrents) or not. Or ask the user whether he or she modifies the circuit or not.
Does the user connect the vehicle with accessories having the large rated output current? Or does the user modify the circuit?
Turn off the accessories or remove them.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) During auto stop.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1617 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
The battery voltage is temporarily lowered.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U0001 BUS OFF
Code No. U0001: Bus Off
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U0001 is set in the AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The microcomputer decides the system is in the bus off mode for 2 seconds.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line or by malfunction in AS&G-ECU.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 3.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0001 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0001 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U0100 ENGINE-ECU TIME-OUT
Code No. U0100: Engine-ECU Time-out
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U0100 is set in the AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • The battery voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • After 2 seconds pass from when the battery voltage is more than 10 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • Unable to receive the signals from the engine-ECU for 4 seconds.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and engine-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of engine-ECU, in engine-ECU itself, in AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and engine-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of engine-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code .
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with engine-ECU sets diagnosis code No. U0100 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U0100 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0100 set?
Replace the engine-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0100 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0100 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U0101 A/T-ECU CAN TIMEOUT<A/T>
Code No. U0101: A/T-ECU Time-out <A/T>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U0101 is set in the AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position.
  • The battery voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • After 2 seconds pass from when the battery voltage is more than 10 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • Unable to receive the signals from the A/T-ECU for 4 seconds.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and A/T-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of A/T-ECU, in A/T-ECU itself, in AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and A/T-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of A/T-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed A/T-ECU.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the A/T-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the A/T-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the A/T-ECU (Refer to GROUP 23C - Troubleshooting <A/T>, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with A/T-ECU sets diagnosis code No. U0101 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U0101 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0101 set?
Replace the A/T-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and A/T-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0101 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and A/T-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0101 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U0114 TRANSFER-ECU CAN TIMEOUT<4WD>
Code No. U0114: Transfer-ECU Time-out <4WD>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U0114 is set in the AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The battery voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • The diagnosis code U0100 is not detected.
Judgement Criterion
  • Unable to receive the signals from the transfer-ECU for 4 seconds.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and transfer-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of transfer-ECU, in transfer-ECU itself, in AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and transfer-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of transfer-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed transfer-ECU.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the transfer-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the transfer-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 22A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Code Chart .
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with transfer-ECU sets diagnosis code No. U0114 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U0114 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0114 set?
Replace the transfer-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0114 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0114 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U0121 ASC-ECU TIME-OUT
Code No. U0121: ASTC-ECU Time-out
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code U0121 is set from AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The battery voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • After 2 seconds pass from when the battery voltage is more than 10 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • Unable to receive the signals from the ASTC-ECU for 4 seconds.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ASTC-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of ASTC-ECU, in ASTC-ECU itself, in AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ASTC-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of ASTC-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the ASTC-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the ASTC-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with ASTC-ECU sets diagnosis code No. U0121 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U0121 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0121 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU). Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0121 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0121 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U0126 STEERING WHEEL SENSOR CAN TIMEOUT
Code No. U0126: Steering Wheel Sensor Time-out
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U0126 is set in the AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The battery voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • Unable to receive the signals from the steering wheel sensor for 4 seconds.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and steering wheel sensor, by malfunction in the power supply system of steering wheel sensor, in steering wheel sensor itself, in AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and steering wheel sensor and malfunction in the power supply system of steering wheel sensor. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed steering wheel sensor.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the steering wheel sensor.
Is any diagnosis code set in the steering wheel sensor?
Perform troubleshooting of the steering wheel sensor (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with steering wheel sensor sets diagnosis code No. U0126 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U0126 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0126 set?
Replace the steering wheel sensor. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and steering wheel sensor (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0126 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and steering wheel sensor (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0126 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U0141 ETACS-ECU TIME-OUT
Code No. U0141: ETACS-ECU Time-out
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U0141 is set in the AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The battery voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • Unable to receive the signals from the ETACS-ECU for 4 seconds.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ETACS-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of ETACS-ECU, in ETACS-ECU itself, in AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ETACS-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of ETACS-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed ETACS-ECU.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.

cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the ETACS-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with ETACS-ECU sets diagnosis code No. U0141 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U0141 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0141 set?
Replace the ETACS-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0141 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
