Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0141 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1180 COMBINATION METER TIME-OUT
Code No. U1180: Combination Meter Time-out
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U1180 is set in the AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The battery voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • The diagnosis code U0141 is not detected.
Judgement Criterion
  • Unable to receive the signals from the combination meter for 4 seconds.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and combination meter, by malfunction in the power supply system of combination meter, in combination meter itself, in AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and combination meter and malfunction in the power supply system of combination meter. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed combination meter.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the combination meter.
Is any diagnosis code set in the combination meter?
Perform troubleshooting of the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with combination meter sets diagnosis code No. U1180 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U1180 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1180 set?
Replace the combination meter. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and combination meter (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1180 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and combination meter (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1180 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1195: CODING NOT COMPLETED
Code No. U1195: Coding not Completed
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines.
  • Whenever the ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When diagnosis code No. U1195 is set in AS&G-ECU, the diagnosis code may also be set in ETACS-ECU. When the diagnosis code is set in ETACS-ECU, perform the diagnosis of the diagnosis code for ETACS-ECU first.
  • When the ETACS-ECU of vehicles without KOS is replaced, the encrypted code of the ignition key needs to be registered to the ETACS-ECU (If the encrypted code is not registered, the engine cannot be started. Register the encrypted code as described in GROUP 54A - Immobilizer System, On-vehicle Service, How to Register Key ID ).
 
 
OPERATION
AS&G-ECU receives the vehicle information set in ETACS-ECU via CAN bus lines.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Judgement Criterion
  • Coding has not been performed.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Coding not implemented.
  • Failed ETACS-ECU.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the ETACS-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. ETACS-ECU coding data check
Use M.U.T.-III to check the coding data set in the ETACS-ECU.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the ETACS-ECU.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1195 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1195 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1201 VEHICLE SPEED SIGNAL ERROR<M/T>
Code No. U1201: Vehicle Speed Signal Error <M/T>
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU checks for an abnormal signal of the Engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The diagnosis code U0100 is not detected.
Judgement Criterion
  • The vehicle speed CAN reception signal is abnormal.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, carry out the forcible auto start.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed Engine-ECU.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the Engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1201 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1210 BRAKE LAMP SW STATUS ERROR<A/T>
Code No. U1210: Brake Lamp Switch Status Error <A/T>
 
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The battery voltage is more than 9 V and is less than 16 V.
  • Neither of the following diagnosis codes is set.
    1. Code No. U0121: ASTC-ECU Time-out
    2. Code No. U0141: ETACS-ECU Time-out
Judgement Criterion
  • The brake lamp switch is OFF when the brake master cylinder hydraulic pressure is 1 MPa or more.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the ASTC-ECU signal, by malfunction in the ASTC-ECU, of the ETACS-ECU signal, of the brake lamp switch (stuck to OFF), in the AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the ASTC-ECU signal and malfunction of the brake lamp switch system. For diagnosis procedure, refer to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed brake master cylinder hydraulic pressure signal that is entered in the AS&G-ECU from the ASTC-ECU via CAN communication.
  • Failed brake lamp switch signal that is entered in the AS&G-ECU from the ETACS-ECU via CAN communication.
  • Failed hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the ASTC-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the ASTC-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 30: Brake lamp SW
OK:
  • ON (Depressed the brake pedal.)
  • OFF (Released the brake pedal.)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list of ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 108: Stop lamp switch
OK:
  • ON (Depressed the brake pedal)
  • OFF (Released the brake pedal)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check stop lamp switch itself
Check stop lamp switch itself (Refer to GROUP 35A - Brake Pedal, Stop Lamp Switch Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Check the stop lamp switch circuit (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Input Signal Procedures, Inspection Procedure 10: The Stop Lamp Switch Signal is Not Received ).
Replace the stop lamp switch (Refer to GROUP 35A - Brake Pedal ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more for 15 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1210 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1211 ENG PARITY/TOGGLE BIT ERROR<A/T>
Code No. U1211: Engine Parity/Toggle Bit Error <A/T>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U1211 is set in the AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The battery voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • Code No. U0100: Engine-ECU Time-out has not occurred.
Judgement Criterion
  • The CAN reception signal from the engine-ECU is abnormal.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and engine-ECU, by malfunction of in engine-ECU, in AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and engine-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of engine-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the engine-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code .
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1211 set?
Replace the engine-ECU. Then go to Step 4.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1211 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1211 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1212 A/T PARITY/TOGGLE BIT ERROR<A/T>
Code No. U1212: A/T Parity/Toggle Bit Error <A/T>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U1212 is set in the AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The battery voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • Code No. U0101: A/T-ECU Time-out has not occurred.
Judgement Criterion
  • The CAN reception signal from the A/T-ECU is abnormal.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and A/T-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of A/T-ECU, in A/T-ECU itself, in AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and A/T-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of A/T-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed A/T-ECU.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the A/T-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the A/T-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the A/T-ECU (Refer to GROUP 23C - Troubleshooting <A/T>, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1212 set?
Replace the A/T-ECU. Then go to Step 4.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and A/T-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1212 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and A/T-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1212 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1213 ABS/ASC PARITY/TOGGLE BIT ERROR<A/T>
Code No. U1213: ASTC Parity/Toggle Bit Error <A/T>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code U1213 is set from AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The battery voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • Code No. U0121: ASTC-ECU Time-out has not occurred.
Judgement Criterion
  • The CAN reception signal from the ASTC-ECU is abnormal.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ASTC-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of ASTC-ECU, in ASTC-ECU itself, in AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ASTC-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of ASTC-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU).
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the ASTC-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the ASTC-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1213 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU). Then go to Step 4.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1213 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1213 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1214 ETACS PARITY/TOGGLE BIT ERROR<A/T>
Code No. U1214: ETACS Parity/Toggle Bit Error <A/T>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U1214 is set in the AS&G-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds has passed after the ignition switch is turn to the "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The battery voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • Code No. U0141: ETACS-ECU Time-out has not occurred.
Judgement Criterion
  • The CAN reception signal from the ETACS-ECU is abnormal.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ETACS-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of ETACS-ECU, in ETACS-ECU itself, in AS&G-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ETACS-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of ETACS-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
In the normal operation, the auto stop is prohibited. If the malfunction is detected during the auto stop, the auto start is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector.
  • Failed ETACS-ECU.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the ETACS-ECU?
Perform troubleshooting of the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1214 set?
Replace the ETACS-ECU. Then go to Step 4.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1214 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction in CAN bus line between AS&G-ECU and ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1214 set?
Go to Step 1.
Check end.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM CHART
SYMPTOM CHART
ItemsTrouble symptomInspection procedure No.
Communication with M.U.T.-III The communication between M.U.T.-III and AS&G-ECU not possible1
AS&G systemStarting impossible (starter not operative) Although the key is operated, the engine cannot be started.2
AS&G OFF display screen is not turned ON right after the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position3
Although AS&G OFF switch pressed, AS&G system not switchedAlthough the AS&G OFF switch is pressed, the AS&G system is not switched to ON/OFF.4
AS&G system abnormal (auto stop not carried out)Although the auto stop requirements are satisfied, the auto stop cannot be carried out.5
AS&G system abnormal (auto start not carried out)Although the clutch pedal is depressed, the auto start cannot be carried out.6
AS&G system abnormal (auto start carried out under condition that clutch pedal not operated) <M/T>Although the clutch pedal is not depressed, the auto start is carried out.7
AS&G system abnormal (auto start carried out under condition that brake pedal is operated) <A/T>Although the brake pedal is depressed, the auto start is carried out.8
Audio equipment is reset or sound jump occurs at auto start9
 
 
PROBLEM SYMPTOM TABLE
cautionDuring troubleshooting if the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position with the connectors, etc. disconnected, some diagnosis code may be saved in other system. After the troubleshooting is completed, always make sure the diagnosis codes of the entire systems. If it is found that some diagnosis codes have been set, erase them.
Inspection procedure No.Trouble symptomReference page
1The communication between M.U.T.-III and AS&G-ECU not possible
2Starting impossible (starter not operative)<M/T>
<A/T>
3AS&G OFF display screen is not turned ON right after the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position
4Although AS&G OFF switch pressed, AS&G system not switched
5AS&G system abnormal (auto stop not carried out)<M/T>
<A/T>
6AS&G system abnormal (auto start not carried out)<M/T>
<A/T>
7AS&G system abnormal (auto start carried out under condition that clutch pedal not operated) <M/T>
8AS&G system abnormal (auto start carried out under condition that brake pedal is operated) <A/T>
9Audio equipment is reset or sound jump occurs at auto startRefer to GROUP 54A - DC/DC converter, Inspection Procedure 2 .
10AS&G-ECU power supply, ignition switch-IG1 system
11DC/DC converter (control system) power supply circuit <A/T>
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > THE COMMUNICATION BETWEEN M.U.T.-III AND AS&G-ECU NOT POSSIBLE
Inspection Procedure 1: The Communication Between M.U.T.-III and AS&G-ECU Not Possible
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The battery voltage is supplied to the diagnosis connector from the battery.
  • The diagnosis connector earth terminals are earthed to the vehicle body.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
When the communication between M.U.T.-III and the AS&G-ECU is impossible, the CAN bus line, power supply circuit of the diagnosis connector, and/or earthing circuit could possibly be defective. The communication cannot be achieved either if the wrong vehicle type is selected on M.U.T.-III.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in the diagnosis connector circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed CAN communication.
  • Failed M.U.T.-III.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the Vehicle Communication Interface (V.C.I.) operations
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
  • Connect the M.U.T.-III to the diagnosis connector.
  • Turn ON the power of the V.C.I.
OK: The indicator lamp of the V.C.I. illuminates in green.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check battery
Check battery (Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery, On-vehicle Service, Battery Test ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the battery.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at diagnosis connector
Voltage between terminal diagnosis connector power supply line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector(s), or check and repair the harness of open circuit, and short circuit in power supply line between diagnosis connector and battery.
 
STEP 4. Perform resistance measurement at diagnosis connector
Resistance between terminal diagnosis connector earthing line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check of open circuit, and harness damage in earthing line between diagnosis connector and body earth.
 
STEP 5. Check of harness damage in power supply line between battery and diagnosis connector
Is the check result normal?
Check M.U.T.-III, refer to the M.U.T.-III User’s Manual.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 6. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Check AS&G-ECU Power Supply, Ignition Switch-IG1 System (Refer to ).
Repair CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > STARTING IMPOSSIBLE (STARTER NOT OPERATIVE)<M/T>
Inspection Procedure 2: Starting Impossible (Starter Not Operative) <M/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The ignition switch-"ST" signal is inputted into the AS&G-ECU connector terminal ST from the ignition switch connector terminal ST <vehicles without KOS> or KOS&OSS-ECU connector terminal STO <vehicles with KOS>.
  • The battery voltage is supplied to the starter cut relay terminal from the battery.
  • The AS&G-ECU connector terminal STCR turns ON the power transistor in the unit, and then makes the current flow into the starter cut relay terminal to turn ON the relay.
  • When the starter cut relay is turned ON, the battery voltage is supplied to the starter relay terminal from the starter cut relay terminal.
  • The AS&G-ECU connector terminal STRL turns ON the power transistor in the unit, and then make the current flow into the starter relay terminal to turn ON the relay.
  • When the starter cut relay and starter relay are turned ON, the battery voltage is supplied to the starter connector terminal from the starter relay terminal.
  • The starter cut relay terminal and the starter relay terminal are earthed to the vehicle body.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure could possibly be caused by the malfunction of the starter or starter system circuits. If the engine-ECU or the KOS&OSS-ECU <vehicles with KOS> sets the diagnosis code, the engine start should be restricted.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed battery
  • Failed clutch interlock switch
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in clutch interlock switch circuit, or loose connector contact
  • Failed ignition switch.
  • Failed starter cut relay
  • Failed starter relay
  • Failed starter assembly.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in ignition switch-"ST" circuit, or loose connector contact
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in starter cut relay circuit, or loose connector contact
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in starter relay circuit, or loose connector contact
  • Failed diesel fuel system.
  • Failed KOS. <vehicles with KOS>
  • Failed AS&G-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check battery
Check battery (Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery, On-vehicle Service, Battery Test ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the battery.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the diesel fuel system.
Is any diagnosis code set in the diesel fuel system?
Perform the troubleshooting of the diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code ).
NO <Vehicles without KOS> : Go to Step 4.
NO <Vehicles with KOS> : Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system <Vehicles with KOS>
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the KOS&OSS-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the KOS?
Perform the troubleshooting of the KOS&OSS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 42B - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 7: Clutch SW Bottom
OK:
  • ON (Clutch pedal: Fully depressed)
  • OFF (Clutch pedal: Released)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Perform the troubleshooting of diagnosis code No. P0833: Clutch interlock switch circuit (Refer to ).
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 1: Starter SW
  • Clutch pedal: Fully depressed
OK:
  • ON (Ignition switch: "ST" position)
  • OFF (Ignition switch: "ON" position)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Clutch pedal: Fully depressed
  • Ignition switch: "ST" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU ST line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
NO <Vehicles without KOS> : Go to Step 7.
NO <Vehicles with KOS> : Go to Step 8.
 
STEP 7. Check ignition switch itself <Vehicles without KOS>
Check ignition switch itself (Refer to GROUP 54A - Ignition Switch, Inspection, Ignition Switch Check ).
Is the check result normal?
  • Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit, and harness damage in ST line between ignition switch connector and AS&G-ECU connector.
Replace the ignition switch.
 
STEP 8. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in STO line between KOS&OSS-ECU connector and AS&G-ECU connector <Vehicles with KOS>
Is the check result normal?
Perform the troubleshooting of the KOS&OSS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 42B - Troubleshooting, Symptom Chart ).
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 9. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 10. Check the starter cut relay itself and starter relay itself
Check the starter cut relay itself and starter relay itself (Refer to GROUP 16 - Starting System, On-vehicle Service, Starter Relay Continuity Check ).
Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 11.
Replace the starter cut relay and/or starter relay.
 
STEP 11. Perform resistance measurement at starter cut relay connector
  • Remove the starter cut relay, and measure at relay box side.
  • Resistance between terminal starter cut relay earthing line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 12.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check of open circuit, and harness damage in earthing line between starter cut relay connector and body earth.
 
STEP 12. Perform resistance measurement at starter relay connector
  • Remove the starter relay, and measure at relay box side.
  • Resistance between terminal starter relay earthing line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 13.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check of open circuit, and harness damage in earthing line between starter relay connector and body earth.
 
STEP 13. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in power supply line between battery and starter cut relay connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 14.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 14. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in STCR line between AS&G-ECU connector and starter cut relay connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 15.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 15. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in output line between starter cut relay connector and starter relay connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 16.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 16. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in STRL line between AS&G-ECU connector and starter relay connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 17.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 17. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in NTSW line between starter relay connector and engine-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 18.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 18. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in output line between starter relay connector and starter connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 19.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 19. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in power supply line between battery and starter connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 20.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 20. Check starter assembly operation
Check starter assembly operation (Refer to GROUP 16 - Starting System, Starter Motor Assembly, Inspection ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Replace the starter assembly.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > STARTING IMPOSSIBLE (STARTER NOT OPERATIVE)<A/T>
Inspection Procedure 2: Starting Impossible (Starter Not Operative) <A/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The ignition switch-"ST" signal is inputted into the AS&G-ECU connector terminal ST from the ignition switch connector terminal ST <vehicles without KOS> or KOS&OSS-ECU connector terminal STO <vehicles with KOS>.
  • The battery voltage is supplied to the starter relay terminal from the battery.
  • The AS&G-ECU connector terminal STR, STRL turns ON the power transistor in the unit, and then make the current flow into the starter relay terminal to turn ON the relay.
  • When the starter relay is turned ON, the battery voltage is supplied to the starter connector terminal from the starter relay connector terminal.
  • The starter relay terminal is earthed to the vehicle body.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure could possibly be caused by the malfunction of the starter or starter system circuits. If the engine-ECU or the KOS&OSS-ECU <vehicles with KOS> sets the diagnosis code, the engine start should be restricted.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed battery.
  • Failed ignition switch.
  • Failed starter relay.
  • Failed starter assembly.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in ignition switch-"ST" circuit, or loose connector contact.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in starter relay circuit, or loose connector contact.
  • Failed inhibitor switch.
  • Failed diesel fuel system.
  • Failed KOS. <vehicles with KOS>
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check battery
Check battery (Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery, On-vehicle Service, Battery Test ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the battery.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the diesel fuel system.
Is any diagnosis code set in the diesel fuel system?
Perform the troubleshooting of the diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code ).
NO <Vehicles without KOS> : Go to Step 4.
NO <Vehicles with KOS> : Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system <Vehicles with KOS>
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the KOS&OSS-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the KOS?
Perform the troubleshooting of the KOS&OSS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 42B - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 1: Starter SW
OK:
  • ON (Ignition switch: "ST" position)
  • OFF (Ignition switch: "ON" position)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector by back probing
  • Do not disconnect connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ST" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU ST line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
NO <Vehicles without KOS> : Go to Step 6.
NO <Vehicles with KOS> : Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 6. Check ignition switch itself <Vehicles without KOS>
Check ignition switch itself (Refer to GROUP 54A - Ignition Switch, Inspection, Ignition Switch Check ).
Is the check result normal?
  • Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit, and harness damage in ST line between ignition switch connector and AS&G-ECU connector.
Replace the ignition switch.
 
STEP 7. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in STO line between KOS&OSS-ECU connector and AS&G-ECU connector <Vehicles with KOS>
Is the check result normal?
Perform the troubleshooting of the KOS&OSS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 42B - Troubleshooting, Symptom Chart ).
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 8. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 9. Check starter relay itself
Check starter relay itself (Refer to GROUP 16 - Starting System, On-vehicle Service, Starter Relay Continuity Check ).
Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 10.
Replace the starter relay.
 
STEP 10. Perform resistance measurement at starter relay connector
  • Remove the starter relay, and measure at relay box side.
  • Resistance between terminal starter relay earthing line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check of open circuit, and harness damage in earthing line between starter relay connector and body earth.
 
STEP 11. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in power supply line between battery and starter relay connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 12.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 12. Check inhibitor switch itself
Check inhibitor switch itself (Refer to GROUP 23C - On- Vehicle Service, Essential Service, Inhibitor Switch Continuity Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 13.
Replace the inhibitor switch.
 
STEP 13. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in output line between inhibitor switch connector and starter relay connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 14.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 14. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in STRL line between AS&G-ECU connector and inhibitor switch connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 15.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 15. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in NTSW line between starter relay connector and engine-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 16.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 16. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in STR line between AS&G-ECU connector and starter relay connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 17.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 17. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in output line between starter relay connector and starter connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 18.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 18. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in power supply line between battery and starter connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 19.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 19 Check starter assembly operation
Check starter assembly operation (Refer to GROUP 16 - Starting System, Starter Motor Assembly, Inspection ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Replace the starter assembly.
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > AS&G INDICATOR/DISPLAY OR AS&G OFF INDICATOR/DISPLAY IS NOT TURNED ON RIGHT AFTER THE IGNITION SWITCH IS TURNED TO THE "ON" POSITION
Inspection Procedure 3: AS&G OFF Display Screen is Not Turned ON Right After the Ignition Switch is Turned to the "ON" Position
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The AS&G-ECU sends the signal to the combination meter through the CAN bus line, corresponding to the state of the AS&G system. When receiving the signal, the combination meter turns ON or blinks the AS&G OFF display screen.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure could possibly be caused by the failed combination meter, failed AS&G-ECU and so on.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed combination meter
  • Failed AS&G-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 24: AS&G OFF Indicator (Output)
OK:
  • Turn on (Press the AS&G OFF switch to turn OFF the AS&G system)
  • Turn off (From the AS&G system OFF status, press the AS&G OFF switch to turn ON the AS&G system)
Is the check result normal?
Check combination meter system (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Trouble Symptom Chart ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > ALTHOUGH AS&G OFF SWITCH PRESSED, AS&G SYSTEM NOT SWITCHED
Inspection Procedure 4: Although AS&G OFF Switch Pressed, AS&G System Not Switched
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The battery voltage is supplied to the AS&G OFF switch connector terminal from the ignition switch connector terminal IG1 <vehicles without KOS> or the IG1 relay connector terminal <vehicles with KOS>.
  • The ON/OFF signal is inputted to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal ASGM from the AS&G OFF switch connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
Pressing the AS&G OFF switch can optionally turn OFF the AS&G system or turn ON the AS&G system.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure could possibly be caused by the failed AS&G OFF switch circuit and so on.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed AS&G OFF switch.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in the AS&G OFF switch circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 5: AS&G OFF SW
OK:
  • ON [AS&G OFF switch: Pressed (only while the switch is pressed)]
  • OFF (AS&G OFF switch: Released)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the AS&G OFF switch itself
Check the AS&G OFF switch itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the AS&G OFF switch.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G OFF switch connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G OFF switch IG1 line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
YES <Vehicles without KOS> : Go to Step 4.
YES <Vehicles with KOS> : Go to Step 5.
NO <Vehicles without KOS> : Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to earth and open circuit in IG1 line between ignition switch connector and AS&G OFF switch connector.
NO <Vehicles with KOS> : Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to earth and open circuit in IG1 line between IG1 relay connector and AS&G OFF switch connector.
 
STEP 4. Check of harness damage in IG1 line between ignition switch connector and AS&G OFF switch connector <Vehicles without KOS>
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 5. Check of harness damage in IG1 line between IG1 relay connector and AS&G OFF switch connector <Vehicles with OKS>
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 6. Check of short to power supply, short to earth, open circuit and harness damage in ASGM line between AS&G OFF switch connector and AS&G-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 7. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > AS&G SYSTEM ABNORMAL (AUTO STOP NOT CARRIED OUT)<M/T>
Inspection Procedure 5: AS&G System Abnormal (Auto Stop Not Carried Out) <M/T>
 
 
cautionIf the following services are performed, the backup data should be deleted. Do not perform these services without carrying out the check described in Step 2.
  • In case the cable is disconnected from the battery terminal
  • In case the connector is disconnected from the engine-ECU
 
 
FUNCTION
If the specified conditions are satisfied, the AS&G-ECU should send the engine stop request signal to the engine-ECU via CAN bus line. When receiving the signal, the engine-ECU should stop the engine.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure could possibly be caused by the failed AS&G system. The AS&G-ECU, however, can possibly prohibit the auto stop, depending on the vehicle status or the ambient conditions.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Deteriorated battery.
  • Failed AS&G system.
  • Short circuit in starter active signal circuit, or loose connector contact.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Confirm the vehicle status and the ambient conditions
Confirm the vehicle status or the ambient conditions to check whether the auto stop should be carried out or not (Refer to ).
Are the conditions for prohibiting the auto stop satisfied?
Check end.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check for data list of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 435: Last Battery Deteriorated ODO
  • Item No. 436: 2nd Last Batt. Deteriorated ODO
  • Item No. 437: 3rd Last Batt. Deteriorated ODO
OK: 0 km (Ignition switch: ON)
Are the all items displayed as "0 km"?
Go to Step 3.
Write the check result. Then go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code is set in the following ECUs.
  • AS&G-ECU
  • Engine-ECU
  • Transfer-ECU <4WD>
  • ASTC-ECU
  • Combination meter
  • ETACS-ECU
  • A/C-ECU <Vehicles with auto A/C>
Is any diagnosis code set?
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the AS&G-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the AS&G-ECU (Refer to ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting - Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the transfer-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 22A - Troubleshooting <V6M5A>, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the ASTC-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the combination meter> : Perform the troubleshooting of the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the A/C-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the A/C-ECU (Refer to GROUP 55B - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: Seat Belt Fasten Status
OK:
  • Fastened (Driver’s seat belt: Fastened)
  • Not fastened (Driver’s seat belt: Not fastened)
noteIf the driver’s seat belt is unfastened, the AS&G display screen in the combination meter should blink.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Perform the troubleshooting of the seat belt reminder function circuit (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Symptom Procedures, Inspection Procedure 14: Seat Belt Reminder Function Does Not Work Normally ).
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 4: Engine Hood
OK:
  • Close (Hood: Closed)
  • Open (Hood: Opened)
noteIf the hood is opened, the AS&G display screen in the combination meter should blink.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Perform the troubleshooting of the engine hood latch switch circuit (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Input Signal Procedures, Inspection Procedure 1: The hood latch switch signal is not received ).
 
STEP 6. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 6: Clutch SW Upper
  • Item No. 7: Clutch SW Bottom
  • Item No. 8: Neutral Position SW
  • Item No. 14: Brake Vacuum sensor
  • Item No. 16: Atmospheric pressure
Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 7.
Perform the troubleshooting for the item that has an abnormal value (Refer to ).
 
STEP 7. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 18: Accelerator Pedal Position
OK:
  • 0% (Release the accelerator pedal).
  • 98% or more (Depress the accelerator pedal fully).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Perform the troubleshooting of the accelerator pedal position sensor [Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures, Diagnosis Code No. P2138: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Main and Sub) Range/Performance Problem .
 
STEP 8. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 17: Vehicle speed
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Perform the troubleshooting of diagnosis code No. U1201: Vehicle Speed Signal Error (Refer to ).
 
STEP 9. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 44: G sensor signal(+:decel,-:accel)
OK:
  • -0.04 to 0.04 m/s2 (Stops the vehicle in a horizontal state).
  • The value changes in the range between -1 to 1 m/s2 (When driving).
Is the check result normal?
YES <Vehicles without auto A/C> : Go to Step 11.
YES <Vehicles with auto A/C> : Go to Step 10.
Perform the troubleshooting of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures, Diagnosis Code No. C1377: G and Yaw Rate Sensor Error ).
 
STEP 10. Confirm the ambient temperature <Vehicles with auto A/C>
Check the ambient temperature information in combination meter
OK: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
Perform the troubleshooting of the ambient temperature sensor (Refer to GROUP 55B - Troubleshooting, Trouble Symptom Chart ).
 
STEP 11. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 7: Engine coolant TEMP. sensor
OK:
  • Engine cold state: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
  • Engine hot state: At 80 to 120°C
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 12.
Perform the troubleshooting of the engine coolant temperature sensor (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures, Diagnosis Code No. P0117: Engine Coolant Temperature Sensor Circuit Low Input ).
 
STEP 12. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position (But do not start the engine).
(2) Check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 434: Vehicle Consumption Current
OK:
  • When the headlamp is lit, the numerical value should increase.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 13.
Replace the battery current sensor.
 
STEP 13. Make certain the check result
Check the following items.
  • After a malfunction occurs, the negative (-) cable is disconnected from the battery once.
  • After a malfunction occurs, the connector is disconnected from the engine-ECU once.
  • The odometer shown on the combination meter is beyond 262,140 km.
noteIf the situation falls under any of the following items, go to "YES" whether or not the check result in Step 2.
Is the check result in Step 2 other than "0 km"?
Go to Step 14.
Go to Step 15.
 
STEP 14. Judge the battery life
Judge the battery life (Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery, On-vehicle Service, Battery Life Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 15.
Replace the battery.
 
STEP 15. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 12: Idle Stop enable(A/C ECU) <Vehicles with auto A/C>
  • Item No. 13: Idle Stop enable(ENG ECU)
  • Item No. 46: Idle Stop enable(T/F ECU) <4WD>
OK: "Enable" is displayed
Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 16.
NO <"Disable" is displayed in item No. 12> : It is estimated to be the output of the auto stop prohibition signal of A/C-ECU. Recheck the auto stop prohibition signal of the A/C-ECU.
NO <"Disable" is displayed in item No. 13> : It is estimated to be the output of the auto stop prohibition signal of engine-ECU. Recheck the auto stop prohibition signal of the engine-ECU.
NO <"Disable" is displayed in item No. 46> : It is estimated to be the output of the auto stop prohibition signal of transfer-ECU. Recheck the auto stop prohibition signal of the transfer-ECU.
 
STEP 16. Check of short to body earth in NTSW line between starter relay connector and engine-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 17.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 17. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > AS&G SYSTEM ABNORMAL (AUTO STOP NOT CARRIED OUT)<A/T>
Inspection Procedure 5: AS&G System Abnormal (Auto Stop Not Carried Out) <A/T>
 
 
cautionIf the following services are performed, the backup data should be deleted. Do not perform these services without carrying out the check described in Step 2.
  • In case the cable is disconnected from the battery terminal.
  • In case the connector is disconnected from the engine-ECU.
 
 
FUNCTION
If the specified conditions are satisfied, the AS&G-ECU should send the engine stop request signal to the engine-ECU via CAN bus line. When receiving the signal, the engine-ECU should stop the engine.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure could possibly be caused by the failed AS&G system. The AS&G-ECU, however, can possibly prohibit the auto stop, depending on the vehicle status or the ambient conditions.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Deteriorated battery.
  • Failed AS&G system.
  • Failed diesel fuel system.
  • Failed A/T system.
  • Failed ASTC system.
  • Short circuit in starter active signal circuit, or loose connector contact.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Confirm the vehicle status and the ambient conditions
Confirm the vehicle status or the ambient conditions to check whether the auto stop should be carried out or not (Refer to ).
Are the conditions for prohibiting the auto stop satisfied?
Check end.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check for data list of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 435: Last Battery Deteriorated ODO
  • Item No. 436: 2nd Last Batt. Deteriorated ODO
  • Item No. 437: 3rd Last Batt. Deteriorated ODO
OK: 0 km (Ignition switch: ON)
Are the all items displayed as "0 km"?
Go to Step 3.
Write the check result. Then go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code is set in the following ECUs.
  • AS&G-ECU
  • Engine-ECU
  • Transfer-ECU <4WD>
  • A/T-ECU
  • ASTC-ECU
  • Combination meter
  • ETACS-ECU
  • A/C-ECU <Vehicles with auto A/C>
Is any diagnosis code set?
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the AS&G-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the AS&G-ECU (Refer to ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the transfer-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 22A - Troubleshooting <V6M5A>, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the A/T-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 23C - Troubleshooting <A/T>, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the ASTC-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the combination meter> : Perform the troubleshooting of the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the A/C-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the A/C-ECU (Refer to GROUP 55B - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 11: ENG ECU AS&G system failure
  • Item No. 38: T/M ECU AS&G system failure
  • Item No. 39: A.S.C. ECU AS&G system failure
OK: OFF (Ignition switch: "ON" position)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.

NO <The display status "ON" to item No. 38> : Perform the troubleshooting of the transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 23C - Troubleshooting <A/T>, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
NO <The display status "ON" to item No. 39> : Perform the troubleshooting of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 12: Idle Stop enable(A/C ECU) <Vehicles with auto A/C>
  • Item No. 13: Idle Stop enable(ENG ECU)
  • Item No. 36: Idle Stop enable(T/M ECU)
  • Item No. 37: Idle Stop enable(A.S.C. ECU)
  • Item No. 46: Idle Stop enable(T/F ECU) <4WD>
OK: The display status "Enable"
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
NO <"Disable" is displayed in item No. 12> : It is estimated to be the output of the auto stop prohibition signal of A/C-ECU. Recheck the auto stop prohibition signal of A/C ECU.
NO <"Disable" is displayed in item No. 13> : It is estimated to be the output of the auto stop prohibition signal of engine-ECU. Go to Step 16.
NO <"Disable" is displayed in item No. 36> : It is estimated to be the output of the auto stop prohibition signal of A/T-ECU. Perform the troubleshooting of the transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 23C - Troubleshooting <A/T>, Diagnosis Code Chart )
NO <"Disable" is displayed in item No. 37> : It is estimated to be the output of the auto stop prohibition signal of ASTC-ECU. Go to Step 6.
NO <"Disable" is displayed in item No. 46> : It is estimated to be the output of the auto stop prohibition signal of transfer-ECU. Recheck the auto stop prohibition signal of the transfer-ECU.
 
STEP 6. Check the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) part number
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 26.
Replace the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU).

  • Not fastened (Driver’s seat belt: Not fastened)
noteIf the driver’s seat belt is unfastened, the AS&G display screen in the combination meter should blink.

STEP 15. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the ASTC-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 05: Master cylinder pressure
OK:
  • Increases by the amount of the brake pedal depression (The brake pedal is depressed).
  • -3 to 3 bar (The brake pedal is released).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 16.
Perform the troubleshooting of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures, Diagnosis Code No. C121D: Master Cylinder Pressure Sensor Malfunction ).

  • Item No. 17: Vehicle speed
Is the check result normal?

STEP 17. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 44: G sensor signal(+:decel,-:accel)
OK:
  • -0.04 to 0.04 m/s2 (Stops the vehicle in a horizontal state).
  • The value changes in the range between -1 to 1 m/s2 (When driving).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 18.

  • 98% or more (Depress the accelerator pedal fully).
Is the check result normal?

Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 14: Brake Vacuum sensor

Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 20.
Check the brake vacuum sensor circuit (Refer to ).

Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position (But do not start the engine).
(2) Check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 434: Vehicle Consumption Current
OK:
  • When the headlamp is lit, the numerical value should increase.
Is the check result normal?

Replace the battery current sensor.

  • After a malfunction occurs, the negative (-) cable is disconnected from the battery once.
  • After a malfunction occurs, the connector is disconnected from the engine-ECU once.
  • The odometer shown on the combination meter is beyond 262,140 km.
noteIf the situation falls under any of the following items, go to "YES" whether or not the check result in Step 2.

Go to Step 24.
Go to Step 26.
