Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > AS&G SYSTEM ABNORMAL (AUTO START NOT CARRIED OUT)<M/T>
Inspection Procedure 6: AS&G System Abnormal (Auto Start Not Carried Out) <M/T>
 
 
cautionIf the following motions are carried out during the auto stop even one time, the AS&G-ECU blinks the AS&G display screen in the combination meter and prohibits the auto start. Even if trying to return to the previous status after that, the auto start is prohibited. When restarted, the engine must be started by the key.
  • In case the hood is opened
  • In case the driver's seat belt is unfastened
  • In case the driver's door is opened
 
 
FUNCTION
When the driver depresses the clutch pedal during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should send the engine start request signal to the engine-ECU via CAN bus line. When receiving the signal, the engine-ECU should start the engine.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure could possibly be caused by the failed AS&G system. The AS&G-ECU, however, can possibly prohibit the auto start, depending on the vehicle status or the ambient conditions.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed AS&G-ECU system.
  • Failed diesel fuel system.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Confirm the vehicle status and the ambient conditions
Confirm the vehicle status or the ambient conditions to check whether the auto start should be carried out or not (Refer to ).
Are the conditions for prohibiting the auto start satisfied?
Check end.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Refer to Diagnosis Code Chart .
Go to Step 3
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the diesel fuel system.
Is any diagnosis code set in the diesel fuel system?
Perform the troubleshooting of the diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: Seat belt fasten status
OK:
  • Fastened (Driver’s seat belt: Fastened)
  • Not fastened (Driver’s seat belt: Not fastened)
noteIf the driver’s seat belt is unfastened, the AS&G display screen in the combination meter should blink.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Perform the troubleshooting of the seat belt reminder function circuit (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Symptom Procedures, Inspection Procedure 14: Seat Belt Reminder Function Does Not Work Normally ).
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 35: Driver's side door SW
OK:
  • Open (Driver's side door: Opened)
  • Close (Driver's side door: Closed)
noteIf the driver's side door is opened, the AS&G display in the combination meter should blink.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Check the driver's side door switch circuit [Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Input Signal Procedures, Inspection Procedure 5: The Front Door Switch (Driver’s Side) Signal is Not Received ].
 
STEP 6. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 4: Engine Hood
OK:
  • Close (Hood: Closed)
  • Open (Hood: Opened)
noteIf the hood is opened, the AS&G display screen in the combination meter should blink.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Perform the troubleshooting of the hood latch switch circuit (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Input Signal Procedures, Inspection Procedure 1: The hood latch switch signal is not received ).
 
STEP 7. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 6: Clutch SW Upper
  • Item No. 7: Clutch SW Bottom
  • Item No. 8: Neutral Position SW
Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 8.
Perform the troubleshooting for the item that has an abnormal value (Refer to ).
 
STEP 8. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 18: Accelerator Pedal Position
OK:
  • 0% (Release the accelerator pedal).
  • 98% or more (Depress the accelerator pedal fully).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Perform the troubleshooting of the accelerator pedal position sensor [Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures, Diagnosis Code No. P2138: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Main and Sub) Range/Performance Problem ].
 
STEP 9. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > AS&G SYSTEM ABNORMAL (AUTO START NOT CARRIED OUT)<A/T>
Inspection Procedure 6: AS&G System Abnormal (Auto Start Not Carried Out) <A/T>
 
 
cautionIf the following motions are carried out during the auto stop even one time, the AS&G-ECU blinks the AS&G display screen in the combination meter and prohibits the auto start. Even if trying to return to the previous status after that, the auto start is prohibited. When restarted, the engine must be started by the key.
  • In case the hood is opened
 
 
FUNCTION
When the driver depresses the brake pedal during the auto stop, the AS&G-ECU should send the engine start request signal to the engine-ECU via CAN bus line. When receiving the signal, the engine-ECU should start the engine.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure could possibly be caused by the failed AS&G system. The AS&G-ECU, however, can possibly prohibit the auto start, depending on the vehicle status or the ambient conditions.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed AS&G-ECU system.
  • Failed diesel fuel system.
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Confirm the vehicle status and the ambient conditions
Confirm the vehicle status or the ambient conditions to check whether the auto start should be carried out or not (Refer to ).
Are the conditions for prohibiting the auto start satisfied?
Check end.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Refer to Diagnosis Code Chart .
Go to Step 3
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the diesel fuel system.
Is any diagnosis code set in the diesel fuel system?
Perform the troubleshooting of the diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 4: Engine Hood
OK:
  • Close (Hood: Closed)
  • Open (Hood: Opened)
noteIf the hood is opened, the AS&G display screen in the combination meter should blink.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Perform the troubleshooting of the hood latch switch circuit (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Input Signal Procedures, Inspection Procedure 1: The hood latch switch signal is not received ).
 
STEP 5. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > AS&G SYSTEM ABNORMAL (AUTO START CARRIED OUT UNDER CONDITION THAT CLUTCH PEDAL NOT OPERATED)<M/T>
Inspection Procedure 7: AS&G System Abnormal (Auto Start Carried Out Under Condition That Clutch Pedal Not Operated) <M/T>
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
When the specified conditions are satisfied, the AS&G-ECU should send the engine start request signal to the engine-ECU via CAN bus line despite the driver's determination. When receiving the signal, the engine-ECU should start the engine.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure could possibly be caused by the failed AS&G system. The AS&G-ECU, however, can possibly carry out the forced auto start, depending on the vehicle status or the ambient conditions.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed AS&G-ECU system.
  • Failed diesel fuel system.
  • Failed automatic air conditioner system. <Vehicles with auto A/C>
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Confirm the vehicle status and the ambient conditions
Confirm the vehicle status or the ambient conditions to check whether the forced auto start should be carried out or not (Refer to ).
Are the conditions for carrying out the forced auto start satisfied?
Check end.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Refer to Diagnosis Code Chart .
Go to Step 3
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the diesel fuel system.
Is any diagnosis code set in the diesel fuel system?
Perform the troubleshooting of the diesel fuel system (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code ).
NO <Vehicles without auto A/C> : Go to Step 5.
NO <Vehicles with auto A/C> : Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check for diagnosis code of other system <Vehicles with auto A/C>
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the automatic air conditioner system.
Is any diagnosis code set in the automatic air conditioner system?
Perform the troubleshooting of the automatic air conditioner system (Refer to GROUP 55B - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 6: Clutch SW Upper
  • Item No. 7: Clutch SW Bottom
  • Item No. 16: Neutral Position SW
Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 6.
Perform the troubleshooting for the item that has an abnormal value (Refer to ).
 
STEP 6. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 17: Vehicle speed
OK: 0 km/h (Vehicle: Stopped)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Perform the troubleshooting of diagnosis code No. U1201: Vehicle Speed Signal Error (Refer to ).
 
STEP 7. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the engine-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 7: Engine coolant TEMP. sensor
OK:
  • Engine cold state: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
  • Engine hot state: At 80 to 120°C
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Perform the troubleshooting of the engine coolant temperature sensor (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures, Diagnosis Code No. P0117: Engine Coolant Temperature Sensor Circuit Low Input ).
 
STEP 8. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > AS&G SYSTEM ABNORMAL (AUTO START CARRIED OUT UNDER CONDITION THAT BRAKE PEDAL OPERATED)<A/T>
Inspection Procedure 8: AS&G System Abnormal (Auto Start Carried Out Under Condition That Brake Pedal is Operated) <A/T>
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
When the specified conditions are satisfied, the AS&G-ECU should send the engine start request signal to the engine-ECU via CAN bus line despite the driver's determination. When receiving the signal, the engine-ECU should start the engine.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure could possibly be caused by the failed AS&G system. The AS&G-ECU, however, can possibly carry out the forced auto start, depending on the vehicle status or the ambient conditions.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed AS&G-ECU system.
  • Failed diesel fuel system.
  • Failed A/T system.
  • Failed ASTC system.
  • Failed automatic air conditioner system. <Vehicles with auto A/C>
  • Failed AS&G-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Confirm the vehicle status and the ambient conditions
Confirm the vehicle status or the ambient conditions to check whether the forced auto start should be carried out or not (Refer to ).
Are the conditions for carrying out the forced auto start satisfied?
Check end.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code is set in the following ECUs.
  • AS&G-ECU
  • Engine-ECU
  • A/T-ECU
  • ASTC-ECU
  • A/C-ECU <Vehicles with auto A/C>
Is any diagnosis code set?
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the AS&G-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the AS&G-ECU (Refer to ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the A/T-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 23C - Troubleshooting <A/T>, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the ASTC-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
YES <Diagnosis code is set in the A/C-ECU> : Perform the troubleshooting of the A/C-ECU (Refer to GROUP 55B - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 17: Vehicle speed
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Perform the troubleshooting of the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures, Diagnosis Code No. P0500: Vehicle Speed Signal Low Input ).
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 44: G sensor signal(+:decel,-:accel)
OK:
  • -0.04 to 0.04 m/s2 (Stops the vehicle in a horizontal state).
  • The value changes in the range between -1 to 1 m/s2 (When driving).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Perform the troubleshooting of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures, Diagnosis Code No. C1377: G and Yaw Rate Sensor Error ).
 
STEP 5. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the ASTC-ECU data list (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 05: Master cylinder pressure
OK:
  • Increases by the amount of the brake pedal depression (The brake pedal is depressed).
  • -3 to 3 bar (The brake pedal is released).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Perform the troubleshooting of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures, Diagnosis Code No. C121D: Master Cylinder Pressure Sensor Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 18: Accelerator Pedal Position
OK:
  • 0% (Release the accelerator pedal).
  • 98% or more (Depress the accelerator pedal fully).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Perform the troubleshooting of the accelerator pedal position sensor [Refer to GROUP 13A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Procedures, Diagnosis Code No. P2138: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Main and Sub) Range/Performance Problem ].
 
STEP 7. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 14: Brake Vacuum sensor
OK: Increases whenever the brake pedal is depressed (vacuum pressure is reduced) (When depress the brake pedal several times).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Check the brake vacuum sensor circuit (Refer to ).
 
STEP 8. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > AS&G-ECU POWER SUPPLY, IGNITION SWITCH-IG1 SYSTEM
Inspection Procedure 10: AS&G-ECU Power Supply, Ignition Switch-IG1 System
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The power voltage is supplied to the AS&G-ECU connector terminal BAT1 from the engine control relay connector terminal.
  • The ignition switch-IG1 signal is inputted into the AS&G-ECU connector terminal IGN from the ignition switch (IG1) connector terminal <vehicles without KOS> or IG1 relay connector terminal <vehicles with KOS>.
  • The AS&G-ECU connector terminal GND is earthed to the vehicle body.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in engine control relay circuit, or loose connector contact
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in ignition switch-IG1 circuit, or loose connector contact <vehicles without KOS>
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in IG1 relay circuit, or loose connector contact <vehicles with KOS>
  • Open circuit or harness damage in AS&G-ECU earth circuit, or loose connector contact
  • Failed AS&G-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU BAT1 line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to body earth and open circuit in BAT1 line between engine control relay connector and AS&G-ECU connector.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at AS&G-ECU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal AS&G-ECU IGN line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
YES <Vehicles without KOS> : Go to Step 6.
YES <Vehicles with KOS> : Go to Step 7.
NO <Vehicles without KOS> : Go to Step 3.
NO <Vehicles with KOS> : Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 3. Check ignition switch itself <Vehicles without KOS>
Check ignition switch itself (Refer to GROUP 54A - Ignition switch, Inspection, Ignition Switch Check ).
Is the check result normal?
  • Repair or replace the connector(s), or check and repair the harness of short to body earth, and open circuit in IGN line between ignition switch connector and AS&G-ECU connector.
Replace the ignition switch.
 
STEP 4. Check IG1 relay itself <Vehicles with KOS>
Check IG1 relay itself (Refer to GROUP 42B - On-vehicle Service, Relay Inspection ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the IG1 relay.
 
STEP 5. Check of short to earth, and open circuit in IG1 line between IG1 relay connector and AS&G-ECU connector <Vehicles with KOS>
Is the check result normal?
Perform the troubleshooting of the KOS&OSS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 42B - Troubleshooting, Symptom Chart ).
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 6. Check of harness damage in IGN line between ignition switch connector and AS&G-ECU connector <Vehicles without KOS>
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 7. Check of harness damage in IGN line between IG1 relay connector and AS&G-ECU connector <Vehicles with KOS>
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 8. Perform resistance measurement at AS&G-ECU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal AS&G-ECU GND line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of open circuit and harness damage in GND line between AS&G-ECU connector and body earth.
 
STEP 9. Check of harness damage in BAT1 line between engine control relay connector and AS&G-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 10. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the AS&G-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > DC/DC CONVERTER (CONTROL SYSTEM) POWER SUPPLY CIRCUIT<A/T>
Inspection Procedure 11: DC/DC Converter (Control System) Power Supply Circuit <A/T>
 
 
cautionEven when diagnosis code No. B1351 or B1352 is set, do not conclude as a DC/DC converter (control system) or AS&G-ECU error, and be sure to check the DC/DC converter (control system) power supply circuit.
 
 
OPERATION
  • The power voltage is supplied to the DC/DC converter (control system) connector terminal PWR from the fusible link.
  • The ignition switch-IG1 signal is inputted into the DC/DC converter (control system) connector terminal IGN from the ignition switch (IG1) connector terminal <vehicles without KOS> or IG1 relay connector terminal. <vehicles with KOS>
  • The DC/DC converter (control system) connector terminal GND is earthed to the vehicle body.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in power supply circuit, or loose connector contact.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in ignition switch-IG1 circuit, or loose connector contact. <vehicles without KOS>
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in IG1 relay circuit, or loose connector contact. <vehicles with KOS>
  • Open circuit or harness damage in DC/DC converter (control system) earth circuit, or loose connector contact.
  • Failed DC/DC converter (control system).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (control system) connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (control system) PWR line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of short to body earth and open circuit in PWR line between fusible link and DC/DC converter (control system) connector.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at DC/DC converter (control system) connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DC/DC converter (control system) IGN line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
YES <Vehicles without KOS> : Go to Step 6.
YES <Vehicles with KOS> : Go to Step 7.
NO <Vehicles without KOS> : Go to Step 3.
NO <Vehicles with KOS> : Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 3. Check ignition switch itself <Vehicles without KOS>
Check ignition switch itself (Refer to GROUP 54A - Ignition switch, Inspection, Ignition Switch Check ).
Is the check result normal?
  • Repair or replace the connector(s), or check and repair the harness of short to body earth, and open circuit in IGN line between ignition switch connector and DC/DC converter (control system) connector.
Replace the ignition switch.
 
STEP 4. Check IG1 relay itself <Vehicles with KOS>
Check IG1 relay itself (Refer to GROUP 42B - On-vehicle Service, Relay Inspection ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the IG1 relay.
 
STEP 5. Check of short to earth, and open circuit in IG1 line between IG1 relay connector and DC/DC converter (control system) connector <Vehicles with KOS>
Is the check result normal?
Perform the troubleshooting of the KOS&OSS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 42B - Troubleshooting, Symptom Chart ).
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 6. Check of harness damage in IGN line between ignition switch connector and DC/DC converter (control system) connector <Vehicles without KOS>
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 7. Check of harness damage in IGN line between IG1 relay connector and DC/DC converter (control system) connector <Vehicles with KOS>
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 8. Perform resistance measurement at DC/DC converter (control system) connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal DC/DC converter (control system) GND line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
  • Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of open circuit and harness damage in GND line between DC/DC converter (control system) connector and body earth.
 
STEP 9. Check of harness damage in PWR line between fusible link and DC/DC converter (control system) connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness.
 
STEP 10. Check the trouble symptom
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Replace the DC/DC converter (control system).
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > DATA LIST REFERENCE TABLE
DATA LIST REFERENCE TABLE
 
 
Item No.Inspection item
[M.U.T.-III item name]
Inspection conditionNormal condition
1Starter switch (Ignition switch-ST)
[Starter SW]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionOFF
Ignition switch: "ST" positionON
2Ignition switch-IG
[IG SW]
Ignition switch: Other than "ON" positionOFF
Ignition switch: "ON" positionON
4Hood
[Engine Hood]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionHood: CloseClose
Hood: OpenOpen
5AS&G OFF switch
[AS&G OFF SW]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionAS&G OFF switch: ReleasedOFF
AS&G OFF switch: PressedON (only while the switch is pressed)
6Clutch switch (upper) <M/T>
[Clutch SW Upper]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionClutch pedal: ReleasedOFF
Clutch pedal: DepressedON
7Clutch interlock switch (bottom) <M/T>
[Clutch SW Bottom]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionClutch pedal: ReleasedOFF
Clutch pedal: Fully depressedON
8Neutral position switch <M/T>
[Neutral Position SW]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionGearshift lever position: Except neutralOFF
Gearshift lever position: NeutralON
9DC/DC converter (entertainment system) diagnostic signal*1
[DC-DC OUT (Input)]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionON
10Seat belt fasten status*2
[Seat Belt Fasten Status]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionDo not fasten the driver’s seat belt.Not Fastened
Fasten the driver's seat beltFastened
11Engine-ECU AS&G system failure*3
[ENG ECU AS&G system failure]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionOFF
14Brake vacuum sensor
[Brake Vacuum sensor]
Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
  • Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position after the engine stops from the idling
  • Depress the brake pedal several times
Increases whenever the brake pedal is depressed. (vacuum pressure is reduced)
15Ambient temperature
[Air Temperature]
Ignition switch: "ON" position or engine runningAmbient temperature: -20°C-20°C
Ambient temperature: 0°C0°C
Ambient temperature: 20°C20°C
Ambient temperature: 40°C40°C
Ambient temperature: 80°C80°C
16Atmospheric pressure
[Atmospheric pressure]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionAltitude: 0 m101 kPa
Altitude: 600 m95 kPa
Altitude: 1,200 m88 kPa
Altitude: 1,800 m81 kPa
17Vehicle speed
[Vehicle speed]
Running at 40 km/hApproximately 40 km/h
18Accelerator pedal position
[Accelerator Pedal Position]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionRelease the accelerator pedal0%
Depress the accelerator pedalIncreases in response to the accelerator pedal depression stroke
Depress the accelerator pedal fully98% or more
19Starter relay (output) <M/T>
[Starter Relay (Output)]
Except auto start statusOFF
At auto startON
20Starter cut relay (output) <M/T>
[Starter Cut Relay (Output)]
Engine: Cranking (includes the cranking of auto start status)OFF
Ignition switch: "ON" position (includes auto stop status)ON
21DC/DC converter (entertainment system) control signal
[DC-DC IN (Output)]
Change vehicle status to auto stop status.*4Clutch pedal: Depressed (this allows the engine to achieve the auto start status)At auto start, display status "OFF" is changed to "ON" for a second.
22Idle stop enable (vehicle speed)
[Idle Stop enable(Vehicle Speed)]
Drive the vehicle after the engine start, including the engine start of the auto start.When vehicle speed exceeds 5 km/h, display status "Disable" should be changed to "Enable"
23Idle stop flag
[Idle Stop Flag]
Except auto stop statusOFF
Change vehicle status to auto stop status.*4ON
24AS&G OFF display screen (output)*5
[AS&G OFF Indicator (Output)]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionFrom the AS&G system OFF status, press the AS&G OFF switch to turn ON the AS&G systemTurn off
Press the AS&G OFF switch to turn OFF the AS&G systemTurn on
25AS&G display screen (output)
[AS&G Indicator (Output)]
During idling and driving (The auto stop operation standby incomplete)Turn off
During idling and driving (The auto stop operation standby complete)*4Turn on
  • When the hood is opened
or
  • When the driver’s seat belt is not fastened
or
  • When the driver’s side front door is opened
or
  • During auto stop, the gearshift lever position is in other than neutral position
Turn on <=> Turn off (changes repeatedly)
27DC/DC converter (control system) (Input) *1 <A/T>
[DC-DC OUT for powertrain (Input)]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionOFF
29Parking brake switch <A/T>
[Parking brake SW]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionParking brake: ONON
Parking brake: OFFOFF
30Stop lamp switch <A/T>
[Brake lamp SW]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionDepressed the brake pedal.ON
Released the brake pedal.OFF
31A/T clutch status <A/T>
[Clutch status]
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • selector lever: "P" or "N" position
Open
  • Engine: Idle operation
  • selector lever: "D" or "R" position
Engage
33Brake hold signal (CAN) <A/T>
[Brake hold signal (CAN)]
Change vehicle status to auto stop status.*4ON
Except auto stop status.OFF
34Engine status <A/T>
[Engine status]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionStall
Engine: Cranking (includes the cranking of auto start status)Cranking
Engine: Idle operationRun
35Driver's side door switch
[Driver's side door SW]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionDriver's side door: Close Close
Driver's side door: Open Open
38A/T-ECU AS&G system failure*6 <A/T>
[T/M ECU AS&G system failure]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionOFF
39ASTC-ECU AS&G system failure*7 <A/T>
[A.S.C. ECU AS&G system failure]
Ignition switch: "ON" positionOFF
41DC/DC converter (control system) (Output) <A/T>
[DC-DC IN for powertrain (Output)]
Change vehicle status to auto stop status.*4Brake pedal: Depressed (this allows the engine to achieve the auto start status)At auto start, display status "OFF" is changed to "ON" for a second.
42Starter relay (Output) <A/T>
[Starter relay for AS&G (Output)]
Change vehicle status to auto stop status.*4Brake pedal: Depressed (this allows the engine to achieve the auto start status)At auto start, display status "OFF" is changed to "ON" for a second.
44G sensor signal
[G sensor signal(+:decel,-:accel)]
Stops the vehicle in a horizontal state-0.04 to 0.04 m/s2
When drivingThe value changes in the range between -1 to 1 m/s2
45Brake booster pressure sensor <A/T>
[Brake booster PRS.signal(CAN)]
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Depress the brake pedal several times.
The more frequently the brake pedal is depressed, the more the voltage rises.
46Idle stop enable (transfer-ECU)
[Idle Stop enable(T/F ECU)]
When auto stop prohibition signal is not received from transfer-ECUEnable
When auto stop prohibition signal is received from transfer-ECU*8Disable
note
  • *1: If the DC/DC converter body or the DC/DC converter circuit is abnormal, "OFF" or "Failure" should be shown.
  • *2: If the combination meter detects the seat belt malfunction, "Fault" should be shown. If the communication error occurs between the ETACS-ECU and the combination meter, "SNA" should be shown.
  • *3: If the engine control system is abnormal, "ON" should be shown.
  • *4: The conditions for changing the vehicle status to the auto stop status are as shown below:
    • More than 3 minutes have passed since the engine was started
    • AS&G system: ON
    • Hood: Close
    • Fasten the driver’s seat belt
    • Lamps and all accessories: OFF
    • Engine: After warm-up
    • Ambient temperature: more than 0°C
    • AS&G system is normal
    • Stop the vehicle after driving at 5 km/h or more. Then place the gearshift lever in the neutral position. <M/T>
    • Stop the vehicle after driving at 5 km/h or more. Then place the selector lever in the "D" position. <A/T>
    • Clutch pedal: Released <M/T>
    • Brake pedal: Depress <A/T>
  • *5: If the AS&G system is abnormal, "Turn on" and "Turn off" should repeatedly and alternately stay on the display.
  • *6: If the A/T system is abnormal, "ON" should be shown.
  • *7: If the ASTC system is abnormal, "ON" should be shown.
  • *8: See the conditions of the auto stop prohibition signal for the transfer-ECU. <4WD>
 
 
ASG-ECU monitoring items
  • This monitor item includes useful items for understanding the AS&G system controlled by the ASG-ECU.
  • It is hard to show the definite specification of each item. Therefore, this document describes the check conditions, display range, and behaviour of numeric values only.
Item No.Inspection item
[M.U.T.-III display]
M.U.T.-III display descriptionsStandards at each checkDisplay range, and numeric value
12Idle stop enable (A/C-ECU) <Vehicles with auto A/C>
[Idle Stop enable(A/C ECU)]
  • Indicates the state of the auto stop prohibition signal from A/C-ECU. When the signal is received, "Disable" should be displayed.
  • If this happens, check the A/C-ECU permissions.
After starting the engineEnable/Disable
13Idle stop enable (engine-ECU)
[Idle Stop enable(ENG ECU)]
  • Indicates the state of the auto stop prohibition signal from engine-ECU. When the signal is received, "Disable" should be displayed.
  • If this happens, check the engine-ECU permissions.
After starting the engineEnable/Disable
26Idle stop disable timer
[Idle Stop Disable Timer]
After the key/engine switch is used to start the engine, the AS&G-ECU counts down from 30 seconds. When the AS&G-ECU counts down to zero, a "0 sec" should stay on the display.After starting the engine30 to 0 sec
36Idle stop enable (A/T-ECU) <A/T>
[Idle Stop enable(T/M ECU)]
  • Indicates the state of the auto stop prohibition signal from A/T-ECU. When the signal is received, "Disable" should be displayed.
  • If this happens, check the A/T-ECU permissions.
After starting the engineEnable/Disable
37Idle stop enable (ASTC-ECU) <A/T>
[Idle Stop enable(A.S.C. ECU)]
  • Indicates the state of the auto stop prohibition signal from ASTC-ECU. When the signal is received, "Disable" should be displayed.
  • If this happens, check the ASTC-ECU permissions.
After starting the engineEnable/Disable
43Brake hold request mode flag <A/T>
[Brake hold request mode flag]
Indicates the status of the brake hold mode sent to the ASTC-ECU.Change vehicle status to auto stop status.*ON
note
  • *: The conditions for changing the vehicle status to the auto stop status are as shown below:
    • More than 3 minutes have passed since the engine was started.
    • AS&G system: ON
    • Hood: Close
    • Fasten the driver’s seat belt.
    • Lamps and all accessories: OFF
    • Engine: After warm-up
    • Ambient temperature: more than 0°C
    • AS&G system is normal.
    • Stop the vehicle after driving at 5 km/h or more. Then place the selector lever in the "D" position.
    • Brake pedal: Depress
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > CHECK AT THE ECU TERMINALS
CHECK AT THE ECU TERMINALS
 
 
TERMINAL VOLTAGE CHECK CHART
1. Connect a needle-nosed wire probe to a voltmeter probe.
2.
cautionShort-circuiting the positive (+) probe between a connector terminal and earth could damage the vehicle wiring, the sensor, AS&G-ECU or all of them. Be careful to prevent this!
Insert the needle-nosed wire probe into each of the AS&G-ECU connector terminals from the wire side, and measure the voltage while referring to the check chart.
note
  • Make the voltage measurement with the AS&G-ECU connector connected.
  • You may find it convenient to pull out the AS&G-ECU to make it easier to reach the connector terminals.
  • The chart procedures do not have the particular order.
3. If voltmeter shows any division from standard value, check the corresponding sensor, actuator and related electrical wiring, then repair or replace.
4. After repair or replacement, recheck with the voltmeter to confirm that the repair has corrected the problem.
AS&G-ECU Connector Terminal Arrangement
Terminal No.Terminal codeInspection itemCheck condition (Engine condition)Normal condition
4DCDPDC/DC converter (control system) diagnostic signal <A/T>Ignition switch: "ON" position0.8 V or less
7BVS5Power supply voltage applied to brake vacuum sensorIgnition switch: "ON" position4.9 to 5.1 V
9BVSBrake vacuum sensorEngine: Idle operation after warm-up
  • Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position after the engine stops from the idling
  • Depress the brake pedal several times
Whenever brake pedal is depressed, voltage increases.
10DCCPDC/DC converter (control system) control signal <A/T>Ignition switch: "ON" position1 V or less
Change vehicle status to auto stop status.*Brake pedal: Depressed (this allows the engine to achieve the auto start status)At auto start, voltage increases for a second.
11DCCTDC/DC converter (entertainment system) control signalIgnition switch: "ON" position1 V or less
Change vehicle status to auto stop status.*Clutch pedal: Depressed (this allows the engine to achieve the auto start status)At auto start, voltage increases for a second.
13BAT1Power supplyIgnition switch: "ON" positionSystem voltage
17DCDADC/DC converter (entertainment system) diagnostic signalIgnition switch: "ON" position0.8 V or less
19CLT1Clutch switch <M/T>Ignition switch: "ON" positionClutch pedal: Depressed1 V or less
Clutch pedal: ReleasedSystem voltage
23STRLStarter relayIgnition switch: "ON" position1 V or less
Engine: CrankingSystem voltage
25STCRStarter cut relay <M/T>Ignition switch: "ON" position1 V or less
Engine: CrankingSystem voltage
STRStarter relay <A/T>Ignition switch: "ON" position1 V or less
Change vehicle status to auto stop status.*Brake pedal: Depressed (this allows the engine to achieve the auto start status)The system voltage while the engine is cranking.
27ASGMAS&G OFF switchIgnition switch: "ON" positionAS&G OFF switch: PressedSystem voltage (only while the switch is pressed)
AS&G OFF switch: Released1 V or less
28NTSWNeutral position switch <M/T>Ignition switch: "ON" positionGearshift lever position: NeutralSystem voltage
Gearshift lever position: Except neutral1 V or less
29CLTRClutch interlock switch <M/T>Ignition switch: "ON" positionClutch pedal: Fully depressedSystem voltage
Clutch pedal: Released1 V or less
30IGNIgnition switch-IGIgnition switch: "ON" positionSystem voltage
31STIgnition switch-STEngine: CrankingSystem voltage
note*: The conditions for changing the vehicle status to the auto stop status are as shown below:
  • More than 3 minutes have passed since the engine was started
  • AS&G system: ON
  • Hood: Close
  • Fasten the driver's seat belt
  • Lamps and all accessories: OFF
  • Engine: After warm-up
  • Ambient temperature: more than 0°C
  • AS&G system is normal
  • Stop the vehicle after driving at 5 km/h or more. Then place the gearshift lever in the neutral position. <M/T>
  • Stop the vehicle after driving at 5 km/h or more. Then place the selector lever in the "D" position. <A/T>
  • Clutch pedal: Released <M/T>
  • Brake pedal: Depress <A/T>
 
 
CHECK CHART FOR RESISTANCE AND CONTINUITY BETWEEN TERMINALS
1. Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
2. Disconnect the AS&G-ECU connector.
3.
cautionIf the terminals that should be checked are mistaken, or if connector terminals are not correctly shorted to earth, damage may be caused to the vehicle wiring, sensors, AS&G-ECU and/or ohmmeter.
Be careful to prevent this!
Measure the resistance and check for continuity between the terminals of the AS&G-ECU harness-side connector while referring to the check chart.
noteWhen measuring resistance and checking continuity, a harness for checking contact pin pressure should be used instead of inserting a test probe.
4. If the ohmmeter shows any deviation from the standard value, check the corresponding sensor, actuator and related electrical wiring, and the repair or replace.
5. After repair or replacement, recheck with the ohmmeter to confirm that the repair or replacement has corrected the problem.
AS&G-ECU Harness Side Connector Terminal Arrangement
Terminal No.Inspection itemNormal condition (Check condition)
15 to body earthAS&G-ECU earthContinuity (2 Ω or less)
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > ON-VEHICLE SERVICE > COMPONENT LOCATION
COMPONENT LOCATION
NameSymbolNameSymbol
AS&G-ECU (The barometric pressure sensor is incorporated in the ECU)EClutch monitoring switch <M/T>J
AS&G display screenFDC/DC converter (control system) <A/T>G
AS&G OFF display screenFDC/DC converter (entertainment system)G
AS&G OFF switchHDiagnosis connectorI
Brake vacuum sensor <L.H. drive vehicles>BNeutral position switch <M/T>D
Brake vacuum sensor <R.H. drive vehicles>AStarter cut relay <M/T>C
Clutch interlock switch <M/T>JStarter relayC

17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > ON-VEHICLE SERVICE > AS&G OFF SWITCH CHECK
AS&G OFF SWITCH CHECK
1. Remove the AS&G OFF switch (Refer to ).
2. Connect an ohmmeter to the terminal No. 5 and No. 8 of the connector at the AS&G OFF switch.
3. Check the continuity status when the AS&G OFF switch is pressed and when the switch is released.
AS&G OFF switchConnector terminalsContinuity
Pressed5 to 8Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Released5 to 8No continuity
4. When other than above, replace the AS&G OFF switch.
 
17 -ENGINE AND EMISSION CONTROL > AUTO STOP&GO (AS&G) SYSTEM<4N14> > AS&G OFF SWITCH > AS&G OFF SWITCH REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
On how to remove and install the AS&G OFF switch, refer to GROUP 52A - Instrument Centre Panel Removal and Installation .

<L. H. drive vehicles>
<R.H. drive vehicles>

1.AS&G-ECU
2.Transfer-ECU <4WD>
